They got acquainted through bonds of kinship, neighborhood and friendship. They trade in various items. The women of the group are seeking their second group loan, to be used to buy soaps, shea butter, clothes, shoes, and wheat flour.

MARIAM C. intends to buy locally made soaps (Gabacourouni) from producers in the town of Fana. She sells daily in the village, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 5'000 (ca US$ 10), to be used to repay the loan, while the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy locally made soap

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Бойматова Зухро проживает в городе Худжанд. Возраст, 25 лет. Замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Образование средне - специальное, доярка. По специальности не работает. Она занимается шитьем национальных платьев и костюмов. Заказы берет на дому. В этой области уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для покупки различных тканей.
texts.en: Zuhro B. lives in the city of Khujand. She is 25 years old, married, and has one child. She has a vocational education as a milkmaid. She does not work in her profession.  She is works sewing traditional dresses and outfits. She works from home. She has been doing this for six years.  She is taking out a loan to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy different fabrics

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa A. is from the village of Binahalan, Gingoog City. She is 22 years old. Melissa is married and has two small children. To make a living, Melissa sells green and sweet bananas in the local community. Melissa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Melissa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Melissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Melissa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Melissa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve  and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Lahidou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Lahidou, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 5 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Belenikoro, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois, des habillements et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe Lahidou sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                
AMINATA T. compte acheter des chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe auprès des paysans  du village. Elle effectue ses ventes à la maison, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Lahidou group are all married and average 32 years of age and five children. Most of them live in extended traditional families in Belenikoro, a village in Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of kinship, neighborhood and friendship. They trade in firewood, charcoal, clothes, and various other products. They women of the Lahidou group are seeking their second group loan.

AMINATA T. intends to buy cartloads of firewood from farmers in the village. She sells at her home, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 25'000 (ca US$ 50) to be used to repay the loan and pay her contributions to social ceremonies, while the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie W. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 43 years old. Tessie is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Tessie sells bananas and coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Tessie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Tessie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Nietaga Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Nietaga, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Madoudiarrabougou, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la teinture, le commerce d’articles divers, des pains, des habillements et des galettes.  Les femmes du groupe Nietaga sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                               
OUMOU MADOU D. compte acheter de l’indigo et des tissus pour les tremper. Elle effectue ses travaux de teinture à l’indigo au village, et après le produit fini est vendu au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  90 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The women of the Nietaga group are all married and average 35 years of age and four children. Most of them live in extended traditional families in Madoudiarrabougou, a village in Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of kinship, neighborhood and friendship. They dye cloth and trade in various products such as bread, clothes and pancakes. The women of the Nietaga group are seeking their third group loan.

OUMOU MADOU D. intends to buy indigo and cloths to dye. She performs the dying in the village, and then sells the finished products for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 90'000 (ca US$ 180) to be used to repay the loan, while the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy indigo and cloth to dye

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is 43 years old. He has five children who are between the ages of 1 and 11 years old. Three of his children are in school while the other two are not in school yet. 

Pierre  is a bicycle mechanic and he has been one for 12 years. He is requesting a loan to buy bicycle spare parts. In the future he plans to sell bicycles.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira O. is from the village of Pedlagahan, Gingoog City. She is 44 years old. Elvira is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a mini-restaurant, serving a variety of meals like chicken and pork adobo to customers in the local community. She also sells coco and wood charcoal. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and for working capital. 

Elvira is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Elvira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi lives in Ruisi, Kartli Region. He lives with his family –his  wife, two sons and a daughter. The whole family is actively involved in the family agricultural business. They have plot of land with the area of 2 ha, where cabbages, tomatoes, barley and peach-trees are grown. The fruits and vegetables are sold on the local market. Giorgi has a tractor, which is used for tilling his plot.  The family has also four milk cows. They produce traditional Georgian cheese and sell it in Gori – a nearby town. 

Giorgi will use the loan for purchasing fertilizers and paying salaries to the workforce, who will help him cultivate the plot. After the cultivation he will sow the above mentioned vegetables. The family hopes that they will have a good harvest and will be able to save some money for their children's education and house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay salaries to the labour force.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is 26 years old.  He has two children who are 2 months and 2 years old. Augustine owns and runs a restaurant in which he sells several foods. He is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuff for his restaurant.  With the profit, he plans to add to his savings and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff to sell at his restaurant

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline V. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old. Evangeline is widowed and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline sells gasoline by the liter in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for more than 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional gallons of gasoline. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Bogigul

texts.ru: Саидова Богигул проживает в районе Дангара. Возраст, 37 лет. Вдова, имеет 4 детей. Дети учатся в средней школе. Сама Богигул занимается торговлей на рынке. Она продает детские костюмчики, курточки и носочки, то есть занимается продажей детской одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Bogigul S. lives in Dangara. She is 37 years old, a widow, a has four children. Her children go to high school. Bogigul works trading in the market. She sells children's outfits, coats, and socks.  In other words, she sells children’s wear.  She has been doing this for ten years. She is taking out a loan to buy seasonal goods.

Genalyn is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts and bananas. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Genalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Bethleem Plus Group

texts.en:
Caleb is the chairman of a Community bank named “Bethleem Plus”, composed of 10 microentrepreneurs united to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Caleb earns a living by selling apples, a business he started in 2001 with US$30 as his starting capital. He also manages a small motorcycle transport business. Caleb is seeking a loan to reinforce his working capital through an increase in his business inventory. A 33-year-old married father of a two-year-old son, Caleb is happy that he is going to be able to increase his inventory with the loan. Currently, through his sales, Caleb makes about $270 per week.

A trustworthy client of the MFI Hope DRC, having seven times received and properly repaid loans, his dream is to someday open a transportation company in Kinshasa.

loans.use: to increase store inventory in order to reinforce the working capital

texts.en: Marie Louise is 40 years old. She has four children who are ages 2 -17 years old. She owns a store in which she sells several items such as rice, sugar, etc. She has owned this store for five years. Marie Louise is requesting a loan to buy more items for her store such as rice,sugar etc to make more profits.

texts.en:
Nicanora O., from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City, is 51 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nicanora owns and operates a specialized retail store selling RTW's or ready-to-wear-clothing, sandals and shoe products from NATASHA and AVON in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 12000 PHP a month. In 2009, Nicanora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her fifth loan for 17000 PHP to purchase more t-shirts, polo shirts and blouses. Nicanora plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

loans.name: Cpkii Plus Group

texts.en:
John is the leader of the Community Bank “CPKII Plus,” which is composed of 16 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

John is 40 years old, married and the father of four children whose ages vary between 3 and 12. Three of them go to school.

He has been part of the microenterprise world since 1991. He started his business by selling duplicating paper. Today, John sells iron bars at the market in the mid west of Kinshasa. With hard work and good management, John has stabilized his business. He borrowed eight loans from the MFI HOPE DRC for business expansion and fully repaid them. 

With the next loan, John will be able to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. His business makes US $90 of profit per week. John’s ambition is to someday open a hardware shop in his area.

loans.use: to increase inventory to meet customer demand

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja comes from the village of Ruisi, Kartli Region. He is 58 years old, married and lives with his wife, son and grandson, who is two years old. 

Elguja and his wife are actively involved in agriculture. Elguja’s son works as contractor in the nation’s army. Elguja and his wife lead the family agricultural business. They have two milk cows and produce cheese, which is sold on the open market in Gori, a nearby town. Elguja’s family owns plot of land, with an area of 3 ha, where wheat, cabbage, haricot beans, beets and onions are grown. Part of the vegetables are sold locally. Elguja owns a tractor, which is used for tilling his own plot. In tilling season, he also works with his tractor on other villagers’ plots and receives additional income. 

With the requested amount Elguja plans to cultivate his plot, purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and pay salaries to the hired workforce. 

With the increased profit, Elguja plans to expand the family’s agricultural business, purchasing additional plots. In addition to this he wants to overhaul his tractor and purchase some furniture for their house.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and pay salaries to the workforce.

loans.name: Take And Pay Group

texts.en:
Rugie B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Rugie was born in the town of Moyamba, in southern Sierra Leone, about 33 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has three children, one in primary school and two in secondary school. 

Rugie sells ready-to-wear-clothes: shirts, skirts, baby clothes, etc., and has been managing this business for many years now. 

This is the first loan that Rugie and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Rugie will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy ready-to-wear-clothes at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear-clothes at wholesale to add to her stock

loans.name: Tujikaze Group

texts.fr: Kaurwa M.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Tujikaze, âgée de 55 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants.  Ces 2 enfants  ont leurs propres foyers et les 3 autres poursuivent le chemin de l’école. Son conjoint est un enseignant. La  cliente  Kaurwa M. est vendeuse des habits (friperie). Elle s’installe au marché regional de Kituku, marché réservé par le gouvernement au projet de Foire international agricole pour la paix dans la région des grands lacs. Depuis sa jeunesse la cliente Kaurwa M. exerce cette activité.   Elle vient de réaliser 16 cycles en bénéficiant  des crédits de l’IMF Hekima pour  renforcer  son capital. La cliente  Kaurwa M.  vit de cette activité, car la prime de son mari ne suffit pas pour couvrir les charges du ménage. Les enseignants en RD Congo ne sont pas quasiment payés. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  de nouvelles marchandises (1 ballon de friperie).  En plus, elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise et réaliser son chantier de maison qui  est en pleine construction. La cliente Kaurwa M.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Tujikaze est constitué de 17 membres. Cependant, un collègue d’affaire s’est ajouté sur la photo de groupe d’où 18 figures visibles.
texts.en:
Kaurwa M. is an entrepreneur, and leader of the business group Tujikaze. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Two of her children live on their own, while the other three still go to school. Her spouse is a teacher. 

Kaurwa M. sells used clothing (thrift store). She conducts her sales at the regional market of Kituku, which the government has booked for the project of the international agricultural exhibition for peace in the great lakes region. 

Kaurwa M. has been engaged in this activity since youth. She has completed 16 loan cycles with the Hekima MFI to strengthen her working capital. 

Kaurwa M. earns a living through this activity, as her husband’s wages are not sufficient to cover household expenses. In DRC, teachers receive very low wages. 

This new loan will allow her to stock up on new merchandise (1 sack of used clothing). In addition, she hopes to sustain her business and complete construction on her house.  

Kaurwa M. wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping poor women who cannot turn to traditional banks. 

The Tujikaze group consists of 17 members. However, a business partner also appears in the group photo, which counts 18 people.

loans.use: to buy one sack of used clothing

loans.name: Mikailu M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you teachers of the Faith in Christ School. This group of teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 6,300,000 SLL in order to solve their financial problems or invest in a business. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayment and pays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf. 

Mikailu M. K. is the leader of this group of teachers. He was born in Rogbin village and he is 37 years old. Mikailu has been in the teaching profession for more than eight years. Mikailu has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 SLL from Kiva lenders in order to pay school fees for his children.

They produce cheese and sell it in Khashuri, a nearby town. Also they own a 4.3 ha plot of land and grow tomatoes, haricot beans, barley and wheat. The grains and tomatoes are sold locally. In addition to the agriculture,  Kakha and his wife run a retail business. They buy linens on the wholesale market and sell them in the village. 

Kakha got the loan from Credo for agricultural business – to till the land, purchase fertilizers and seeds. Kakha hopes that they will have a good harvest season and plans to invest the profit in their retail business as well as paying for their children's education.

Amelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Amelita is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and bread. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Amelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and bread

loans.name: Go Before Group

texts.en:
Presented to you are members of the “Go-Before” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 500,000 SLL each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standards of living. 

The leader of this group is Mariama K.. Mariama is 55 years old and was born in Bo City. Mariama is married with eight children. For many years now, Mariama has been selling palm oil, the country’s favorite cooking oil. With this loan, she will expand her palm oil business by buying gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Mechel

texts.en:
Mechel A. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 25 years old and married, with an infant child. To make a living, Mechel sells spices like onions and garlic.  She also sells eggs in the local community. Mechel has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mechel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mechel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mechel is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional trays of eggs and sacks of onion and garlic to be sold. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Mechel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of eggs and sacks of onion and garlic to be sold

loans.name: Warakoze Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne N.  est une  vieille commerçante âgée de 55ans qui habite  au centre ville de la Province de Kayanza au Nord du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de bière de  banane depuis 12 ans alors qu’elle était cultivatrice avant de pratiquer ce métier. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de la 6e annee primaires. Elle est mariée a Jérôme Masabo, un cultivateur, et ont ensemble 7 enfants dont 5 déjà maries et 2 autres qui étudient. Elle arrive au 7e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant une grande quantité de bananes pour en extraire une grande quantité de jus pour faire la bière  à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Ce commerce lui aide à couvrir les charges familiales les plus élémentaires.

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Warakoze».
texts.en:
Jeanne N. is a 55-year-old merchant who lives in downtown Kayanza, a province located in northern Burundi. She has been selling banana beer for 12 years. Prior to this activity, she was a farmer. She completed six years in primary school. She is married to Jerome Masabo, a farmer, and together they have seven children, five of whom are already married and the other two still in school. 

She has reached her 7th cycle of community credit with Turame. She is seeking a loan with Kiva to increase her capital. She will buy a large quantity of bananas to extract the juice that will be turned into beer. She will then sell the beer for substantial profits. This activity helps her to cover some basic household expenses.

She is a member of the Warakoze community group.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy a large quantity of bananas whose juice will be turned into banana beer

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle C. is from the village of Capayangan, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 34 years old and married, with one school-aged child. To make a living, Anabelle runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells canned goods, snack foods, diapers, detergents, juice powder, shampoo, soap and beverages. Anabelle has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Anabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Anabelle is requesting her second loan, for 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods  and beverages. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Niteka Group

texts.fr:
Ernest T.  est un  commerçant âgé de 27ans qui habite  la localité de Masanganzira en province de Ngozi au Nord du Burundi. Il fait le commerce de produits alimentaires comme le haricot, le riz et le grain de maïs depuis 5 ans alors qu’il était élève  avant de pratiquer ce metier. Il a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de la 6e année primaires. Il  est marie a Rwasa Emeline, une cultivatrice, et ont ensemble 3 enfants  âgés respectivement de 5ans, 3ans et 7 mois. Il arrive au 6e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant une grande quantité de produits alimentaires  à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Il espère un jour être un grand commerçant qui fait le commerce de gros. 

Il est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Niteka».
texts.en:
Ernest T.  is a 27-year old retailer who lives in Masanganzira, in the province of Ngozi, in the north of Burundi. He has been selling food products such as haricot beans, rice and corn for the last 5 years, when he was a student before taking up this activity. He went to school up to the 6th year of elementary school. 

He is married to Rwasa Emeline, a market gardener, and together they have 3 children aged 5, 3 and 7 months. He is at his 6th cycle with of community credit with Turame. He is asking Kiva for a loan to increase his capital by buying a large amount of food products to re-sell and make a significant profit. One day, he hopes to be a large-scale trader and work in wholesale. He is a member of the community group "Nitkea."

loans.use: to increase capital by buying a large quantity of food products to re-sell

loans.name: Shima Ii Group

texts.fr:
Michel N.  est un  commerçant âgé de 36ans qui habite  au centre ville du chef lieu de la Province de Kayanza  au Nord du Burundi. Il fait le commerce de produits  de boutique il de cela 5 ans alors qu’il faisait le commerce de vaches avant. Il a fréquenté l’école primaire jusqu’en 6e année primaires. Il  est marie a Césarie Ngendakumana, une commerçante de bière industrielle et ont ensemble 5 enfants dont 3 étudient. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant de  grandes quantités de produits de boutique comme produits alimentaires(haricot,riz,farine de mais,manioc)et autres denrees pour utilisation des menages comme les ampoules d'eclairage,bougies,dentifrices,savons,etc  à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Il a l’espoir qu’avec le commerce pratique avec son épouse, ils pourront devenir de grands commerçants et fournir aux autres

Il est membre  du groupe  Solidaire« Shima II».
texts.en:
Michel N.  is a 36 year-old retailer who lives in the downtown area of the capital city of the Kayanza province, in the north of Burundi. For the last 5 years he has been selling boutique items. Before that, he sold cows. 

Michel went to school up to the 6th year of elementary school. He is married to Césarie Ngendakumana, who sells beer, and together they have 5 children,  3 of whom go to school. 

He is asking for credit from Kiva in order to increase his capital by buying large quantities of boutique items (foodstuffs such as beans, rice, corn flour, and manioc) to re-sell and make a significant profit. He hopes that, along with his wife's business, they can become large-scale retailers and help others. Michel is a member of the "Shima II" group.

loans.use: to increase capital by buying a large quantity of boutique items to re-sell

loans.name: Hasa  Onzere

texts.en:
For 12 years Hasa Onzere has been working in a garage whereby he repairs vehicles for his customers in Dagorreti Corner; Nairobi. He earns an income of KES. 20,000 per month.  He is 25 years old, married and a father of one child.    

He learned about KADET LTD through a friend. He has applied for his first loan through KADET LTD; he plans to use the entire loan amount to purchase working materials (spare parts) for his garage.            


Hasa intends to use the anticipated profits to save and start a vegetable Kiosk for the wife. In the future, Hasa desires to grow his business and establish his garage to be the best in Nairobi.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for vehicle repairs

loans.name: Iteriteka Group

texts.fr:
Rachidi Gapero  est un  commerçant âgé de 27ans qui habite   la localite de Masanganzira en Province de Ngozi au Nord du Burundi. Il fait le commerce de produits  de boutique il ya de cela 10 ans. Il n’a pas été au banc de l’école. Il  est marie a Odette K., une cultivatrice, et ont ensemble 3 enfants  âgés respectivement de 6ans, 4ans et 9 mois. Il prend aussi en charge un autre enfant de sa famille proche. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant de  grandes quantités de produits de boutique  à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Il espère pouvoir progresser dans son métier de commerçant. 

Il est membre  du groupe  Solidaire« Iteriteka».
texts.en:
Rachidi Gapero is a 27-year-old merchant who lives in the Masanganzira area of the Ngozi Province in North Burundi. He has been selling various store items for 10 years. He did not attend school. He is married to Odette K., a farmer, and together they have 3 children who are 6 years old, 4 years old, and 9 months old respectively. He also takes care of another child from his immediate family.

He is seeking this loan through Kiva to increase his capital by buying large quantities of store items and reselling them to realize large profits. He hopes to develop in his career as a merchant.

He is a member of the solidarity group "Iteriteka."

loans.use: To increase capital by buying large quantities of retail store goods for resale

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil K. comes from the village of Osiauri, Kartli Region. He is married and has two sons - 19 and 13 years old. His younger son goes to school and the elder one is serving in the army. The main source of income for the family is agriculture. In particular, they own four milk cows and sell cheese on the local open market. Also they have a plot of land with an area of 3 ha, where maize, onions and wheat are grown. Part of the harvested grains and vegetables are sold on the local market.

With the loan received from Credo, Mikheil plans to expand his cattle-shed, as he wants to increase the number of cows in his farm. Besides that, he plans to purchase potato seeds. Once his cattle-shed is larger, he will purchase additional cows and the family’s income from dairy products sales will increase. Also he hopes that they will harvest quality potatoes and sell them at a good price. 

Besides being the main source of the income for the family, the dairy farm is a hobby for Micheil. He hopes someday his family will own a big, well developed dairy farm. He works hard to make this hope real.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and materials for cattle-shed expansion.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Aminata F..  She is married, and has three children aged five months, three years and seven years. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because they are her relatives whose parents live in the village. These children depend on her to take care of them while attending school in the city.  

In 2007, Aminata F. established her local foodstuffs, palm oil, "gari" (cassava couscous) and beans business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.

Aminata F. requires a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Aminata F. plans to open a big store for the sale of local produce.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food items for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph E. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. He is 43 years old. Joseph is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Joseph owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing utility van or multi-purpose vehicle services to local community members. Joseph has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 16,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joseph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joseph has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase tools needed to provide service. Joseph is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools & equipment needed to expand services provided. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Joseph from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & equipment needed to expand services provided.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a young man from Rafah, married and a father of two little sons. Ahmad distributes goods and items to stores and cafeterias.

Ahmad used to save a fixed amount of his income and he came to FATEN to take out a loan in order to purchase a van that would help him distribute larger amounts faster and thus save time.

Ahmad appears in the picture above.

loans.use: to purchase a van to distribute food items.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna V. is from the village of Spring Kibawe, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Lorna is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, candies, detergents, sugar,  shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & detergents. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & detergents.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase of firewood to bake his bricks.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia C. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Patricia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Patricia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fruit like oranges, pineapples, apples & also selling beauty soaps & products in the local community. Patricia has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Patricia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patricia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Patricia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fruits like watermelons & guavas. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Patricia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits like watermelons & guavas.

loans.name: Germelyn

texts.en:
Germelyn M. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Germelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Germelyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling hardware, auto supplies & electrical products in the local community. Germelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,010 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Germelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Germelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Germelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional electrical & hardware products. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Germelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional electrical & hardware products.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah O. is a married man. His wife takes care of the household chores while Elijah goes out to run their motorcycle business. They have an eight-year-old daughter whom they hope to give good education to the university level. His business is located at Kisumu. 

Kisumu is a region in Kenya known for the production of fish. It harbours Lake Victoria and is commonly known as the Lake Basin. Elijah has been in the transport business for seven years and has twelve employees. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is theft. Thugs pretend to be customers and on their way to the destination they rob the person rendering the service. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy another motorcycle to grow his business. In future, he plans to grow his transport business still more. He hopes to buy rickshaws and later vehicles. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver S. is 41 years old and lives in Sevan. He has a wife and two sons. Nver’s sons are both students. 
Nver was a policeman for about 17 years, but opened a butcher’s shop nine years ago. Along with running his butcher shop, Nver is a farmer and breeds animals.On his farm he breeds cows, sheep, pigs, and chickens, and also grows potatoes. Nver’s wife is a great help on the farm. 
With the income from his various endeavors, Nver supports his family, pays for his sons' education and repaired part of his home. 
This is Nver’s second loan from Kiva. He is asking for a loan of 1.000.000 AMD to buy potato seedlings for his farm. 
He plans to use the additional income to finish repairing his home.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Majid

texts.en:
Majid S. is a married man. His wife takes care of the household chores while Majid goes out to run their motorcycle business. They have two children aged four and two years old. Majid and his wife hope to give a good education to their kids until they reach university level. His business is located at the Nyalenda-Kachok area in Kisumu.

Kisumu is the region of Kenya known for the production of fish. It harbours Lake Victoria and is commonly known as the lake basin. 

Majid has been in the transportation business for five years and has two employees. He says that his business is profitable and his major challenge is theft. Thugs pretend to be customers and, on their way to the destination, they rob the person rendering the service. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He plans to use his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy another motorcycle to grow his business. He hopes to buy rickshaws some day. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace A. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old. Mary Grace is married and has a baby. Mary Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store.The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing and shoes from Natasha & Avon in the local community. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Mary Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and improve working capital. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional blouses and t-shirts. This loan will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional blouses and t-shirts

loans.name: Sthandokuhle Group

texts.en:
Vitress is 55 years old, and married with six children, three of whom attend school. She also takes care of two grandchildren. She earns an income from the government's child support grant. In the photo above she is wearing a white head scarf sitting in front of her group.

She has been in business for ten years and sells clothing, fruit and vegetables in town. She says the main challenges to her business are customers who buy on credit and do not pay on time.

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva. She said that the extra income from this loan will help her extend her house and send her children for tertiary education. In the future she would like to see her business grow and become a fruit and vegetable supplier.

She also mentioned that she really appreciates WDB and Kiva for providing the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: God Is Able Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en: Justine K. is 47 years old and has been in poultry sales for twenty years in Nasuti-Mukono. Justine is married with four children. She says she started in the poultry business after leaving a job as a teacher, which had been miserable for her. She quit teaching because of the low remuneration and exploitation pervasive in most Ugandan private schools and some government schools. Her poultry business generates 40,000 shillings profit. She plans to use the loan to purchase more poultry for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry for resale

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca B. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old. Prisca is single. Prisca owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing repair services of motorcycles & small vehicles to local community members. Prisca has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Prisca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 15,000 PHP and was used to purchase tools needed to provide service.

Prisca is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase tools & utilities needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her sixth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & utilities needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans M. is thirty-three years old and married. He and his wife have one  seven-year-old child whom they hope to give a good education to, up to the university level. 

His business is located at Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya known for production of fish. It harbours Lake Victoria and is commonly known as the lake basin. Evans has been in the transport business for six years now and uses a bicycle to give services to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is rainy weather. During the rainy season it becomes hard to get customers to use a bicycle and the roads too become impassable. 

However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to repair his bicycle and buy household goods. In future, he plans to grow his transport business by buying a motorcycle. He also hopes to give his family better living standards. He describes himself as tolerant, motivated and humble.

loans.use: Repair bicycle and buy household goods

loans.name: Dyesebel

texts.en:
Dyesebel M. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Dyesebel is married and has five school-aged children. Dyesebel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, detergents, soap & beverages in the local community. Dyesebel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Dyesebel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 16,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.

Dyesebel is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods. This loan will be her sixth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & junk food

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ar: احمد في عمر 25 سنة اعزب يعمل في زرع الأرض وبيع المحاصيل له في عمله 5 سنوات يحب عمله ويحب ان يطوره من خلال استحداث اساليب جديدة في الزراعة له زبائن من المحيط يحب العمل يحلم في تأمين مستقبل جيد حتى يتمكن من ان يبني عائلة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مولد للكهرباء لدعم الزراعة في الأرض وايضا يصبح لديه مدخول ثاني طموح ولا يريد ان يكون محدود العمل
texts.en: Ahmad is 25 years old and unmarried. He works in agriculture, planting crops and selling the produce. He has 5 years experience in this. He loves his work and is always seeking to develop it by adopting the latest agricultural methods. He has many local customers. He aspires to secure his future so that he may settle down with his own family. With this loan he wants to purchase an electricity generator to support his work and hopes that it will become a second source of income for him and help increase his workload.

loans.use: to purchase an electricity generator to support his agricultural work.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira D. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 55 years old. Elvira is widowed and has six adult children. Elvira owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling beverages, junk food, chocolate & milk powder drinks, biscuits & breads in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2005, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 16,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.

Elvira is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional canned goods, beverages & junk food. This loan will be her sixth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, beverages & junk foods

loans.name: Rosenia

texts.en:
Rosenia B. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Rosenia is single and has one school-aged child. Rosenia owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorela or habal-habal services (motorcycle transport) to local community members. Rosenia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Rosenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 17,000 PHP and was used to purchase tools needed to provide service.

Rosenia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase tools and utilities needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be her sixth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & utilities needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Chrispin

texts.en:
Chrispin O. O. is twenty four years old. He is single and does not have any children yet. He owns a transport services business located at Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya known for production of fish. It harbours Lake Victoria and commonly known as the lake basin. 

Chrispin has been in the transport business for two years now and has not managed to employ people yet since he owns only one motorcycle. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is theft. Thugs pretend to be customers and on their way to the destination they rob him.

However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. Due to this Chrispin has plans to diversify his business by starting a barber shop and that is why he has taken this loan amounting to 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). Even when he is venturing to a different business, he plans to grow his transport business. He describes himself as having good customer relations.

loans.use: to start a barber shop

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses O. is an auto-shop owner who is 31 years old, married and has one child who is 4 years old. He has been in the auto-shop business for the last 4 years and he sells things like screwdrivers, wiring materials, lighting bulbs and many more. He is able to get a profit of Kshs 15,000 per month and more from his wife’s business which enables him to provide for his family.

He is a new client at KADET LTD and he has applied for his first loan, which he plans to use to add more stock of items to sell in his auto-shop. He hopes to get profits, some of which he will use to save for his child’s education and the rest he will use to open a soft drink supply business on the side.

He hopes to expand his business and operate on a larger scale.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his auto shop

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence M. is a 46 year old married lady with one child who is 20 years old. She is a second-hand clothes seller in a market known as Gikomba in Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last 11 years and she is able to make a profit of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

Florence joined KADET LTD as a new client a few months ago and she has applied for her first loan which she plans to use to add more stock of the second hand clothes for resale. She anticipates that she will get profits which she will plough back into the business and also save some to invest in real estate. 

She has a desire to be a real investor in real estate in future.

loans.use: buying more clothes stock

loans.name: Vecinos Y Amigos Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Vecinos y Amigos” y está conformado por 18 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso. Todos ellos se dedican a diferentes rubros, específicamente venta en la feria de ropa interior, ropa y juguetes.
Gabriela es la presidenta del banco comunal y en la foto se encuentra al medio del grupo, viste una blusa blanca y un chaleco negro, los demás integrantes la señalan. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y juguetes en la feria desde hace 2 años. Gabriela trabaja todos los fines de semana en la feria y esporádicamente cuida a dos ancianos en una casa particular. Su mercadería la compra en diferentes lugares, los cuales sean convenientes económicamente.
Con éste préstamo pretende comprar un fardo de ropa (paquete grande de ropa usada).
Sus metas en su negocio son obtener un toldo grande, para utilizarlo como protección en la temporada de invierno, debido a la lluvia y en la temporada de verano, debido al intenso calor. Ya que actualmente Gabriela acomoda su mercadería encima de un paño en la calle. 
Ella vive junto a su hija de 26 años, quién la apoya los fines de semana en la venta de ropa. Sus sueños a nivel personal son poder independizarse económicamente, obtener y trabajar en un local que sea suyo. 
Gabriela está muy agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, ya que éste le permitirá invertir en su negocio, además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo de emprendedores, ya que son vecinos y conocidos. Por lo que las reuniones son muy amenas y se apoyan bastante. Respecto a los talleres realizados, Gabriela ha aprendido a como distribuir mejor los ingresos de su negocio. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Vecinos y Amigos” (Neighbors and Friends) and has 18 members from the city of Valparaíso.  They are all in different lines of work; specifically clothing, underwear and toy sales in the market.

Gabriela is communal bank President.  In the photo she’s in the middle of the group and is wearing a white blouse and black vest; the other group members are pointing at her.  She has been selling used clothes and toys in the market for the last two years.  She works every weekend in the market and sporadically cares for two senior citizens in a private home.  She buys her merchandise in various places, whichever is the most economically convenient.  She intends to use this loan to buy a bundle of clothes (a large package of used clothes).

Her goal for her business is to get a large awning to use as protection during the winter because of the rain and in summer because of the intense heat because currently Gabriela arranges her wares on a piece of cloth in the street.

She lives with her 26-year-old daughter who helps her on weekends with the clothing sales.  Her personal dreams are to become economically independent and to get a locale of her own to work in.

Gabriela is very grateful for the loan granted by Fondo Esperanza because it will make it possible for her to invest in her business.  Besides, she feels very comfortable in the group of entrepreneurs because they are neighbors and known to her.  Because of this, the meetings are very pleasant and they support each other quite a bit.   With respect to the workshops conducted, Gabriela has learned how to better distribute income earned from her business.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago.  It is the regional capital and also the legislative seat of the country.  It is the country’s main port and offers a large variety of beautiful, picturesque places like, for example, Nobel Prize winning poet Pablo Neruda’s house.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of used clothes.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus K. M. is a 34-year-old married man with two children aged ten and four years old. He operates a cleaning service business that obtains contracts to clean other offices, houses, and other spaces. He has been in this business for two years, earning a profit of about Kshs 20,000 per month.

Justus is a new client with Kiva partner Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET).  This loan is his first and he plans to use it to buy a new grid-da machine and service his current machine. The machine helps with the cleaning business. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

In the future, Justus hopes to open other cleaning business outlets in different parts of the country.

loans.use: To purchase a new grid-da machine and service the old one.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is 44 years old and has one child who is 16 years old. She owns a general store in which she sells several items such as rice, maize flour, cooking oil, soap, sugar, etc. She has had this shop for 10 years and it has always helped her meet all her family's needs. She is requesting a loan to buy more items such as maize flour,cooking oil,rice etc and fill her store and with the profits she plans to reinvest in her business by buying more items and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy items such as maize flour, cooking oil, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a member of Msimamo group in Faulu Kenya. For eleven years, he has been selling firewood. He also earns extra income from his rental houses. He joined Faulu Kenya so that he could easily access business loans. He used his previous loan from Faulu Kenya to expand his business. He hopes to grow his business so that he can get enough income to educate his children. He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more firewood.

loans.use: to buy more firewood

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is 28 years old and married with a four month old son. He runs a retail shop where he sells spare parts. He has been running the business for four years. He hopes to establish his business and open other outlets of his business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access business loans. This has helped him to improve his business. He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy alternators, starters, and distributors.

loans.use: to buy alternators, starters, and distributors

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 34 years old and married. He runs a school together with his wife who is in the photo. He has been operating the school for three years. He also supplies stationery so as to earn extra income. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in business management. This has helped him to improve his business. He hopes to grow the number of students in his school. He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy textbooks.

loans.use: to buy textbooks

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 53 years old, married, and has five children. He does dairy farming so as to earn a living. He has been in the business for 14 years. In addition, he grows tea to supplement his income. Being a married man with five children, he works hard in his business to provide for his family. He hopes to add at least five cows on his farm. He has requested 20,000 KES to construct a water tank on his farm.

loans.use: to construct a water tank on his farm

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik T. lives with his wife and two children in Talin city. The main income for the family comes from agriculture and exploiting Gagik’s truck. The truck was obtained thanks to Gagik’s savings and the loan he took previously from SEF. Although Gagik only uses the truck for four months during the agricultural high season, the profit from that period helps the family a lot. Gagik has also acquired a good reputation as a mechanic and is able to earn some income from providing services in that field too. Gagik and his wife take care of their small farm and also cultivate land. To increase their number of cattle and maintain the machinery, Gagik has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to increase the number of cattle and renovate the machinery.

loans.name: Ángel Remigio

texts.es:
Ángel Remigio M. P. tiene 33 años, es casado vive con la esposa y vive  con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.  Tiene 1hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS esta constituida por 12 socios esta se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de mora, tomate y maíz, son agrícolas por mas de 10 años los mas antiguos y otros miembros que estan comenzando con esta actividad.

Ángel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, tomate y maíz en grandes cantidades, las compras las realiza en Chillanes en Agro y las vende los días domingos en la feria de Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una finca propia para sembrar.

Le gusta hacer deporte, festejar el carnaval y ser una persona trabajadora.
texts.en:
Ángel Remigio M. P. is 33 years old, married, and lives with his wife and child in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS' community bank has 12 members.  It is located 20 minutes from our Chillanes office.  The members of this group work in agriculture.  They mainly grow blackberries, tomatoes and corn.  The older members have been farming for more than 10 years whilst other members are just starting out in the business.

Ángel is a farmer who grows blackberries, tomatoes and corn in large quantities.  He makes his purchases in Agro, in Chillanes and sells his produce on Sundays at Chillanes market.

Ángel is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as seeds, manure and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to own his own plot of land where he can sow his crops.

Ángel enjoying taking part in sports, celebrating Mardi Gras and being a hard-working person.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
Jose Alfredo A. Q. tiene 44 años, es casado vive con la esposa y vive  con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS esta constituida por 12 socios esta se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de mora, tomate y maíz, son agrícolas por mas de 10 años los mas antiguos y otros miembros que están comenzando con esta actividad.

José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, tomate y maíz en grandes cantidades, las compras las realiza en Chillanes en Agro y las vende los días domingos en la feria de Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un vehiculo para transportar sus productos y venderlos.

Le gusta hacer deporte, ser una persona emprendedora.
texts.en:
Jose Alfredo A. Q., 44, lives with his wife and children in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.  He has three children.

The “COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS” (Blackberry Farmers Cooperative) communal bank has 12 members and is located 20 minutes from the office in Chillanes.  The members of this communal bank are farmers, especially of blackberries, tomatoes and corn.  The older ones have been farming for over ten years and the other members are just starting out in this activity.

Jose farms blackberries, tomatoes and corn in large amounts.  He makes his purchases in Chillanes and sells at the Chillanes Sunday farmers market.

He asks for a loan to buy farming supplies: seed, manure and fertilizer.  Help from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.   His dream is to own a vehicle to transport his products to sell.

He likes playing sports; he’s an enterprising person.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.en:
The Ayidote group consists of three women who live in the same neighborhood and attend the same church. This is their second loan with ALIDE, following successful repayment of the first. They have agreed to support each other in business and through loan repayments.

Odile (with her hand raised in the photo) is 31 years old and lives in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. She and her husband Comlan support their two children, both of whom have received education.

For the past six years, Odile has been selling bottles from her home. This loan will enable her to purchase additional stock from Lomé, the capital of the neighboring country Togo. Her aim in the long term is to grow her business. Her strongest point as an entrepreneur is her welcoming nature.

loans.use: to purchase bottles for resale

loans.name: Elvis Ebelio

texts.es:
Elvis Ebelio G. S.  tiene 32 años, es casado vive con la esposa y vive  con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS esta constituida por 12 socios esta se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de mora, tomate y maíz, son agrícolas por mas de 10 años los mas antiguos y otros miembros que estan comenzando con esta actividad.

Elvis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, tomate y maíz en grandes cantidades, las compras las realiza en Chillanes en Agro y las vende los días domingos en la feria de Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener finca propia.

Le gusta hacer deporte y ser una persona sencilla.
texts.en:
Elvis Ebelio G. S. is 32 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 2 children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS' community bank has 12 members.  It is located 20 minutes from our Chillanes office.  The members of this group work in agriculture.  They mainly grow blackberries, tomatoes and corn.  The older members have been farming for more than 10 years whilst other members are just starting out in the business.

Elvis is a farmer who grows blackberries, tomatoes and corn in large quantities.  He makes his purchases in Agro, in Chillanes and sells his produce on Sundays at Chillanes market.

Elvis is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as seeds, manure and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to own his own farm.

Elvis enjoys taking part in sports and being a simple person.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Ubumwe Ii Group

texts.fr:
Francine N.  est une  commerçante âgée de 22ans qui habite en Commune Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce du sorgho qui sert a la production de la bière locale. Elle a commence ce métier depuis bientôt 2 ans. Elle  est mariée a Thiery D., un cultivateur, et ont ensemble 2 enfants de petit âge (3ans et 1an 8mois) : un garçon et une fillette 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant de  grandes quantités du sorgho  à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Elle a une préférence particulière pour le crédit Turame-Kiva du fait que les remboursements se font en tranches mais aussi avec un taux d’intérêt accessible pour les petits commerçants.

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Ubumwe II»
texts.en:
Francine N. is a 22-year old merchant who lives in the town of Rugombo, Cibitoke Province, in western Burundi. She runs a business selling sorghum, which is used to produce local beer.
