She begin this business almost 2 years ago. She is married to Thiery D., a farmer, and together they have 2 young children (3 years old and 1 year 8 months old): a boy and a girl.

She is seeking this loan through Kiva to increase her capital by buying large quantities of sorghum for resale in order to realize large profits. She particularly prefers loans through Turame and Kiva because the repayments are staggered and also because the interest rates are accessible to small retailers.

She is a member of the community group "Ubumwe II."

loans.use: To increase her capital by buying large quantities of sorghum for resale

loans.name: Juana Jeannette

texts.es: Juana tiene una pulpería, es una persona my responsable por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita créditos. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, con mucho sacrificio ha logrado tener esta actividad. La comarca donde ella vive se llama tololar, la mayoría de sus clientes son amigos, vecinos y familiares, pues Juana siempre ha sido una persona carismática y bondadosa, tiene 4 hijos delo cuales tiene que hacerse cargo. Solicita este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, jugos, detergentes, sopas y pan.
texts.en:
Juana owns a grocery store.  She is a very responsible person and this is not the first time that she has requested a loan.  Juana's store is located in her home and she worked very hard to set up her business.  The region where Juana lives is called Tololar.  Most of her customers are friends, neighbors and family members.  Juana has always been a charismatic and kind person.  She has 4 children to take care of.

Juana is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, candies, soft drinks, juice, detergents, soup and bread.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, soft drinks, juice, detergents, soup and bread

loans.name: Manuel Mesias

texts.es:
Manuel Mesias T. Q. tiene 38 años, es casado vive con la esposa y vive  con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS esta constituida por 12 socios esta se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de mora, tomate y maíz, son agrícolas por mas de 10 años los mas antiguos y otros miembros que estan comenzando con esta actividad.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, tomate y maíz en grandes cantidades, las compras las realiza en Chillanes en Agro y las vende los días domingos en la feria de Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener mas dineros para dar educación a los hijos.

Le gusta ser una persona responsable y festejar las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Manuel Mesias T. Q. is 38 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 2 children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS' community bank has 12 members.  It is located 20 minutes from our Chillanes office.  The members of this group work in agriculture.  They mainly grow blackberries, tomatoes and corn.  The older members have been farming for more than 10 years whilst other members are just starting out in the business.

Manuel is a farmer who grows blackberries, tomatoes and corn in large quantities.  He makes his purchases in Agro, in Chillanes, and sells his produce on Sundays at Chillanes market.

Manuel is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as seeds, manure and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to make more money so that he can provide his children with an education.

Manuel likes being a responsible person and enjoys taking part in Mardi Gras celebrations.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Los Hermanos Unidos 1 Group

texts.en:
Faviela is the coordinator of her group Los Hermanos Unidos 1 (United Brethren 1). Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and sugar cane industry. The town’s main economic activity revolves around a free traD. zone, a cement factory and other businesses. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

Faviela makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and her little son. She says that her greatest challenge is caring for her family, yet she hopes to have more children in the future.

Faviela operates a fruit stall. She has been in business for almost three years, a venture she started with money she received from her first loan. She enjoys doing business. It is her favorite pastime because she makes money doing this. She is excited to be taking out her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her prior loans and grown her business. Faviela plans to use this loan to invest further in her business. She will use her profits to increase her sales and to continue growing her business.

Faviela is saving to make her dreams come true: to have a prosperous life, a safe and beautiful home, and more children. She knows this will be possible through God’s will.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for her stall

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna Nakajjugo is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. Berna lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.

Berna sells plantains and charcoal. She has been doing so for nine years, and she works six days out of every week. Her main business challenge is transporting her goods.

Berna has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to purchase more plantains and charcoal. Her goal is to educate her children up to university-level studies.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and bananas

loans.name: Rudasingwa

texts.fr: Rudasingwa M. est commerçante dans le secteur de Rubavu.  Elle a 38 ans, elle est veuve, née a RDC, et elle a 2 enfants entre 17 ans et 19 ns, et aussi 5 personnes en charge.  Tous ses enfants vont à l’école, et elle a fini 2 ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des arachides et des petits poissons pour les revendre dans son commerce.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’élever ses ventes dans son marche, et aller ou vient ses produits (Tanzanie, Uganda) pour bénéficier de plus.  Elle voudrait devenir une grande distributrice des marchandises dont elle vend pour le moment, et dépasser le niveau de détaillant, et devenir grossiste.  Pour sa vie, elle voudrait améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille, scolariser ses enfants, ainsi tous les enfants a sa charge.
texts.en: Rudasingwa M. is a merchant in the Rubavu sector. She is 38 years old, widowed, was born in the Democratic Republic of Congo, has 2 children who are 17 and 19 years old, and also takes care of 5 people. All of her children attend school, and she finished 2 years of secondary school. This loan is her first with ACB (one of Kiva's field partners), and she is going to use it to buy peanuts and small fish to resell them as part of her business. Her strategy to increase her business is to raise her sales volume at the market and to travel to where her products come from (Tanzania and Uganda) in order to make larger profits. She would like to become a large distributor of the goods she currently sells, and to move beyond the retail level and become a wholesaler. As for her life, she would like to improve her family's standard of living, and educate her own children as well as all of the other ones in her care.

loans.use: To buy peanuts and small fish for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 33 years old, married, and the mother of one. She runs a food stall so as to earn a living. She has been running the business for two years. She joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that she could save money, get business ideas, and access loans easily. She has been guaranteed a loan of 15,000 KES by the group members. She will use the loan to buy cooking fat, potatoes, plates, and cups. In five years, she sees herself running a big hotel.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, potatoes, plates, and cups

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr: Emmanuel H. est agent militaire, et propriétaire d’un cyber café.  Il a 31 ans, il et marié, et il a un enfant de 3 ans, et aussi 2 personnes en charge.  Il a fini 3 ans d’école secondaire, et ce crédit et son premier cycle avec ACB.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des ordinateurs pour en utiliser dan son cyber café.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’offrir les services de qualité, avoir tous les matériels nécessaires pour avoir de bon services, et bonne gestion de travailleurs.  Il voudrait élever le business, faire tous ce que c’est possible pour offrir tous les services relatif a l’informatique, et devenir un telecentre.  Pour sa vie, il voudrait améliorer le bien être de sa famille, et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Emmanuel H. is a military officer and owns an internet cafe. He is 31 years old, married, has one 3-year-old child, and also takes care of 2 additional people. He finished 3 years of secondary school, and this loan is his first with ACB (one of Kiva's field partners). He is going to use his loan to buy computers to use in his internet cafe. His strategy to increase his business is to offer quality service, have all the necessary equipment to deliver good service, and manage his workers well. He would like to raise his business, do everything possible to offer all the services related to computing, and develop a telecentre. With regards to his life, he would like to improve his family's well-being and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy computers for use in an internet cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Vestine

texts.fr: Vestine M. est enseignante dans le secteur de Rubavu, et diacre de son église.  Elle a 43 ans, elle est mariée, née a Rwanda, et elle a 4 enfants entre 5 ans et 12 ans.  Tous ses enfants vont à l’école, et Vestine a fini ses A-levels en psychologie clinique.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des matériels de construction et main d’œuvre, pour construire une maison à louer.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter ses sources de revenu an ayant des maisons à louer, et améliorer sa situation d’habitation.  Pour sa vie, elle voudrait améliorer le bien être de sa famille, et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Vestine M. is a teacher in the Rubavu sector, and is also the deaconess of her church. She was born in Rwanda and is currently 43 years old. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are between 5 and 12 years old. All of her children attend school, and Vestine finished her A-levels in clinical psychology. She is going to use her loan to pay for construction materials and manual labour to build a house for rent. Her strategy to increase her business is to augment her sources of income by having houses to rent and also to improve her living situation. With regards to her life, she would like to improve her family's well-being and to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay for construction materials and manual labour in order to build a house for rent.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne U. est commerçante dans le district de Rubavu, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle a 31 ans, elle est mariée, née a RDC, et elle a un enfant d’un an.  Elle a fini 3 ans d’école secondaire, et ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat de 2 douzaines d’essuie-mains, 2 douzaine de Colgates, 30 parfums, 4 douzaines de singlets, et autres choses à vendre dans son commerce.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de demander beaucoup des prêts, tout en augmentant la quantité des produits à vendre.  Elle voudrait devenir une grande commerçante dans le district de Rubavu, bâtir sa propre maison d’habitation, et aussi assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Jeanne U. is a trader in the Rubavu district and a customer of ACB since 2010. She is 31 years old, married, born in the Democratic Republic of Congo, and has a one-year old child; She completed three years of secondary school and this loan is her first from ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy two dozen kitchen rolls, two dozen tubes of Colgate, 30 perfumes, four dozen vests, as well as other items to sell. Her strategy for growing her business is to request a large number of loans, in order to increase the quantity of goods she can sell. She would like to become an important businesswoman in the Rubavu district, build her own home and also ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy two dozen kitchen rolls, two dozen tubes of Colgate, 30 perfumes and four dozen vests for her business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 48-year-old businessman. To earn a living, he sells cakes on a wholesale basis. He has 10 years of experience in the business.  

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business through loans. He hopes to expand his business and employ more people in the future.  

He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a variety of cakes.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cakes

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia, de 44 años, quien esta separada y sola esta saliendo adelante. Vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos mayores. Hace más de 12 años, se dedica  a la venta de periódicos. Todos los días a las 5 de la mañana, recoge los periódicos de las editoras.  En seguida las distribuye a crédito a diversos kioscos de su localidad hasta las 9 de la mañana, y a las 4 de la tarde, nuevamente retoma su recorrido realizando sus cobranzas. Es así que esta trabajadora mujer se esfuerza por el bienestar y educación de sus hijos. Por ello, quiere incrementar más su negocio, con la compra de revistas, para atender la solicitud de sus clientes y, de ese modo captar mas utilidades. En adelante desea tener otro negocio, ya que el actual lo considera muy sacrificado y de  mucho peso, por ello desea vender golosinas, y para este fin, de a poco ira acondicionando su casa. Se está reincorporando a MFP, y dice “que pagará todas sus cuotas, sin tardar como las anteriores créditos”, porque ya no vive con su esposo y tampoco quiere defraudar la confianza que le brindan. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará revistas mensuales, para satisfacer la petición de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eusebia, 44, is separated and getting ahead by herself.  She lives in the company of her three adult children.  For over 12 years she has sold newspapers.  She goes out every day at 5am to pick up newspapers from the publishers.  She then sells on credit to various kiosks in the location until 9am.  At 4pm she once again repeats the route to collect payment.  This is how this hard working woman strives for her children’s wellbeing and education. Because of this, she’d like to expand her business buying magazines to meet customer demand and earn higher profits.

In the future she’d like to have another business since she considers the current one to be quite laborious and heavy.  She’d like to sell snacks and toward this end she’s been equipping her house.

She is rejoining MFP and says that she “will pay all her installments on time, not like the previous loans,” because she no longer lives with her husband and does not want to disappoint those who place their trust in her.  

If she were to get the loan she’s requesting, she will use it to buy monthly magazines to meet customer requests.

loans.use: to buy magazines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for farming business

loans.name: Mariana Liduvina

texts.es:
Mariana Liduvina P. C. tiene 52 años, es soltera   vive con una hija de 25 años en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.   

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS esta constituida por 12 socios esta se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de mora, tomate y maíz, son agrícolas por mas de 10 años los mas antiguos y otros miembros que estan comenzando con esta actividad.

Mariana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, tomate y maíz en grandes cantidades, las compras las realiza en Chillanes en Agro y las vende los días domingos en la feria de Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es apoyar a los hija para que estudie.

Le gusta descansar y pasar conversando con la hija.
texts.en:
Mariana Liduvina P. C., 52, is single.  She lives with her mother in the Ecuadorean province of Bolivar.  She has no children.

The COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS community bank has 12 members.  The bank is located some 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  The members are all farmers.  They grow blackberries, tomatoes and maize.  Some of the members have been farmers for up to 10 years and others are just starting out.  

Mariana grows blackberries, tomatoes and maize.  She buys what he needs from Agro in Chillanes and sells at the Sunday fairs there.  

Mariana is applying for a loan to buy the supplies she needs for her farming business: seeds, manure and chemical fertilizer.  Your loans will fund the investment she needs.  Her biggest challenges are the pests and plant diseases that can destroy her crop and the ever-changing weather.  Her greatest wish is to help with the children's studies.

Mariana likes to spend time with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for farming business

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie Nyirahabimana est commerçante de pommes de terre dans le district de Rubavu, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle a 39 ans, elle est mariée, née a Rwanda, et elle a 5 enfants entre 5 ans et 23 ans.  Elle a aussi 1 personne en charge.  Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école, et Marie a fini deux ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit est son deuxième cycle avec ACB, et elle a une bonne histoire de remboursement.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1000 kgs de pommes de terre, payer la main d’œuvre, et acheter 20 emballages pour son business.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’acheter et vendre les pommes de terre en grande quantité ; donc, augmentation de la quantité.  Elle voudrait devenir grossiste, assurer le bien être de sa famille, payer et préparer les futures études pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marie Nyirahabimana sells potatoes in the district of Rubavu, and has been a  client of ACB since 2010. Born in Rwanda, Marie is 39 years old, married and the mother of 5 children between the ages of 5 and 23. She also takes care of one other person. Four of her children go to school. Marie finished two years of secondary school. This loan is her second cycle with ACB, and she has a good repayment history.

She will use her loan to buy 1,000 kg of potatoes, to pay for workers and to buy 20 packages for her business.  Her business growth plan is to buy and sell large quantities of potatoes, therefore, she needs to increase quantities. She would like to become a wholesaler, to guarantee her family's well being, and to pay and save for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 kg of potatoes, 20 packages for her business, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is 69 years old. He earns his daily bread through dairy farming.  He used to grow vegetables, but he has been a farmer for four years now, and he has employed one person.  He sells milk to people in his area.  Besides farming, he also has other employment.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business through loans.  He hopes to start large-scale farming in the future.  He has requested 20,000 KES to buy animal feed.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a member of Dandora Victory Self Help group.  She has been tailoring for three years.  She is married with five children.  She works hard in her business so as to help her husband with household expenses.  She hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has requested her first loan of 10, 000 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Luz De La Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the president of her group, Luz D. la Esperanza (Light of Hope) 1 & 2, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the areas surrounding San Pedro, and their community depends on tourists. It is a poor area where the economy used to thrive on sugar cane but has more recently waned, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. 

Maria makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their three children.  She  is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to purchase calling cards, mobile phones, copy paper, etc. She also sells cosmetic products, and she will purchase different brands of this kind of product, as well as some others things like women’s accessories.  She will use the profits to further invest in her business, as clients always need more products. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Los Arcoiris De Atoto Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Los Arcoiris de Atoto" debido a que en las epocas de lluvia en ese municipio se pueden apreciar perfectamente varios arcoiris de distintos tamaños al mismo tiempo. Esta ubicado en Hidalgo, en México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes. La señora Rocio C. tiene 43 años, estudio hasta la universidad, es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijas mujeres. Ella se dedica a un negocio de lavanderia que inicio desde hace 6 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en productos como shampoo, detergente, suavitel, bolsa etc. para su negocio de lavanderia. Al solicitar este prestamo ella se siente entusiasmada ya que en base al credito piensa establecer su lavanderia en un local independiente a su casa por la gran demanda que tiene gracias al servicio que ofrece y sus precios accesibles, sus clientes la recomiendan ampliamente por su buena atención y magnifico trabajo. La señora también espera ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida y seguirles brindando educación a sus hijas con las ganancias que obtenga para que logren cumplir sus sueños y una vida más estable. Observaciones, la persona que no se ve bien en la foto se llama Anabel C. y Veronica R.
texts.en:
This goup is called "Los Arcoiris de Atoto" (Atoto Rainbows) because in the rainy season several rainbows are perfectly visible at the same time in this town in Hidalgo, Mexico.  The group is comprised of 11 members.  Mrs. Rocio C. is 43 years old and has a college education.  She is a merchant and has two adult daughters.  She has a laundromat that she set up six years ago for which she is requesting a loan to buy laundromat supplies such as detergent, softener, bags, etc.  

She is very excited about the loan because it will allow her move her business from her home to an independent location.  There is a great demand for her services because she offers good prices.  Her customers recommend her services because of her attentiveness and wonderful work.

With her earnings she plans to offer her daughters a better lifestyle and education so they can realize their dreams and have a stable livelihood.

N.B.  The people barely seen in the photo are Anabel C. and Veronica R.

loans.use: To buy laundromat supplies

loans.name: Lino Oswaldo

texts.es:
Lino Oswaldo A. T. tiene 18 años, es soltero  vive  con la madre y el padre en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS esta constituida por 12 socios esta se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de mora, tomate y maíz, son agrícolas por mas de 10 años los mas antiguos y otros miembros que están comenzando con esta actividad.

Lino se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, tomate y maíz en grandes cantidades, las compras las realiza en Chillanes en Agro y las vende los días domingos en la feria de Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es culminar la carrera.


Le gusta jugar  ser una persona alegre.
texts.en:
Lino Oswaldo A. T., 18, is single living with his mother and father in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.  He has no children.

The “COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS” (Blackberry Farmers Cooperative) communal bank has 12 members and is located 20 minutes from the office in Chillanes.  The members of this communal bank are farmers, especially of blackberries, tomatoes and corn.  The older ones have been farming for over ten years and the others are just starting out in this activity.

Lino farms blackberries, tomatoes and corn in large quantities.  He makes his purchases at Agro in Chillanes and sells at the Chillanes Sunday farmers market.

He’s requesting a loan to buy supplies like seed, manure and fertilizer.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to complete his career.

He enjoys playing and being a cheerful person.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Berclin

texts.fr:
Berclin L. est un commerçant de HOPE Congo âgé 35 ans, célibataire et père d'un enfant dont l'âge est de 13ans.

 il débute son commerce de quincaillerie en 1996. Il vend en moyenne 15000 a 35.000frs par jours. 

Avec le prêt le second, il compte renforcer son stock en achetant deux mélanger lavabo et baignoire, dix boîtes colles gebajoint, deux des robinets, des flotteurs bâche à eau, vingt des fusible. 

 il pense ouvrir un magasin avec vente en gros et détails, afin de soutenir les études scolaires de son enfants.
texts.en:
Berclin L. is a merchant with HOPE Congo. He is 35 years old, unmarried, and the father of one child, aged 13.  He started his hardware business in 1996. His sales on average amount to 15,000 to 35,000 francs a day.

With this second loan, he plans on bolstering his inventory by buying 2 blenders, washbasins and bath tubs, 10 cans of Gebajoint glue, 2 faucets, some toilet tank floats, and 20 fuses.

Berclin is thinking about opening a wholesale and retail store in order to support his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy faucets, bath tubs, and fuses

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores de 28 años, nacida en el distrito de San Francisco; esta casada con Fortunato de 34 años de edad y tienen 02 hijos Dennis de 12 años y Erick de 03 años. Juntos viven en su propia casa donde reina la  buena armonía. Dolores y su pareja Fortunato son el pilar de sus hijos, ha Dolores desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a remover la tierra; ella es campesina y cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café y plantaciones de plátano; plantas oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene removiendo la tierra hace 06 años en su propia parcela, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los peones quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los frutos hasta los tendales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en los distritos de Kimbiri y San Francisco; lugares donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Con el préstamo solicitado mas los ahorros acumulados comprará un lote de terreno en la ciudad de Ayacucho; en lo futuro desea comprar nuevas tierras e incrementar su producción con plantas de café. Este  es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará un lote de terreno en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en: Dolores, 28, was born in Peru's San Francisco region.  She and her husband, Fortunato, 34, live with their 2 children, Dennis, 12, and Erick, 3, in a house that they own.  Dolores and Fortunato are the bedrock of the family and their home is one where harmony is the rule.  Dolores learned farming from her parents when she was just a girl.  She's a "campesina", a country girl, with 4 hectares of land where she plants coffee and platanos.  Both crops are native to Peru's Rio Apurimac Valley.  She started working her own land 6 years ago.  She hires seasonal workers to help her harvest her crop and carry it to market.  Her favorite thing about farming is harvesting her crop because it makes all of the hard work that came before worthwhile. Her most difficult challenge is getting her crop to market because she has to deliver it to buyers in Kimbiri and San Francisco, the two towns where she can get the best price for the crop.  She is applying for loan, which she will combine with her own savings, to buy a plot of land in the city of Ayacucho.  In the future, she wants to buy even more land and increase her production of coffee.  This is Dolores's first MFP loan.  She knows that if she repays it on time, she'll have an easier time getting future loans.  She will use the loan, for 3,000 new soles, to buy a plot of land in Ayacucho.

loans.use: Comprar un terreno en Ayacucho.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Larissa Sandrine

texts.fr:
Larissa M. W. est une commerçante de HOPE Congo, âgée de 25ans, universitaire et célibataire sans enfant. 

Elle débute son acticité dès l’âge de 15ans avec un capital de 25000. Ses revenus journaliers sont de 80000 à 150000frs. 

Avec ce second prêt elle veut renforcer son commerce en achetant des sacs de charbon.

Elle veut devenir une grande commerçante dans l’avenir ainsi que finir ses études universitaires et fondé une famille afin d’offrir une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Larissa M. W. is a merchant with HOPE Congo. She is 25 years old, a university student, unmarried, and has no children. With 25,000 francs in capital, she started her business at the age of 15.  Her revenues range from 80,000 to 150,000 francs per day.

With this second loan, Larissa wants to bolster her business by buying sacks of charcoal. She wants to become a major merchant in the future, along with finishing her university education and starting a family, so as to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Madwen Meho

texts.en: Madwen Meho A. is married and has four children. Her husband is an electrician. To help him support the family, she sells banku, fufu and provisions such as oil, eggs, tinned tomatoes and rice. Banku is a staple made of fermented corn and cassava dough and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste. It is usually served with soup, stew or a pepper sauce with fish. Fufu is a thick paste, also a Ghanaian staple, made from cassava and plantain. Madwen sells her food in a Ntranoa Village, near Elmina. She’ll use the loan to purchase more food items to grow her business. The profits will be reinvested back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to grow her business.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba D. is married and has four children. Her husband is an officer. To help supplement his income, she sells sandals in Ntranoa, a village near the town of Elmina. Her earnings pay for their children’s education and some of the household expenses. For the past seven years, she has been selling her sandals by carrying her wares around, as shown in the photograph. Her dream is to set up her own shop some day. To do so, she plans to expand her business. This loan will allow her to purchase more sandals to meet the needs of her customers and grow her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more sandals to meet the needs of her customers and grow her sales.

loans.name: Anifath

texts.en:
Anifath is 39 years old and lives in the Sagbo district of Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. Together with her husband, Tidjani, she looks after their three children, all of whom are in school.

For the past 20 years Anifath has sold meals from her stall outside her home. This is her fifth loan with ALIDE, following successful repayments of past loans, and it will allow her to purchase raw ingredients for her meals from Cotonou, Benin's largest city. Her aim is to eventually build her own home. She cites her welcoming nature as her strength as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr:
Michel  est un commerçant de HOPE Congo de 37 ans, marie et père de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 6ans à 22 ans.

 Il commence ce commerce de quincaillerie en 2002. En moyenne il vend environ 5000 a 50.000frs par jours.

Avec le second prêt qu'il compte recevoir, il va renforcer son activité en achetant, des sanitaires, des robinets, des interrupteurs, des fusibles, des pointes de toute taille.... 

A l’ avenir il pense se lancer dans la vente en gros et avec ses économies, ainsi que pour pouvoir ouvrir un grand magasin. Il pense aussi à envoyer ses enfants dans des grandes écoles pour leur formations scolaire.
texts.en:
Michel is a merchant with HOPE Congo. He is 37 years old, married, and the father of three children, aged 6 to 22. He started this hardware business in 2002. On average, his sales amount to approximately 5,000 to 50,000 francs per day.

With a second loan he expects to receive, Michel is going to bolster his business by buying toilets, faucets, circuit breakers, fuses, and spark plugs of any size.  

For the future, he is thinking of getting started in wholesale with this savings, as well as opening a large store. He is also thinking of sending his children to top schools for their training and education.

loans.use: to buy toilets, faucets, and circuit breakers

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa E. is married to a cleaner and they have six children. For the past 20 years, she has run two businesses to help support their family. She is a baker and also sells charcoal in the village of Ntranoa, near Elmina town. Her earnings help pay for the school fees. 

Adjowa wishes to grow her business and will use her loan to purchase more charcoal for sale. She plans to reinvest the additional profits back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is a fishmonger from the village Ntranoa, near the fishing town of Elmina. Her income is used to provide for her household of five children. Rose wants to expand her business and will use the requested loan to purchase larger quantities of fish to sell. She plans to reinvest the profits back into her business for further growth, as well as save up for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of fish to sell

loans.name: Eider Abad

texts.es:
Desde hace 3 años Eider Abad se desempeña como profesional de la Belleza, el estudió en una academia de belleza del municipio, esta labor le ha permitido tener el sustento diario de él y su familia. 

Eider trabaja en la sala de su casa y su trabajo está siendo tan reconocido que ha decido montar su propia sala de belleza y así podrá generar nuevos ingresos además de poder atender a todos sus clientes, es por esto que al tener el crédito Eider tendrá lo necesario para dotar su centro de belleza.
texts.en:
Eider Abad has been working as a Beauty Professional for the last three years.  He trained at a municipal beauty academy.  This work is making it possible for him to support himself and his family.

He works in his living room and his work is being recognized to such a degree that he’s decided to set up his own beauty salon to earn new income and also be able to tend to all his customers.  This is why Eider will use the loan to provide all that’s needed to equip his beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his beauty salon.

loans.name: Houenoussou 1 Group

texts.en:
The 16 entrepreneurs in this group live in the Sémé-Podji district of Cotonou, Benin's economic centre.  They run similar businesses, and also arrange social events together. This is their first loan with ALIDE.

Elisabeth (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1973 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital. She moved to her current location 12 years ago, and now lives with her husband Thomas and the two of their six children who are still at home. All of their children have been to school.  Since moving to Cotonou Elisabeth has run a stall selling food at a local park. This loan will enable her to purchase wheat, condiments, and rice to prepare her food for sale. Her aim in the long term is to build her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Concepcion A. tiene 61 años de edad, vive en el barrio el Chile y trabaja en la empresa Expresarte como jefe de encuadernacion desde hace 7 años.
Maria es una mujer luchadora y con muchos deseos de superacion, su meta siempre a sido terminar de construir su casa y poco a poco a avanzado en la misma. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de puertas y ventanas las cuales instalara en la sala, cuartos y baños.
Maria nos comento que ya le falta poco para dejarla como ella desea, su siguiente paso es pintarla y asi poco a poco terminara de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Maria Concepcion A. is 61 years old and lives in Chile neighborhood.  She works for the company Expresarte as head of binding.  She has been in this job for 7 years.

Maria is a real fighter and she has a great desire to improve herself.  Her goal has always been to finish building her home and she has gradually made progress in this.

Maria will use her loan to buy doors and windows which she will install in her sitting room, bedrooms and bathrooms.  Maria tells us that she doesn't have much work left to do in order to have things as she would like them.  Her next step is to paint her house and gradually finish it.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi K. sells maize, gari and beans in a village called Ntranoa, near Elmina town. Gari is a couscous-like dish made from cassava. She has been doing this for 25 years. Esi is married with five children. Her income goes to supporting the family.
 
She plans to grow her business to increase her income. The loan will be used to buy larger volumes of maize, gari and beans to boost her sales. She’ll save up the additional profits from her business for her children’s further education.

loans.use: to buy larger volumes of maize, gari (processed cassava) and beans to boost her sales

loans.name: Houenoussou 2 Group

texts.en:
The 13 entrepreneurs in this group live in the Sémé-Podji district of Cotonou, Benin's economic centre.  They run similar businesses, and also arrange social events together. This is their first loan with ALIDE.

Hortance (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1979 in Cotonou. She moved to her current location 7 years ago, and now lives with her husband Geames and their five children, all of whom are in school.  Since moving to Cotonou Hortance has run a stall selling shoes and miscellaneous items. This loan will enable her to increase her stock of shoes from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim in the near term is to build her credit limit.

loans.use: to increase her stock of shoes

loans.name: Louis

texts.fr:
louis est un commerçant de HOPE Congo de 48 ans, célibataire et père de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 6 à 22 ans.
il débute son commerce en 2002 dans vente de la quincaillerie. En moyenne il vend environ 5000 a 50.000frs par jours. 

Avec le second prêt, il compte renforcer son stock  en achetant des interrupteurs, des fusibles, des sanitaires, des robinets, des ampoules. 

A l’ avenir il pense ouvrir un grand magasin, voyager aller acheter de la marchandise en Afrique de l'ouest.
texts.en:
Louis is a 48-year old businessman belonging to Hope, Congo. He is single and father to three children, whose ages range from six to 22 years old. He began his business selling hardware in 2002. He has an average daily turnover of around 5,000 to 50,000 francs. 

With this second loan, he is planning to replenish his stock by buying light switches, fuses, toilets, taps and light bulbs.

He is thinking of opening a large shop in the future and of travelling in West Africa to buy his goods.

loans.use: to purchase fuses, taps and light-bulbs

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua F. is married and has five children. Her husband is a trader, and they live in Ntranoa near the town of Elmina.

Ekua runs a small store from which she sells things like soap, detergent and food items. She has been in business for eight years. Her earnings help pay for their household expenses.

Ekua wants to grow her business and so is asking for a loan. She intends to use the loan to buy a greater variety of goods to grow her customer base and sales. She intends to save her profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of goods

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua Y. is from Ntranoa, a village near the town of Elmina. For the past eight years, Ekua has been selling fruits, vegetables and soaps to help support her family. Her husband is a carpenter, and they have three children. Her income pays for their children’s school fees and their home utility bills.

Ekua is keen to grow her business and needs a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to increase her sales. Any additional profits she earns will be reinvested in her business for further expansion.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Esi Comfort Fosuah

texts.en:
Esi Comfort Fosuah A. is a divorcee with six children. As the sole breadwinner for her family, she earns her income by selling cooked yams in Abrafo, a village near Abura. She has been in this business for six years now.

Esi is looking to grow her business to increase her income. She plans to use the loan to purchase more yams and other ingredients to increase her sales. Any additional profits she earns will be ploughed back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more yams and other ingredients to increase her sales.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen T. sells second-hand clothes and cooking utensils in Abrafo, near the town of Abura.  She has been doing this for a year. Married to a driver, she and her husband have one child. Her earnings help pay household expenses. 

She wants to improve her earnings and plans to do so by expanding her business. The loan will help her purchase more goods for sale. Queen plans to reinvest any additional profits back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for resale.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
la sra. Teresa A. G. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en el barrio el Chile de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, Teresa se dedica a prestar los servicios de costurera, hace todo tipo de ropa para dama y caballero, sus mejores clientes son las mujeres ya que les elabora las prendas de vestir a la medida.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra e instalacion de un tanque para almacenar agua ya que en la zona en donde ella vive es muy escaso ese vital liquido,  a veces solo llega el agua dos veces por semana y es complicado para ella y para su familia el estar sin agua.
con este tanque tendra una mejor calidad de vida y salud para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa A. García, 38, lives in Tegucigalpa’s Chile neighborhood.  She is a Seamstress.  She makes all types of clothes for women and men.  Her best customers are women because she makes their items of clothing to order.

She will use the loan to buy and install a tank to store water because in the area where she lives this vital liquid is very scarce; sometimes water only comes twice a week and it’s problematic for her and for her family to be without water.  This tank will provide a better quality of life and health for her family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Eva Veronica

texts.es:
Eva de 35 años, es mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones a futuro. Empezó con la venta de arroz hace 10 años. Le gusta esta actividad porque le dedica más tiempo a sus hijos y esposo.

Su esposo le ayuda en las ventas en su camión y es mecánico.Con el prestamo desea  comprar quintales de arroz para mejorar su productividad.En un futuro lo que más desea es terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Eva, 35, is a hard-working woman with many aspirations for the future.  10 years ago she started selling rice and she likes this work because she can dedicate more time to her children and husband.

Her husband, a mechanic, helps her with sales from his truck.  With the loan she wants to buy kilos of rice to improve her productivity.  In the future she would like to finish building her house.

loans.use: To buy kilos of rice.

loans.name: Paulette

texts.fr:
Paulette est  une commerçante de HOPE Congo de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l'âge varient entre 9 ans à 24 ans.

 Connaissant sa charge, elle s'est lancée dans la vente des vaisselles en 2000. Elle vend en moyenne 15000f a 50000 f par jour. 

Avec ce second prêt qu'elle souhaite recevoir elle tient a renforcer son commerce en achetant de la porcelaine de Chine; de Sèvres; des flutes a champagnes, des verres en cristal.

 Elle s'efforce à  aider sa famille afin de pouvoir subvenir aux études des enfants qui sont a au primaire et à l'université.
texts.en:
Paulette is a 44-year old businesswoman belonging to Hope, Congo. She is married and mother to two children of nine and 24 years old. Aware of her responsibilities, she set herself up selling crockery in 2000. She has an average daily turnover of 15,000 to 50,000 francs.

With this second loan she is hoping to be granted, she is aiming to build up her business by buying china and Sèvres porcelain, champagne flutes and crystal glasses. 

She is trying to help her family with the aim of paying for her children's studies at primary school and university respectively.

loans.use: to purchase glasses, champagne flutes and crockery

loans.name: Nana Jenet Ama

texts.en:
Nana Jenet Ama A. sells palm oil at Abrafo, near the town of Abura. She first purchases the palm fruit, then boils it (as shown in the photograph) before extracting the oil. The final product is then sold. She has finished senior high school and has been selling palm oil for four years. 

Nana has eight children and is married to a driver. Her income helps pay for household expenses. To provide a meaningful education for her eight children, Nana needs to improve her earnings. She will use the loan to expand her business: she plans to purchase more palm fruit to extract larger quantities of oil for resale. The additional profits will be saved up for education fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruit for making palm oil

loans.name: Houête Ayidekon Group

texts.en:
The Houête Ayidekon group consists of 29 women, who all live in the same neighborhood and have agreed to support each other in their businesses and loan repayments. This is their first loan with ALIDE as a group.

Odette (with her hand raised in the picture) is 51 years old, and has lived in Calavi all her life. She is married with six children. For 15 years she has run a stall from her home selling food supplies, and with this loan she hopes to restock her maize and spices.  Her ambition is to grow her product line, and she cites her management skills as her greatest strength.

loans.use: Purchasing spices and maize

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua M. sells second-hand clothing at Abrafo, a village near the town of Abura. She has been engaged in this business for 20 years. She and her husband, who is a farmer, have eight children. Whatever she earns selling second-hand clothes helps pay for her family’s utility bills and for the children’s education.

Efua wants to grow her business and plans to use the loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of clothes in order to meet the needs of her customers. The additional profits she earns will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity and variety of clothes in order to meet the needs of her customers

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. has worked for seven years as a vendor of salted fish and other food items, such as kenkey and salt. (Kenkey is a staple made from fermented cassava and maize dough.) She sells her wares at Abrafo, near the town of Abura. In this picture, Ama his holding Fante kenkey in her right hand and bagged salt in her left.

Ama is a widow and is her family’s sole breadwinner. To support her family, she needs to increase her earnings. Her loan will be used to buy greater varieties of fish in order to attract more customers. The new profits will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to buy greater varieties of fish in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Rosario Regina

texts.es:
Rosario de 45 años, es una mujer trabajadora  empezó su negocio con una pequeña vitrina. Un día  realizo un crédito en la fundación para mejora su vivienda e incrementar su mercadería.

Ella trabaja sola todo el día vendiendo productos como azúcar, detergente y colas. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuaderno, hojas, porta retratos, etc.  Para en un futuro mejorar y surtir su negocio para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosario, 45, is a hardworking woman who started her business with a small glass display case.  One day, she took a loan from the Fundación to make improvements to her house and to increase her merchandise.

She works by herself all day selling products such as sugar, detergent and soft drinks.  With the loan she wants to buy notebooks, paper, picture frames, etc., so that in the future she can have more products for her customers.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, paper and picture frames

loans.name: Naa

texts.en:
Naa A. is a single mother of two children. She supports her family by selling palm oil in Abrafo, a village near Abura. Naa has completed her junior high school education and has been selling palm oil for six years.

Naa wishes to grow her business and will use her loan to purchase larger quantities of palm fruit to extract more oil for sale. She plans to reinvest the additional profits in her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruit

loans.name: Anonio Jose

texts.es:
Antonio José nació en el campo y es por esto que conoce muy bien como criar animales y cultivar la tierra, es por esto que él iniciará el negocio de engorde de gallinas para la venta y producción de huevos, sin embargo Antonio solo podrá dedicar en horas de la tarde a esta labor ya que él también trabaja en una empresa en el cargo de oficios varios.

El quiere que sus hijos aprendan de esta labor y que sea su legado, por esto ellos serán quienes en la mañana cuiden de los animales y así además podrá tener otros ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio José was born in the countryside and so he knows very well how to raise animals and cultivate the land.  For this reason, he started a business fattening hens for sale and producing eggs.  However, Antonio can only work on these tasks in the evening as he also works for a company in several positions.

Antonio José would like his children to learn this trade and for it to be his legacy to them.  They will be the ones who raise the animals in the future.  In addition, it will enable Antonio José to make extra income to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Brield Silve Garclem

texts.fr:
Brield est un commerçant de HOPE Congo de 29ans célibataire sans enfant. Il se lance dans la vente des ustensiles de cuisine en 2004. Ses ventes sont de 15000frs à 40000frs. 

Avec ce second prêt il va renforcer son commerce en achetant des ustensiles de cuisine pour cérémonie. Il à un bon étalage de ses marchandises. 

Il aimerait devenir le plus grand fournisseur de Brazzaville. Il veut fonder une famille ainsi que être capable de bien nourrir ses enfants dans le futur. 

Dans son entourage on dit qu'il est courageux et sérieux.
texts.en:
Brield is a 29-year old businessman belonging to Hope, Congo; he has no children. He began selling kitchen utensils in 2004. He sells between 15,000 to 40,000 francs.

With this second loan he is going to strengthen his business by buying kitchen utensils for special occasions. He has a good display of goods. He would like to become the largest supplier in Brazzaille. He wants to create a family and be able to feed his children well in the future. Those people who know him well say he is courageous and serious.

loans.use: to buy glasses, china plates and saucepans

loans.name: Leonor Del Carmen

texts.es: En el departamento de la paz centro conocimos a la señora Leonor, se dedica a la venta de carne. Tiene más de 20 años en su negocio y mantiene a su hijo menor de edad que todavía está a su cargo. es en su vivienda donde tiene establecido su negocio, trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y a veces hasta más tarde los productos los obtiene a un precio accesible es por eso que quiere realizar un buen pedido. Este crédito lo va a emplear en la compra de carne de res, pollo, desmenuzada, lomo, hígado entre otro tipo de carnes. Su meta es apoyar a su hijo para que no tengan problemas en un futuro y sea un profesional.
texts.en:
In the center of the department of La Paz, we have gotten to know Leonor who sells meat.  She has had her business for more than 20 years, and she supports her minor son who is still her responsibility.  Her store is in her house.  Leonor works every day from 6:00 am until 7:00 pm at night, and at times even later.  She buys her products at an accessible price, and it is for this purpose that she wishes to acquire a loan.

The loan will be used to buy beef, chicken, ground meat, pork, and liver, among other types of meat.  Her goal is to help her son to become a professional, so that he will not have problems in the future.

loans.use: TO BUY BEEF, CHICKEN, GROUND MEAT, PORK, AND LIVER, AMONG OTHER TYPES OF MEAT, TO SELL

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama K. is a vendor of palm oil at Abrafo, a village near Abura. She has been in this business for four years. Ama completed her senior high school education. Her husband is a printer and they have four children. Whatever Ama earns helps pay for their utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

Ama’s goal is to grow her business. Her loan will be used to purchase more palm fruit so that she can extract more palm oil to offer for sale. Ultimately, she wants to save up enough to buy a piece of land for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit so that she can extract more palm oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Wangninagbe Group

texts.en:
The Wangninagbe group of 20 entrepreneurs all live in the same village of Avrankou, just outside Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. This is their first loan with ALIDE.

Joulienne (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1979 in Avrankou. She now lives with her husband Antoine and their three children.  For the past 20 years she has sold fruits and meals around her neighborhood. This loan will enable her to purchase fruits, palm nuts, corn and condiments for sale and as ingredients for meals. Her aim in the long term is to build a beautiful home. She claims to have a very strong entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, nuts, corn and condiments for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria A. D. tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 1 hijo que depende de ella, vive en la aldea Altos de la Cruz desde hace 14 años y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su pulperia que tiene desde hace 3 años, sus clientes son sus vecinos y amigos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria que no tiene en existencia y que son productos exigidos por sus clientes.
Doña  gloria es una mujer seria y de principios cristianos.
su meta es que su negocio crezca y que sea el mejor de la zona.
texts.en:
Gloria A. D., 40, is married and has one dependent child.  She has lived in the town of Altos de la Cruz for 14 years, and she has had a grocery store for 3 years.  Her customers are her neighbors and friends.  

She will use this loan to purchase groceries that she does not have in stock that are in demand by her customers.

Gloria is a serious woman with Christian values.  Her goal is to have her business grow and become the best in the area.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, milk, coffee, bread, cookies, soft drinks, juice, flour, tortillas, butter, margarine, cooking oil, sauces, pasta, toilet paper, soap, water, candles and batteries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase bolts of cloth and shoes for resale

loans.name: Zenelia Elvira

texts.es: Zenelia Elvira se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, pues es una persona responsable y además no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio. Zenelia se siente muy contenta por esta oportunidad que se le ha otorgado, la experiencia que ha obtenido por medio de su negocio ha sido muy satisfactorio ella ha demostrado que puede sacar adelante a su familia. Es por este motivo que solicita este crédito con el fin de comprar productos como perfumes, polvos, estuches, bolsos, sabanas, brillos, tratamientos entre otros productos.  Su sueño es tener un local mucho más grande en donde pueda ordenar mejor sus productos.
texts.en: Zenelia Elvira sells general merchandise. She has had this business for more than 11 years and is a responsible person. This is not the first time that she has financed her business. Zenelia is very happy for this opportunity that she has been granted. The experience she has obtained through her business has been very satisfying. She has shown that she can raise her family. This is why she is requesting this loan to buy products such as perfumes, powders, cases, bags, sheets, glosses and treatments among other products. Her dream is to have a much larger shop where she can better organize her products.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, powders, cases, bags, sheets, glosses, treatments and other products.

loans.name: Dede Wegni Gbe Group

texts.en:
This group of 11 entrepreneurs work in the same neighborhood of Saint-Cecile, a district of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. This is their second loan with ALIDE, following the successful repayment of the first. They have agreed to help each other in their businesses and loan repayments.

Philomène (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1989 in Sakete. She moved to her current location 4 years ago, and now lives with her husband Lucien. The couple do not yet have any children.  Since moving to Saint-Cecile, Philomène has run a beauty stall focusing on manicures and pedicures. This loan will enable her to purchase more products and equipment from Tokpa, Benin’s largest market. Her aim in the long term is to open a salon. Her greatest strengths are her perseverance and rigor in financial management.

loans.use: to purchase pedicure and manicure equipment

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel M. tiene 52 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene cinco hijos pero  ninguno depende de ella, vive en la aldea Altos de la Cruz desde hace 39 años y se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas y los fines de semana elabora tamales y pan casero. dicha actividad le a permitido salir adelante.
Sus hijos se encuentran fuera del pais.
doña Maria Isabel es una mujer de pocas palabras y muy seria.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales al por mayor para la fabricacion de las tortillas, a si le sale mas barato y obtiene mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel M. is 52 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and has five children, none of whom depend on her any more.  She has lived in the village of Altos de la Cruz for 39 years and her business is making and selling tortillas.  On the weekend she makes tamales and homemade bread.  This business has allowed her to get ahead in life.  Maria Isabel's children live out of the country.

Maria Isabel is a woman of few words and is very serious.  She will use her loan to buy supplies wholesale for making her tortillas.  In this way, her supplies work out cheaper and she makes more profits.

loans.use: to buy firewood, lime, corn and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Unidas Venceremos Group

texts.en:
Luisa is the president of her group, Unidas Venceremos 4 (United we'll win), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the areas surrounding San Pedro, and their community depends on tourists. It is a poor area where the economy used to thrive on sugar cane but has more recently waned, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. 

Luisa makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their three children. She is excited to be taking out her 4th loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to purchase calling cards, mobile phones, copy paper, etc. She operates a Cybercafé, where she offers services such as photocopying, internet access, and printing.  She also sells communications products like calling cards, cell phones and telephone line activation.  She will use the profits to further invest in her business, as clients always need more services and products. Her most important challenge is to improve her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy calling cards, mobile phones, copy paper, etc.

loans.name: Las Abejitas De Mayobamba Group

texts.en:
The rural communal bank Las Abejitas D. Mayobamba (the Little Bees of Mayobamba) is in its second loan cycle with Kiva partner, FINCA Peru. It is located in the Vinchos district of Ayacucho and most members have agriculture or livestock businesses.
Agustina is a member of the bank. She is married and has six children who are all studying. She is taking a loan of 500 PEN to transport cereal grains to sell at fairs in San Felipe. She also sells potatoes, wheat and barley at the markets/fairs. Agustina has used the proceeds from her business to educate her children and has also been able to purchase cows. She would like to construct a house and have her children continue studying. She would also like to have her own stO. one day to make mO. profits.

loans.use: to transport cereal grains to sell at market and fairs

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.en:
This group of 11 entrepreneurs live in the same neighbourhood in the Saint Cecile district of Cotonou, Benin's economic centre. This is their second loan with ALIDE, following the successful repayment of their first. They have agreed to support each other in their businesses and loan repayments.  

Josephine (with her hand raised in the photo) is 25 years old and lives with her husband Gamei, a fisherman. Together they support their three children.  Since the age of 11 Josephine has worked selling sandwiches. This loan will enable her to purchase bread, butter, avocados and condiments from the local bakery. Her aim in the long term is to build her business to become self-sufficient. She states that her greatest attributes are her dynamism and creative spirit in building her business.

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
Gloria de 49 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Comenzó con la tienda desde que su cuñado era el dueño y debido a una mala administración ella la compro para tener mejores ingresos. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Vende en su tienda detergentes, bebidas, aceite, arroz. Tiene muchas aspiraciones de seguir trabajando ya que tiene tres hijos de 24, 22 y 10 años de edad y quiere darles una buena economía. Por eso quiere el préstamo para surtir su tienda con bebidas.
texts.en:
Gloria, 49, is a hard-working woman who owns a small corner shop that she operates from her house.  Her brother-in-law used to run the business but he wasn't a good manager and Gloria took over.  

Gloria now works from 6:30am to 11:00pm seven days a week.  She sells detergents, soft drinks, cooking oil, rice, etc.  She wants to make a success of the business because she has three children--24-, 22- and 10-years old, respectively--and she wants to provide for them.  She's applying for a loan to buy soft drinks that she will resell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for corner shop

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: Héctor es agricultor desde hace 20 años y trabaja con ganado y la venta de leche, esta forma de trabajo es la que le ha permitido tener el sustento para su familia, por esto necesita comprar 2 vacas mas para poder incrementar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Hector has been a farmer for 20 years.  He raises cattle and produces milk.  The business has allowed him to support his family.  He is applying for a loan to buy two cows so that he can increase his output and, in turn, his income.  The extra income will improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy milk cows for farming business

loans.name: Ayiminasso 2 Group

texts.en:
The Ayiminasso 2 group of 20 entrepreneurs all live in the same village outside the rural centre of AllaD.. This is their first loan with ALIDE.

Philomène (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1976 in AllaD.. She moved to her current village 8 years ago, and now lives with her husband Laurent and one of their two children, both of whom have been to school.  For the past 25 years Philomène has run a stall selling corn in the village. This loan will enable her to purchase three sacs of corn from Cotonou, Benin’s economic centre, two hours away from AllaD.. Her aim in the long term is to grow her business to be able to fully support her family’s needs. She claims to be rigorous and dynamic in her approach to business.

loans.use: to purchase sacs of corn

loans.name: Féhintola

texts.fr: Monsieur Féhintola exerce comme activité la vente de pièces détachées et tire assez se revenus pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Il a commencé depuis 2003 et s’approvisionne en gros au grand marché de Lomé. Il revend les pièces dans un magasin à Hedzranawoé. Il est très accueillant ce qui l’aide à avoir du jour au lendemain plus de clients. Aussi il a employé dans le magasin 2 personnes qui l’aident. Il demande un prêt pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants. Il habite quartier Yayrakomé, un quartier périphérique de Lomé.
texts.en: Mr. Féhintola is in the business of selling spare parts and generates enough income to support his family. He has been in business since 2003 and buys his merchandise wholesale at the large market in Lomé. He then sells the parts in a store in Hedzranawoé. He is very welcoming which helps him have a very loyal clientele. Also, he has two employees that help him with the store. He is asking for a loan in order to handle the increasing demand for his products. He is married and has four children.  He lives in the Yayrakomé neighborhood in the outskirts of Lomé.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Erika Mercedes

texts.es: Erika Mercedes vive en el municipio de la paz centro con sus dos hijos en la edades de 3 y 5 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos varios como bolsitas, bolis, hielo, refrescos, leña, frijoles cocidos, verduras entre otros.  Esta actividad inicio al quedar desempleada y no obtener una fuente de ingreso para su hogar y mantener a sus hijos, por el buen carisma logró conseguir muchos clientes, ya que en la actualidad hay mucha competencia, pero es algo que sabido manejar. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda, para dejarles a sus hijos un lugar donde vivir. Este crédito es para la compra de bolsas, frutas, frijoles, bolis, leña entre otros.
texts.en: Erika Mercedes lives in central La Paz with her two children, 3- and 5-years old, respectively.  She operates a business selling everyday commodities such as "bolsitas" (could be teabags, but not clear), pens, ice, soft drinks, firewood, beans, vegetables, etc.  She started the business when she was out of work and didn't have enough money to support herself or her children.  People are drawn to her and she's managed to build a large customer base because of it.  There's a lot of competition among businesses like her, but she's learned to cope.  Her dream is to make improvements to her hosue so that her children have a decent place to live.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise that she will resell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina, D. 46 años, es una mujer muy humilD. y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Evaristo D. 55 años y su hijo Níkel D. 8 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. El trabajo al que Albina se dedica, es el cultivo D. papa, maíz, habas y arvejas. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga D. la venta D. su cosecha, dependerá mucho D. la calidad D. sus productos. Ella venD. sus cultivos en el mercado D. Tarma, puesto que es donD. mejor le pagan. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses D. trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre corre el peligro D. que los químicos afecten su salud. En adelante, sembrará en todas sus tierras, pata obtener mejores ingresos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso D. su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto D. sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Albina is 46 years old.  She is a very modest and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 55 year-old Evaristo, and her son, 8 year-old Nikel.  She would like to proviD. her husband and son with a better quality of life.

Albina's business is growing potatoes, corn, beans and peas.  Every day, very early in the morning, she works on her crops since she knows that the money she makes from the sale of her harvests depends greatly on the quality of her produce.  Albina sells her crops in Tarma market since that is where they pay her the most.  What she most likes about her work is harvesting her land since that is when she feels that the months of work have borne fruit.  Albina has been in this business for 15 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be spraying her land since she always runs the risk of the chemicals affecting her health.

In the future, Albina will sow crops on all of her land in order to make more income.  This is her eighth loan from MFP and she says that this support will help her a lot in making progress in her work.  Albina is a very well-liked member of her community bank since she is very supportive of her fellow members.  She will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more manure for her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Jessica Johana

texts.es:
La señora Jessica Johana A. tiene 27 años de edad, esta casada pero no tiene hijos.
Jessica se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion y lo tiene desde hace unos 4 años.

nos comento que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas y que su negocio a ido creciendo poco a poco y espera que siga igual o mejor.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor, desea comprar porductos que se estan moviendo rapido y queda sin existencia rapido y por falta de fondos no los ha podido comprar.
Jessica espera que para la epoca de verano sus ventas se incrementen y tener mejores utilidades.
su mayor deseo es tener un hijo.
texts.en:
Jessica Johana A. is 27 years old and married but doesn't have any children.  Jessica's business is selling personal care products.  Her business is located in her home and she has run it for 4 years.

Jessica tells us that her sales have been very good and her business has gradually grown.  She hopes that things will continue in the same way or even improve.  Jessica will use her loan to buy merchandise wholesale.  She would like to buy products that are selling quickly and which, through a lack of funds, she hasn't been able to buy more of.

Jessica hopes that her sales will increase over the summer and that she will make better profits.  Her biggest desire is to have a child.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, conditioners, soap, toothpaste, deodorants, hair gel, sandals, thongs (flip-flops) and body oil

loans.name: Nicolas Alonso

texts.es: Nicolás de 59 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene un negocio de servicio de reparación de bicicletas. Comenzó su negocio hace diez años cuando él se jubilo, pues siempre ha sido un hombre activo y necesitaba una actividad para mantenerse ocupado es por eso que decide establecerse con este negocio. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo mejorar su local de trabajo. En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano, el es muy conocido en su localidad y todos sus clientes saben del buen servicio que ofrece. Este crédito es para la compra de llantas, asientos, calcomanías, cadenas y acondicionar su lugar de trabajo. En el futuro quiere tener más ingresos para asegurar su futuro
texts.en:
Nicolás is 59 years old.  He is a hard-working man who has a bicycle repair business.  He started his business ten years ago when he retired since he has always been an active man and he needed something to keep himself occupied.  This is why he decided to set up his business.  Gradually, with a lot of effort and dedication, he managed to improve his work premises.  He currently works from very early in the morning.  He is very well known in his town and all his customers are aware of the good service that he offers.

Nicolás will use this loan to buy tires, seats, decals and chains, and to fit out his work premises.  In the future, he would like to make more income so that he can secure his future.

loans.use: to buy tires, seats, decals and chains, and to fit out his work premises

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 28 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Luis de 27 años y su querida hija Tania de 3 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Los hermosos campos del poblado natal de Elizabeth, han sido en su vida el lugar que la ha visto crecer y forma su familia, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus papas, arvejas y habas, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el lugar donde los vende en el mercado de Tarma. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Dentro su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 28 years old.  She is a very simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 27 year-old Luis, and her beloved 3 year-old daughter Tania, who she would like to provide with a better future.  The beautiful countryside surrounding Elizabeth's home town has been an important place in her life.  This is where she grew up and also where she formed her family.  When she was a very young girl, Elizabeth's parents taught her to work on the farm and now she has her own land which she works with a lot of care and sacrifice.

What Elizabeth most enjoys about her work is growing her potatoes, peas and beans.  She has been in this business for 8 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her crops to the market in Tarma where she sells them.  Over time, Elizabeth would like to buy new farmland, in order to increase her production.

This is Elizabeth's eighth loan with MFP.  She knows that she must make all of her repayments on time and she is prepared to do this.  Elizabeth is always up to date with all the agreements that are reached in her community bank.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of manure

loans.name: Philomene's Group

texts.en:
This group of seven entrepreneurs live in the same neighborhood of Toyoyome, a district in Cotonou, Benin's largest city. This is their sixth loan with ALIDE, and they have agreed to support each other in their businesses and loan repayments.

Philomene (with her hand raised in the photo) is 56 years old. She and her husband David, a fisherman, still support one of their five children.  For the past 30 years Philomene has been selling fresh fish at the Tokpa market, Benin's largest. This loan will enable her to purchase stock in bulk to resell to individuals. Her aim in the long term is to grow her business. Her strongest point as an entrepreneur is her care in growing her business, and her rigor with finances.

loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk for resale

loans.name: Jacqueline Lujan

texts.es:
Jacqueline de 40 años, tiene una pequeña papelería. En donde vende cuadernos, plumas, ropa, artículos de bazar etc. 

Comenzó con su papelería con la ayuda de un dinero que tenía. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.
