Los artículos que vende son muy económicos por eso mucha gente conoce su negocio. Tiene muchas aspiración con su papelería pero por ahora quiere construir mejor su casa por eso requiere el préstamo para comprar cemento y piedras.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 40 years old. She has a small stationary store. She sells notebooks, pens, clothes and other items found at bazaars. 

She started her store with money she already had. She works from eight am to nine pm every day. The products she sells are very inexpensive so lots of people visit her store. She has lots of goals for her stationary store but right now, she wants improve her house. She is requesting the loan to purchase cement and stones.

loans.use: to purchase cement and stones

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita Terán F. de  70 años y con 8 hijos es una mujer  emprendedora,  propietaria de un negocio,  que consiste en la distribución de víveres a domicilio y en su mayoría a crédito,  con cuentas por cobrar que  rotan cada 27 días.  Sus principales productos a la venta son: arroz, aceite, azúcar, café y en general productos de la canasta familiar  que compran las amas de casa,  para el  consumo  diario en su hogar.  Margarita con su negocio ha logrado generar, desde hace mucho tiempo  ingresos para su familia  y por eso  siempre está en función de ampliarlo y fortalecerlo; de esta manera ha realizado  17 financiamientos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  organización que le ha aportado al  sostenimiento de su negocio con  un capital de trabajo financiado, y Margarita  mediante su trabajo ha logrado transformarlo en utilidades y resolver situaciones difíciles  relacionadas al ingreso familiar,  que gradualmente ha ido superando. Su meta ahora es adecuar la infraestructura de su vivienda,  para continuar mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia, pues como mujer cabeza de ella estará insistiendo siempre en este tema.  Con su credikiva comprará mercancía variada como cubrelechos y ropa para niños, porque quiere fortalecer su apertura a otros productos, que venderá en nuevos mercados, augurando una inversión exitosa,  en términos de que el margen esperado supera el promedio  actual  que está en un 36,6%, por eso siente que su negocio es muy atractivo y cuida mucho de él.
texts.en:
Margarita Terán F. is 70 years old, and she has eight children.  She is an enterprising woman, and she has a business delivering food to homes.  She does this mostly on credit, and she manages an accounts receivable cycle of 27 days.

The main products that she sells are rice, oil, sugar, and coffee.   Generally speaking, she sells the basic necessities that  housewives buy for daily consumption in their homes.  For a long time Margarita has managed to generate income for her family through her business.  Therefore, she is always in the process of expanding and strengthening it.  

She has had 17 loans with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  This organization has contributed to supporting her business with working capital.  Through her work Margarita has managed to transform the loans into profits.  She has also solved and gradually overcome difficult situations concerning the family income. 

Her goal now is to improve the infrastructure of her house in order to continue improving her family’s living conditions.  As a woman, her thoughts will always be on this matter.

She will use her Kiva loan to buy varied merchandise like bedspreads and children’s clothing.  She wants to do this to strengthen her opening to other products that she will sell in new markets.  She predicts that it will be a successful investment.  In terms of the profit margin, it is expected to pass the current average, which is at 36.6%.  That is why she feels that her business is very attractive, and she takes good care of it.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise like bedspreads and children's clothing

loans.name: Seneyda Claribel

texts.es: La señora Seneyda Claribel tiene 23 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener. Seneyda tiene una pulpería desde hace 1 año en donde vende shampoo, abarrotería, sandalias, sopas, golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, jugos y detergentes. Su negocio lo abre de lunes a domingo, atiende desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de productos varios y así surtir más su negocio. su nivel de vida es bueno, tiene lo necesario y su mayor deseo es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Seneyda Claribel, age 23, is a very hardworking young woman. With a lot of effort she has succeeded in supporting herself. Seneyda has had a convenience store for 1 year where she sells shampoo, groceries, sandals, soups, sweets, soft drinks, juices, and detergents. Her business is open from Monday to Sunday from 7:00 in the morning until 9:00 at night.

She will use the loan to buy various products to stock her business better. Her standard of living is good. She has the necessities of life, and her greatest desire is to continue growing with her business.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, groceries, sandals, soups, sweets, soft drinks, juices, and detergents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of stock for her store

loans.name: Maricela Pascuala

texts.es:
Maricela de 34 años, Es una mujer trabajadora  que ha salido adelante en su pequeña papelería  por medio de una liquidación que recibió. Y con préstamo que hizo en la fundación la estuvo incrementando poco a poco.

Ella trabaja todo el día antes la ayudaba su mama desde que falleció lo hace sola. Una de sus dificultades en su negocio es la delincuencia que hay en el sector. Es madre soltera tiene dos hijos de 6 y 8 años. Con el préstamo quiere aumentar su productividad  en artículos de primera necesidad. 

Una de sus metas es tener una tienda muchos más grande y surtido, en conjunto con la papelería. Y darle lo mejor a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maricela, age 34, is a hardworking woman who has made progress in her small stationary shop. Thanks to severance pay that she received and a loan when she began the business it has grown little by little. She works every day. Previously her mother helped her, but since her mother died Maricela works alone. One of the major difficulties for her business is crime in the area. She is a single mother who has two children, ages 6 and 8.

With the loan she wants to increase her productivity by acquiring basic stationary items. One of her goals is to have a much bigger shop stocked as a stationary store. She also wants to give a better education to her children.

loans.use: to acquire basic stationary items.

loans.name: Enrique Hernan

texts.es:
Enrique Hernan tiene 37 años, Es divorciado vive solo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada EN EL RECINTO Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas en ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Enrique se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz por mas de 10 años. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir progresando en la agricultura.

Le gusta hacer mucho deporte.
texts.en:
Enrique Hernan is 37 years old, divorced and lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.  He has two children.

The communal bank "V.R.C. NUEVA UNION" is located in Guamayacu which belongs to the Echeandia canton.  This farm group mainly grows short-cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Enrique has been growing corn and rice for over 10 years.  He buys his supplies in Comercial Murillo and sells his produce in the same place.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizer for his corn and rice crops.  This financial support helps him meet his needs.  He is up against challenges such as plagues, sickness and weather change.  His dream is to become more successful in his agricultural business.

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer for crops

loans.name: David Oswaldo

texts.es:
David Oswaldo B. L. tiene 31 años, Es casado vive con la esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. No  Tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada EN EL RECINTO Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas en ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

David se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio.

Le gusta hace deporte.
texts.en:
David Oswaldo B. L. is 31 years old, married and lives with his wife in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.  He has no children.

The communal bank "V.R.C. NUEVA UNION" is located in Guamayacu which belongs to the Echeandia canton. This farm group mainly grows short-cycle crops such as corn and rice.

David grows corn and rice. He buys his supplies in Comercial Murillo and sells his produce in the same place.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizer for his corn and rice crops. This financial support helps him meet his needs. He is up against challenges such as plagues, sickness and weather change. His dream is to become more successful in his agricultural business.

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.en:
Marguerite is 40 years old and lives in the Agboton district of Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. Together with her husband Michel she looks after their three children, all of whom are in school.

For the past 13 years Marguerite has run a general store out of her home. This is her fourth loan with ALIDE, following successful repayments of past loans, and it will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Cotonou, Benin's economic centre. Her ambition is to build her own home.  She claims to have a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to restock a variety of items in her store

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania, de 53 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Bernabé de 59 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Junto a su esposo, Epifania trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de muy buena calidad. Ella principalmente siembra papa, alfalfa y arveja, ya que estos productos se están vendiendo muy bien en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito la ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa.
Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Epifania, age 53, is a humble and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Bernabé, age 59. What she desires most is to work hard so that she can get ahead in life. Together with her husband, Epifania works every day tending to her crops. Through her efforts, her land has generated productive returns. Now that she has planted everything, she knows that all of her products will be of good quality. Her main crops are potatoes, alfalfa, and peas. These products sell very well at the market. What she enjoys most about her work is protecting her crops from diseases that could affect them. Epifania has been farming for 35 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops to the wholesale market in Tarma where they are sold. For the future of her business, she wants to buy additional farmland so that she can increase her production.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. Epifania believes this loan will be a great help in developing her business. She is known in her Communal Bank as a very responsible member, a distinction of which she is proud. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy compost to improve the productivity of her land.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice, beverages, detergents, soft drinks, bread, soups, and canned goods.

loans.name: Antonio Edalberto

texts.es:
Antonio Edalberto tiene 48 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.   Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada EN EL RECINTO Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas en ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un  carro para el trabajo.

Le gusta hace deporte y salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Antonio Edalberto is 48 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.  He has three children.

The communal bank "V.R.C. NUEVA UNION" is located in Guamayacu which belongs to the Echeandia canton. This farm group mainly grows short-cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Antonio grows corn and rice. He buys his supplies in Comercial Murillo and sells his produce in the same place.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizer for his corn and rice crops. This financial support helps him meet his needs. He is up against challenges such as plagues, sickness and weather change. His dream is to become more successful in his agricultural business.

He enjoys sports going out with his family.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa M. has worked as a hairdresser in Abrafo, a village near Abura, for two years. She attended school up to the junior high level. She is the single mother of one child. 

Adjoa wants to expand her business and will use the loan to purchase more hair products to meet the needs of her existing customers as well as to grow her customer base. Her long-term goal is to save up enough to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more hair products to meet the needs of existing customers as well as to grow her customer base

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. sells gari (a type of flour made from cassava) at Abrafo, a village near Abura. She has been in this business for six years. In the photograph, Abena is shown preparing gari. 

Abena's husband is a farmer and they have eight children. Abena’s income from selling gari helps pay for utility bills and school fees. 

To expand her business, she will use the loan to purchase more cassava so that she can produce more gari to offer for sale. She plans to reinvest the profits back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava so that she can produce more gari to offer for sale

texts.en:
Mirian Guicela R. B. is 29 years old.  She lives with her partner and two children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

She will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own home.

Mirian enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Honorine

texts.en: Honorine is 36 years old and lives in the Chogohorou district of Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. Together with her husband Elias she looks after their five children.  For the past 10 years Honorine has run a general store selling items such as food and cooking oils. This is her third loan with ALIDE, following successful repayments of past loans, and it will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Ouando, a large local market. Her ambition is to purchase her own piece of land. She cites her courtesy and welcoming nature as her strongest attributes.

loans.use: to restock her general store

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua earns an income by selling fried fish in Abrafo village, near Abura. She has been in this business for three years. Her husband is a farmer and the couple has three children. Ekua's current earnings from selling fish help pay for the family’s utility bills and for the children’s education.
  
Ekua's goal is to increase her sales so that she can save up enough to purchase a cold store, which will allow her to preserve her fish longer. She will use the loan to buy larger quantities of fish to offer for sale and will set aside the additional revenue she earns to help her save for the cold store.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of fish to offer for sale

Nancy Alilian R. B. is 49 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and child in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The Nueva Unión community bank is located in Guamayacu, in Echeandia canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Nancy is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.  She is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  Nancy faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land so that she can continue growing crops.

Nancy enjoys watching television and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, Christina E. has supported her family by selling accessories such as hair bands, clips, elastic ponytail bands, and earrings. She currently sells her wares at Abrafo, a village near Abura, carrying them from customer to customer. 

She would like eventually to open her own shop. To realize this dream, she intends to improve her immedate sales by buying a greater variety and quantity of accessories to meet the needs of her customers and to grow her customer base. Additional profits will be reinvested into her business.   

Christine attended school up to the junior high level. She and her husband, who works as a driver, have five children.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of accessories to offer for sale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 46 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Héctor de 52 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, Julia ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papas, choclo y arveja, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de poder acceder a este crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para hacer más productivas sus tierras.
texts.en:
Julia, age 46, is a simple hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Héctor, age 52, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Julia works very hard on her farm to provide everything she needs to support her family. Before the first rays of sunlight appear, she leaves her house and walks almost an hour before reaching her land where she grows potatoes, corn, and peas. These products are eventually sold at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. What she enjoys most about her work is cultivating her land, which she feels has been put to good use. Julia has been farming for thirty years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to Tarma because the sacks are heavy and the work is tiring. Within time, she wants to buy additional farmland so that she can increase her production.

This is her second loan with MFP. Julia is pleased to access this loan and wants to express her appreciation to everyone who made it possible for her to obtain the money she needs. She is a well-respected member of her Communal Bank because she tries to keep the meetings orderly. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more compost to make her land more productive.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of compost.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua Y. sells fish in Abrafo, at a village near Abura. Her husband is a farmer and they have five children. Her income from selling fish helps pay for the family’s utility bills and the children’s school fees. She has been selling fish for five years. 

As shown in the photo, Ekua sells her fish by carrying it around the village and the market. She wants to grow her business. Her loan will be used to purchase more fish to sell to increase her income. Additional profits will be plowed back into her business for further expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to increase her income

For the past year Béatrice has sold firewood from her home to her neighbors. This is her first loan with ALIDE, and it will allow her to purchase firewood in bulk for resale. Her ambition is to build her own home. She claims her welcoming nature is her greatest attribute.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for resale

The Nueva Unión community bank is located in Guamayacu, in Echeandia canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Segundo is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.  He is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  Segundo faces challenges in his business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy farmland.

Segundo enjoys watching television and taking part in sports..

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Efia Constance Antwi

texts.en:
Efia Constance Antwi M. is a single mother from Abrafo village, near Abura. She supports her family and has one child. She sells palm oil. The process involves purchasing palm fruit, boiling it and then extracting the oil to sell. She has been in this business for two years. Efia Constance was educated up to a junior high school level. 
Her dream is to provide her child with a good education. In order to do so, she needs to grow her business. Currently, most of her earnings go towards household expenses. She plans to use the loan to purchase more palm fruit. She will reinvest the profits into her business and start saving up for her child’s education.

loans.use: She plans to use the loan to purchase more palm fruit.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 56 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Gabriel de 60 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. En su pequeño Patay, Marina ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar que es la agricultura y por eso, ahora se dedica al cultivo de papa, olluco, maíz y arveja, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 36 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista, ya que los transportes son muy escasos por su zona. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marina, age 56, is a hardworking and cheerful woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Gabriel, age 60. What she desires most is to work hard so that she can get ahead in life. Marina has spent most of her life in the small town of Patay. There she learned the family business of farming as a young girl. Now she grows potatoes, ulluco, corn, and peas. Her work has resulted in the necessary income to maintain her family. Everything she harvests is sold at the wholesale market in Tarma where she is able to obtain the best prices for her products. What she enjoys most about her work is sowing her land, which she does with great care. Marina has been farming for 36 years and considers the most difficult part to be getting her products to the wholesale market because transportation is limited in her area. Within time, she hopes to buy additional farmland so that she can increase production.

This is her third loan with MFP. Marina has been prompt with her loan payments and expects to continue in the same manner. In her Communal Bank, she is an active participant and greatly admired by the other members. The loan of 3000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more compost and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena K. is married to an electrician and they have two children. She has completed her junior high education. For the past six years, Abena has been a fishmonger and she makes a living selling fish in Abrafo, a village near Abura. 

In order to move her business to the next stage, Abena needs to build cold storage to preserve her fish longer. As a first step toward that goal, she needs to boost her sales. Abena is requesting a loan to buy larger quantities of fish to sell. She will use the profits from her loan to save for her cold storage.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of fish to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa M. is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa sells palm oil in Abrafo village. She has been in this business for over six years and is able to financially contribute to her household. 

Adjoa is requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing more palm fruit so that she can extract larger quantities of palm oil to sell. She will set aside her increased profits for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit and extract oil to sell

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.en:
Nathalie was born in 1975 in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. She now lives in the Sourou district with her husband Honore and their four children. All of their children are in school.

For the past 15 years Nathalie has run a stall outside her home selling various foods and household items. This is her fifth loan with ALIDE, following successful repayments of past loans, and it will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Ouando, a large market nearby. Her ambition is to buy her own piece of land.  She cites her welcoming nature as her strongest attribute.

loans.use: to purchase stock for resale

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is married to a farmer and they have seven children. Yaa sells palm oil in Abrafo, a village near Abura. She first purchases palm fruit (shown in the picture) and boils the fruit to extract the oil, which she then sells. 

Yaa is keen to grow her business and will use the loan to purchase more palm fruit so that she can extract more oil for sale. She plans to save up the additional profits to buy a piece of land for her family some day.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to extract more oil for sale.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, de 45 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Marleny de 40 años y sus 2 menores hijas Judith de 20 y Marita de 16 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que Orlando se dedica, es el cultivo de papa y arvejas, Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que mientras mejor calidad tengan sus productos, mejores precios obtendrá por sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre corre el peligro de que los químicos le causen alguna enfermedad. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras, para sembrar más. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y respetuoso. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de papa y arveja, por ser productos de temporada y lo que tiene mayor demanda en el mercado.
texts.en:
Orlando, age 45, is a simple hardworking man. He lives in his own home with his wife Marleny, age 40, and their two children, Judith (age 20) and Marita (age 16), who are the reason behind all of his efforts. Orlando earns his living by growing potatoes and peas. Every day, starting early in the morning, he works with his crops. He knows how to achieve high quality products so that he can obtain the best prices at the wholesale market in Tarma. What he enjoys most about his work is harvesting his crops because he gets to see the fruit of his labor after many months. After farming for thirty years, Orlando considers the most difficult part to be fumigating his land because there is always the risk that the chemicals will cause illness. Within time, he wants to buy more land so that he can grow more.

This is his tenth loan with MFP. Orlando says that this loan will be a great help in advancing his business. In his Communal Bank, he is a responsible and respectful member. The loan of 3000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy potato seedlings and pea seeds. The season for these products has arrived and there is greater demand at the market.

loans.use: To purchase potato seedlings and pea seeds.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua B., who is married to a farmer and has four children, runs a provisions store in Abrafo, near Abura, selling soaps, detergent, toilet paper, etc. Her income supplements her husband’s and helps to pay for utility bills and school fees.

Educated up to junior high school, Akua is keen to grow her business and will do so with this loan by purchasing more goods in quantity and variety to attract more customers. Her plan is to reinvest profits back into her store. Eventually, she wants to open a second shop in a different locality.

loans.use: to purchase more goods in quantity and variety to attract more customers.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is a borrower who lives in Santiago, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres Luchadoras (Fighting Women) 3, and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Ana and her husband have three children and live in a simple home in Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. Urban areas of the Dominican Republic are very overcrowded and can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate health care. Despite these difficulties, Ana runs a successful “miscellaneous” store, mostly selling clothing and shoes. With this loan, Ana plans to purchase clothing, shoes, perfume, accessories and jewelry to sell for a small profit to her friends and neighbors.

This is Ana’s fifth loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve the home life of her family. With the profits, she hopes to rebuild her home and reinvest in her business. 

Ana hopes to continue her dream as a businesswoman; she wants to have a very improved, big store. Thank you for lending to Ana and the Mujeres Luchadoras group!

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel, de 46 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Antonia de 51 años y esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro con tal de brindarle a su familia un mejor futuro. Siendo aún muy joven, Samuel sabe que tiene que poner todas sus fuerzas, para lograr ganarse la vida con su labor. Él se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja y gladiolo, productos que llegada la época de cosecha, llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde sus clientes, conocedores de la calidad de sus cultivos, los compran rápidamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas, lleva 28 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el mercado donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. En adelante, tiene el deseo de comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy participativo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de papa, gladiolo y arveja, también comprará abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Samuel, age 46, is a simple hardworking gentleman. He lives in his own home with his wife Antonia, age 51. Samuel is willing to work extremely hard so that he can provide his family a better future. Even as a young man, he knew that he had to put forth all of his effort into earning a living. Samuel grows potatoes, peas, and gladiolas. When these products are harvested, he sells them at the wholesale market in Tarma where he has customers who buy up his goods quickly because they are familiar with the quality of his crops. What he enjoys most about his work is protecting his crops from diseases. Samuel has been farming for 28 years and considers the most difficult part to be carrying his harvest to the market to be sold because the sacks are very heavy. Going forward, he wants to buy additional farmland so that he can plant more crops.

This is his ninth loan with MFP. Samuel knows that he must submit his payments on time if he wants to access subsequent loans. He is an active participant in his Communal Bank. The loan of 2000 PEN that he requested will be used to purchase potato, gladiola, and pea seeds. He will also buy compost and insecticides.

loans.use: To purchase compost, insecticides, and seeds for planting potatoes, gladiolas, and peas.

loans.name: Nora Alexis

texts.es:
La señora Nora Alexis L. A. tiene 44 años de edad, esta soltera y vive en la aldea El Guayabo Numero 1, Nora se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en general y granos basicos en el mercado municipal de San Lorenzo.
Doña nora se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años y su negocio le a dado buenos frutos y se siente muy satisfecha con su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria al por mayor y asi tener mas surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Nora Alexis L. A. is 44 years old, single, and lives in the neighborhood of El Guayabo Number 1. She sells groceries and dry goods at the municipal market in San Lorenzo.

Doña Nora has been in this business for several years and achieved good results. She is very satisfied with her business. This loan will be used to buy groceries in bulk so that her business will be well-stocked.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Patricia Alexandra

texts.es:
Patricia de 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora  que inicio hace 6 años en un puesto pequeño  le gusta conversar con la gente y promocionar su producto.

Ella sale a su local en la bahía 6 días a la semana. Un día se la dedica a su hogar con su familia. Algunas veces sus hijos la apoyan en el negocio cuando están de vacaciones.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar prenda de vestir para el mejoramiento de su negocio , lo que más desea  es tener una casa más cómoda para ella y su familia y tener su negocio mas surtido para tener mas ventas y poder darles lo mejor  a sus hijos en lo que necesite.
texts.en:
Patricia, age 32, is a hardworking woman who started a small clothing stand six years ago. She enjoys talking with people and promoting her products.

Patricia sells from her shop in La Bahía six days a week. One day is set aside so that she can be at home with her family. Sometimes her children will help with the business whenever they are on vacation.

With this loan, Patricia will buy clothing to improve her business. What she wants most is to have a more comfortable home for her and her family as well as a well-stocked business to help her generate more sales and give her children what they need to have a better life.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro J. owns "Pete’s Enterprises, LLC", a repair and salvage company. The bulk of Pete’s (Pedro's) business comes from repairing outdoor power equipment, e.g., lawn mowers, weed eaters, power sprayers, or anything else with a small engine. Pete picks up, repairs, and returns the equipment for one price. If the customer decides not to have Pete fix the equipment, Pete charges a small fee to compensate for his time and fuel. If the customer has Pete fix the equipment, Pete waives the consultation charge. Pete keeps his advertising costs low, preferring instead to let his reputation bring him business. With approximately 500 clients, Pete says he stays busy throughout the lawn care season, which in Texas usually lasts nine months. When winter comes, Pete does home repairs for his customers. He says that he does all general repairs except work that requires extensive electrical or plumbing know-how. On average, he says that about 75% of his business comes from repairing lawn equipment with about 25% from home repairs. Another aspect of Pete’s Enterprises is salvaging miscellaneous materials and items people no longer want. Through word of mouth, Pete says people learn to call him when they have something they want to get rid of. He picks the items up and takes them to his store which serves as his repair shop and doubles as a storefront for the salvaged goods. He sells what he can, and gives the rest to individuals in need. This loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana serves as operating capital for Pete to meet business expenses. Even with the home repairs that Pete does, business is slower for Pete during the winter. Pete keeps a full array of parts in his inventory at all times. This loan helps Pete buy inventory so that he is ready when the lawn-mowing season gets under way. Eventually, Pete wants to hire a full-time associate whom he can train to help him handle the volume of service calls. He advertises through Yellow Pages which has his business’ information and also shows customer feedback. Check it out at the link below: http://www.yellowpages.com/sugar-land-tx/mip/petes-mobile-lawnmower-shop-451306589.

loans.use: to buy inventory and for operating expenses.

loans.name: Mujeres De Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yeimi is one of the members of the “Mujeres de Esperanza 1 y 2” (Women of Hope 1 and 2) group which has 10 micro businesswomen who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, etc. Her family is composed of herself, her husband and two children. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is collecting from customers that owe her.

Yeimi is very excited to get her second loan from Esperanza Internacional having successfully repaid her previous loan and taken a step towards her business’ growth. She has had her business for about 10 years; she started it by using her savings to buy clothing to sell.

Yeimi is planning to use her new loan to buy jeans, blouses, underwear, and shirts. She will use her profits to reinvest in her business and continuing savings. Her dream is to have her own store and a family.

This Esperanza associate started with us because she is interesting to progress with her business and she will do it thought the loans. Her history is being used to exemplify the other group members as well as clients of Esperanza, both the Haitians (who for the most part have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them quite recently) as well as the Dominicans who generally live in very poor communities like this zone, and many others like it in the Dominican Republic which have few resources; they lack drinking water and reliable electricity.

This group is located in an area of few resources called Puerto Plata, a city whose economy depends primarily on real estate and tourism, although the latter has recently been overshadowed by new, emerging tourist areas.

loans.use: to buy jean, blouses, underwear, and shirts

loans.name: Mercy Angelita

texts.es:
Mercy de 23 años, es una joven que tiene gran aspiración de salir adelante con la ayuda de su padre empezaron a vender cangrejo en tarrina.

Ella trabaja diariamente sacando la carne de los cangrejos para venderlos en tarrinas. La dificultad de su trabajo es que cuando está en veda o esta caro los cangrejos. Con el préstamo quiere  la compra de cangrejos para mejorar su negocio. En su futuro ella quiere mejora su casa y así sacar adelante a sus hijos en lo que necesite.
texts.en:
Mercy, age 23, is a young woman who has great ambition to succeed with the help of her father. They have started a business selling crabs by the tub.

She works every day removing the meat from the crabs before selling it in containers. Her main difficulties occur when crab season is closed or when the price of crabs gets expensive. With this loan, Mercy wants to buy crabs to improve her business. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her home and see that her children have what they need to get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase crabs.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa O. A. tiene 53 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Jose y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria y frutas, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado nuevo de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor, con esto obtiene mejores precios de compra y mas ganancias.
su negocio es el puesto numero 71 en el mercado municipal de san lorenzo.
su meta es hacer crecer mas su negocio y asi poder obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Luisa O. A., age 53, lives in the neighborhood of San Jose. She sells groceries and fruits from her business at the new market in the city of San Lorenzo.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise in bulk since she can obtain better prices, which will help her earn more. Her business is located at vending stall #71 of the municipal market in San Lorenzo. Her goal is to grow her business even more so that she can generate a better income, which she needs to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, honey, and natural medicines to sell in her store.

loans.name: Arevhat

texts.en: Arevhat is a hard-working hairdresser and has owned her own salon since 2005.  She lives with her retired mother and also supports her disabled brother. Business is good and Arevhat has many clients. She has applied for a loan to do some work to refinish and expand her shop to attract more customers and provide comfort to her current clients.

loans.use: to repair and remodel the salon

loans.name: Mujeres Inteligentes 3 Group

texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Inteligentes (Intelligent Women) 3, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the DR, an area famous for natural beauty and its tourism industry. Outside of the all-inclusive resorts running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and two children.

Marie is excited to be taking her 6th loan with Esperanza and excited at the opportunity to take loans at low interest rates. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business which is a fruit and vegetables stall, where she sells vegetables avocado, orange, pineapple, papaya, etc. She will use the profits to provide for the basic daily needs of her children and her mother. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, and fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE REPLACEMENT PARTS, TIRES, AND VARIOUS OTHER SUPPLIES

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es: Martha Irene de 38 años, es una madre abnegada. Tiene más de 1 año en su negocio que es una pulpería. Que inicio con muy pocos productos como comestibles, dulces, bebidas, frutas. Ahora, es la más abastecida de su localidad y todas las mañanas se encuentra llena de personas deseosas de querer comprar productos comestibles para el alimento diario. Su principal deseo es mejorar su tienda de comestibles para poder salir adelante en compañía de su familia. Este es el primer crédito donde agradece la confianza depositada en ella, pues comenzará a mejorar su negocio, Martha invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, golosinas, refrescos y detergentes.
texts.en: Martha Irene is 38 years old and is a devoted mother. She has had her grocery business for more than a year. She started her business with few products such as groceries, candies, drinks and fruits. Her business is now the best stocked in the neighborhood and every morning it is full of people wanting to buy groceries for their daily food. Her main desire is to improve her grocery store to be able to succeed with her family. This is her first loan. She is thankful for the confidence placed in her and she will start to improve her business. Martha will invest in the purchase of staple products such as rice, sugar, oil, beans, candy, soft drinks and detergents.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, beans, candy, soft drinks and detergents.

loans.name: Erika Paola

texts.es:
Erika de 26 años, una mujer  joven emprendedora que inicio hace un año en la venta por catalogo de Yanbal  y ventas de ropa Nivi. Su esposo trabaja en pintura de decoración y tiene tres hijos.

Ella trabaja de lunes a domingos por medios telefónicos a amigos y conocidos para promocionar sus ventas. su mayor dificultad en algunas ocasiones es en la cobranza a sus clientes ya que lo dejan a créditos y no le pagan a tiempo. 

Con el préstamo ella desea mejorar sus ingresos en las ventas de catálogos de ropa. Una sus metas es llegar a ser consultora y que su negocio crezca mas para así sacar adelante a su familia en lo más necesiten.
texts.en:
Erika is 26 years old and is an enterprising young woman. A year ago she started selling Yanbal products and Nivi clothing by catalog. Her husband works as a decorative painter and she has three children. 

She works Monday to Sunday calling friends and acquaintances to promote her sales. Her main difficulty on some occasions is collecting from customers that gives credit to and do not pay on time.

With the loan she wants to improve her income in clothing sales. Her goals are to become a consultant and that her business will grow so that she can support her family with what they need most.

loans.use: to purchase Nivi clothing and Yanbal products (cosmetics).

loans.name: Yisel

texts.es: Yisel es una mujer  que se adapta rápidamente a las circunstancias, elL. nació en el Cerro D. San Antonio en el departamento del Magdalena   y  tiene 21 años D. estar viviendo en Soledad en el departamento del Atlántico;  su cónyuge también es un trabajador independiente y aunque Yisel  tiene 10 años D. experiencia comercial, solo desD. hace  cinco años empezó en firme L. venta D.   refrescos y desD. hace más D. uno,  incursionó en L. comercialización D. cosméticos, perfumes, cremas desodorantes y joyas; ambos negocios que aun tienen un gran potencial D. crecimiento. Sus principales clientes están ubicados  en su barrio y en comunidades aledañas al lugar donD. habita. ElL. cuenta con una muy buena clienteL. a quienes les venD.  los fines D. semana hasta 20 cajas D. cervezas, así mismo, tiene un stock D. productos cosméticos y joyería,  gran parte D. ellos comprado en oferta para tener alternativas D. mejores precios para sus clientes y con esto compite en el mercado.  Yisel tiene actualmente un buen nivel D. ventas, que le ha permitido cubrir los gastos operativos del negocio y  parte D. los gastos familiares, sus estados financieros registran una utilidad y un margen D. contribución muy buenos. En su balance general, se destacan los rubros D. cuenta por cobrar y el D. inventario   constituidos primordialmente por los productos cosméticos, ya que en el negocio D. L. cerveza maneja  ventas en su gran mayoría  D. contado. En L. actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, financiamiento que aplicará a L. compra D. un botellero, una vitrina y también invertirá un poco en capital D. trabajo.
texts.en: Yisel is a woman who adapts quickly to the circumstances.  She was born in the mountain of San Antonio in the department of Magdalena, and for 21 years she has lived in Soledad in the department of Atlantico.  Her partner is also self-employed and even though Yisel has 10 years of sales experience, she only began her drink business 5 years ago, and one year ago she started selling cosmetics, perfumes, deodorant creams and jewelry.  Both business still have great potential for growth.  Her main customers live in her neighborhood and in communities nearby.  She has good clientele to whom she sells up to 20 cases of beer on the weekends.  She also has a stock of cosmetic products and jewelry, most of which she bought on sale so that she could offer her customers alternatives at better prices, and therefore be able to compete in the market.  Yisel currently has a good level of sales that has allowed her to cover operating costs and part of her family expenses.  Her financial statements show a profit and good margin of contribution.  On her general balance sheet, the outstanding accounts are highlighted along with inventory, mainly maD. up of the cosmetic products since the majority of beer sales are managed in cash.   Currently she is applying for her first Kiva loan, money which she will use to buy a bottle holder, a glass showcase, and also to invest in some business capital.

loans.use: to buy a bottle holder and a glass showcase, and also to invest in some business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Ruby

texts.es:
Ruby del Carmen O., vive en el municipio de Soledad, la tierra de las butifarras artesanales más deliciosas y antiguas  de Colombia en el departamento del Atlántico. Ruby  la muy inquieta y trabajadora  mujer,  vende de todo un poco: usted puede verla elaborando fritos, como arepas, empanadas,  carimañolas, hayacas y simultáneamente lista para viajar al departamento de Sucre, en Colombia,  con su libreta de registros y mercancías como ropa, sandalias, prendas de plata y otros accesorios para allí venderlos, y también puede verla de regreso a su casa,  con cajas de queso, aguacates y hasta diabolines (deliciosos pasabocas de queso y tostado elaborados en Sucre para venderlo en el municipio de Soledad. Todo este movimiento en su vida se lo debe a que hace 12 años tuvo una tienda y se acostumbró a realizar un gran esfuerzo  de trabajo  diario, que ahora no puede parar. Así que después de fracasar en la tienda, empezó a vender sopas en la puerta de su casa, y agregó mercancías variada para llevarla a Corozal en el departamento de Sucre, aprovechando el mercado natural  de sus familiares que allí viven y de esta misma ciudad regresa con diabolines, queso y aguacates para la venta, negocios de buen resultado y  que aún persisten.
Ruby tiene un año de estar vinculada a los programas de la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con su crédito anterior ha logrado reemplazar los préstamos costosos, a una tasa de interés de  un 10% mensual,  por una tasa más baja y en plazos apropiados. En la actualidad solicita su segundo crédito a esta organización, para comprar ropa,  harina, queso, diabolín y aceite. Su sueño ahora es tener una casa propia y que su hijo termine la carrera de derecho, con lo que se sentiría muy realizada. 
Ruby  es una mujer muy valiente que vive con su cónyuge y 2 hijos de 24 y 25 años, ella afirma que su diario vivir es un gran desafío, pues nunca se queda quieta esperando que todo le llegue por arte de magia.
texts.en:
Ruby del Carmen O. lives in the town of Soledad, which is located in the Department of Atlántico and the home of the most delicious handmade sausages in Colombia. Ruby is a very energetic and hardworking woman. She sells a little bit of everything. Ruby can be found making fried foods such as arepas, empandas, carimañolas, hayacas, and often at the same time so that she can sell them in the Department of Sucre in Colombia. With her traveling papers in hand, she also brings with her merchandise such as clothing, sandals, silver jewelry, and other accessories to sell while she is there. When she returns home, she brings back with her boxes of cheese, avocados, and even “diabolines” (delicious toasted cheese snacks that are made in Sucre and sold in the city of Soledad). All of this activity in her life is a result of managing a store for twelve years. She became accustomed to performing a great deal of work each day and now she cannot quit. After her store closed down, she began selling soups from the doorstep of her house. She also started bringing various types of merchandise to Corozal in the Department of Sucre to take advantage of the market owned by her relatives who live there. Upon her return home, she brought back “diabolines”, cheese, and avocados to sell. These businesses generated good results and she continues to manage them.

Ruby has participated in the programs of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for one year. Her previous loan replaced other expensive loans, one with a monthly interest rate of 10%. This new loan had a lower rate and more favorable terms. At the moment, she is requesting her second loan from the organization in order to buy clothing, flour, cheese, “diabolines”, and oil. Her dream now is to have a house of her own and see her son finish his law degree, which would give her a sense of accomplishment.

Ruby is a courageous woman who lives with her husband and two children, ages 24 and 25. She says that her everyday life is a huge challenge, but it does not prevent her from hoping that everything will magically happen.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, "diabolines", oil, flour, and cheese.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria Elena J. G. es una mujer de 51 años de edad, que  vive en el barrio Loma Fresca de la ciudad de Barranquilla con su conyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 19 a 22 años;  con su  pequeño negocio ubicado en su vivienda  y la venta de mercancias mediante guias especializadas de productos, que  tambien tiene, Victoria  está muy satisfecaha y quiere hacerla crecer,    su esposo y su hijo la apoyan los fines de semana y tiene muchos clientes que cada dia crecen y le compran de contado o a un crédito que cancelan en menos de 20 dias. Su sueño es lograr convertirlo  en un autoservicio  locativamente bien condicionado, donde sus clientes encuentren lo que ellos necesitan y se sientan confortables. Su mayor desafio es la competencia,  pero la enfrentan con buenos precios y buen servicio,y con ello  logra que su margen de utilidad se encuentre en no menos de un 28% y esto hace que su negocio sea atractivo y despierte en ella el deseo de continuar construyendolo, además de que sus inventarios rotan cada 15 dias que es una muy buena señal. Con su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo comprará ranchos, viveres, refrescos para surtir su punto de ventas  y comprar tambien  mercancias como cosméticos y accesorios, que tiene encargada entre sus clientes de Puerto Colombia, pueblo pintoresco, tradicional y muy cercano al mar.
texts.en:
Victoria Elena J. G. is a 51 year old woman who lives in the Loma Fresca neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla with her husband and three children who range in age from 19 to 22. She has a small business in her home where she sells merchandise through specialized product guides. Victoria is very satisfied with what she has accomplished and wants to grow. Her husband and son help her on the weekends since she has many customers and the number continues to grow each day. She sells her merchandise for cash or on a credit that must be paid off in less than 20 days. Her dream is to convert her business into a self-service store where her customers are equipped to find what they need and feel comfortable. The greatest challenge is competition, but Victoria is able to confront it by offering affordable prices and good service. As a result, she has been able to achieve a profit margin of at least 28%, thus making her business look attractive. This motivates her to wake up each day and want to continue building on what she has accomplished. Her product turnover period is 15 days, which is another very good sign.

This Kiva loan is also her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy food, provisions, and soft drinks to restock her retail outlet. In addition, she will purchase merchandise such as cosmetics and accessories that have been ordered by her customers in Puerto Colombia, a traditional picturesque town that is very close to the sea.

loans.use: To purchase food, provisions, soft drinks, cosmetics, and accessories.

loans.name: Reyneris

texts.es: Reyneris tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa usada y discos grabados. Tiene 10 años de experiencia en este negocio que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener su hogar. Reyneris siempre ha sido responsable tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su forma de venta es al por mayor y al por menor que siempre le solicitan una gran variedad, de música, videos y ropa variada. Este es su  tercer crédito que será utilizado para la compra de discos, pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes de baños.
texts.en:
Reyneris, age 37, sells used clothing and recorded discs. He has ten years of experience in this business, which has provided the necessary income to maintain his home. Reyneris has always been responsible with looking after his three young children. He sells both wholesale and retail since his customers are always requesting a variety of music, videos, and clothing.

This is his third loan which will be used to buy discs, trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, and bathing suits.

loans.use: To purchase discs, trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, and bathing suits.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase pants, skirts, blouses and underwear

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 28 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Amarildo de 30 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Robert de 11 y Miguel de 6 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que diariamente realiza Sonia en sus chacras, ha hecho que sus sembríos de arveja y gladiolo sean uno de los mejores cultivados del poblado de Patay. Todas las mañanas sale muy temprano a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que es muy importante que las tenga bien cuidadas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para tomar sus propias decisiones, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta la ciudad de Tarma. En adelante, espera comprará nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Es el octavo crédito con MFP y se siente en la obligación de pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, ya que no desea causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y siempre es aconsejada por el resto de las socias. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 28, is a humble and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Amarildo, age 30, and their two beloved children, Robert (age 11) and Miguel (age 6), for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Sonia works every day in her fields, tending to her pea and gladiola crops, which are known for being the best cultivated in the village of Patay. Every morning, she leaves very early to go work in the fields because she knows that it is very important that her crops receive good care. What she enjoys most about her work is having the freedom to make her own decisions. Sonia has been farming for eight years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops to the city of Tarma. Going forward, she hopes to buy additional farmland so that she can increase her production.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. Sonia feels obligated to submit her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for her Communal Bank. She is well-respected and always providing advice to the other members. The loan of 1500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more compost to improve her crops.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of compost.

loans.name: Mendieta Onofre

texts.es:
J. de 62 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio pintando carro pero un día se decidió por empezar a vender hot dog en una carrera ya que la pintura le hacía daño.

Su esposa le ayuda en la preparación de los hot dog en las mañana ya en la tarde el sale con su carreta a vender hasta la noche. No tiene dificultades en sus ventas ya que todos sus clientes lo conocen y lo esperan para comprarle.

Con el préstamo desea es invertir más en su carreta  para sus ventas y mejorar su vivienda. Su meta es seguir trabajando cada día más con su esposa.
texts.en:
J., age 62, is a hardworking gentleman who started out painting cars for a living. One day, he decided to sell hot dogs at a race because the paint was affecting his health.

His wife helps him with preparing hot dogs in the morning and then he goes out in the afternoons with his cart to sell them into the night. J. has no difficulty making sales since all of his customers know him and wait for him so that they can buy.

With this loan, he wants to invest more into his hot dog cart so that he can generate sales. In addition, he wants to make improvements to his home. His goal is to continue working each day alongside his wife.

loans.use: To invest in his hot dog business and pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel has a wife and two children. This hardworking man is a computer technician, and his business is a repair center. He found the need to do service in his community and used his knowledge to serve people and sell them the pieces they need to have better equipment.

He will use this loan to buy computers from brand outlets. Emmanuel is excited to be taking out his 4th loan with the Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He will use the profits to invest in his business and save, as he is saving to have his own house.

He became interested in and motivated others to join Esperanza because of the good things he heard that it was doing in his community and other nearby areas, especially the low interest. Compared to others around, Esperanza's rates are very low and with this opportunity he can make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy used computers

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija María de 15 años y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de Sonia es la primera en abrirse en su pueblo, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su tienda no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 10 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP y espera poder pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 38, is a kind and cheerful woman. She lives in her own home with her beloved 15 year old daughter María. Sonia is willing to work hard so that she can provide her daughter a better quality of life. Her store was one of the first to open in her town. At 6am, the doors of her store are open to receive the early morning buyers who have no hesitation to buy because they are aware of the variety of goods that she offers. Her customers have the security of knowing that they can find everything they need. What she enjoys most about her job is conversing with her customers and getting news about the events in town. Sonia has been in this business for ten years and considers the most difficult part to be staying at her store all day without being able to leave. Within time, she hopes to grow her business and provide her customers with better service.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. Sonia expects to submit her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank. She is a highly respected member because she tries to keep her group orderly. The loan of 500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more products so that her store will be better stocked.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase melons, mangoes, watermelons, oranges, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina, de 43 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Victoriano de 53 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña Catalina aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra arveja, papa, olluco y cebada, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Su deseo es comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuota de humor en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus nuevas siembras le den buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Catalina, age 43, is a simple hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with husband Victoriano, age 53, and their five beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. As young girl, Catalina learned from her parents how to work on a farm. They showed her everything that needed to be done to achieve a good crop. Now she has her own land that she cultivates and cares for with much love and patience. She grows peas, potatoes, ulluco, and barley to sell at the wholesale market in Tarma. What she enjoys most about her job is harvesting her crops because she feels that her hard work yields fruitful results. Catalina has been farming for 21 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting her crops from diseases that could have a harmful effect. Her wish is to buy additional farmland so that she can increase her production.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. Catalina knows that she must submit her payments on time and is willing to do so. She is one of the most cheerful members of her Communal Bank and always shares her sense of humor with the group. The loan of 1500 PEN that she is requesting will be used to buy compost for her land because she wants her new crops to yield good results.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of compost.

loans.name: Hugo Andrés

texts.es: Hugo Andrés es músico profesional de una importante  universidad , él ofrece  clases de guitarra eléctrica, acústica, teclado, solfeo, técnica vocal y entrenamiento auditivo, a domicilio   junto con dos compañeros más de universidad;   Su negocio inició hace 5 años creando una agrupación llamada "CACTOPUS" en el cual Hugo es el compositor y guitarrista de la banda;  entre sus temas aborta principalmente lo social  y fusiona diferentes ritmos; esta agrupación  realiza presentaciones en bares y cafés de Bogotá,   ciudad donde este grupo ha  tenido reconocimientos como entrevistas en revistas y otros.  Su principal tema  es "cariñito en rock"   muy conocido   por   seguidores de este genero. La meta de este grupo musical es lograr   reconocimiento a nivel nacional por la fusión de ritmos tradicionales.  CACTOPUS" es un proyecto musical para jóvenes y adultos creados hace 5 años. Hugo Andrés es un compositor, cantante y guitarrista que  fusiona ritmos como el rock y ritmos benes de  capoesia con música tradicional. Su sueño es que CACTOPUS  obtenga  el reconocimiento internacional como un estilo nuevo latinoamericano.  Su principal desafío es la difusión en medios comerciales  porque siente que está  monopolizada y para él es muy difícil así trabajar. Como negocio  Captopus  cuenta con ingresos promedios que dependen de  clases a domicilio y las presentaciones en bares y restaurantes, posee activos   representados en equipos de música, amplificadores y algunos cds con sus temas musicales. Hugo Andrés y su grupo quieren  grabar 9 canciones de su próximo disco que lanzarán,  en el cual se encuentran  trabajando. Este sería el primer lanzamiento  que hacen de un disco, ya que había lanzado 3 sencillos anteriormente con gran acogida,  reflejada  en  las presentaciones en  lugares como el bares,   hamburgueserías, entre las persona que reciben sus las clases  y otros sitios donde realizan presentaciones cada 8 días; su plan de inversión consiste en la grabación del disco , el prensaje de los cds o copias del disco   y el pago del arte o diseño de la caratula,  por eso desde la hermosa capital de Colombia “ Bogotá”, está acudiendo a su credikiva.
texts.en:
Hugo Andrés is a professional musician at a major university. He teaches classes in electric guitar, acoustics, keyboard, music theory, vocal technique, and ear training at home with two of his university classmates. Five years ago, Hugo started a group called “CACTOPUS” in which he is the composer and guitarist for the band. His music addresses social issues and fuses different rhythms. The group has made appearances in bars and cafés throughout Bogota, and has received attention as a result of magazine interviews and other forms of publicity. Its style is described as “cariñito en rock” which is well-known among followers of this genre. The goal of the group is to achieve recognition on a national level for its fusion of traditional rhythms.

CACTOPUS is a project for young people and adults that was created five years ago. Hugo Andrés is a composer, singer, and guitarist who is able to fuse the rhythms of rock music and the rhythmic beats of Capoeira with traditional music. His dream is for CACTOPUS to attain international recognition for its new Latin American style. Hugo’s main challenge has been generating publicity through commercial broadcast media because he believes the industry is monopolized, thereby making his work difficult. As a business, CACTOPUS generates income through the classes Hugo teaches at home and from appearances at bars and restaurants. The group’s assets include musical equipment, amplifiers, and some music CDs that have been produced. Hugo Andrés and his group want to record nine songs for the upcoming album launch, on which he is currently working. This will be the first album the group has launched, but the group has already released three singles that were well-received based on the sales that were made whenever they performed at bars and hamburger joints. Students of his classes have also bought these recordings, as well as attendees of performances at various sites in which they conduct every eight days.

Hugo has gone to the beautiful Colombian capital of Bogota to request a Kiva loan because he needs to invest in the cost of recording the album, pressing and copying the CDs, and designing and paying for cover art.

loans.use: To invest in album recording costs, pressing and copying CDs, and cover art design.

loans.name: Cleny

texts.es: Cleny, de 36 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Enrique de 42 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que Cleny realiza, es el cultivo de café, cacao, achiote y plátano, es así que todas las mañanas junto a su esposo, sale a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del buen cuidado que les brinde dependerá la calidad de los productos que llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y darles el cuidado necesario, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos de productos que lleva son muy pesados. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en la limpieza de sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Cleny, age 36, is a kind and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Enrique, age 42, and their five beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Cleny’s work involves growing coffee, cacao, annatto, and bananas. Every morning, she and her husband leave to go to their fields. Cleny knows that the quality of her products depends on the good level of care that she provides. Once harvested, her crops are sold at the market in the city of Pichanaki. What she enjoys most about her work is sowing her fields and providing her crops the care they need. She has been farming for twelve years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products since the sacks of produce can be extremely heavy. Within time, she hopes to buy additional farmland so that she can increase her production.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Cleny is saving so that she can submit her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank. She is pleased to be a member. The loan of 2500 PEN that she is requesting will be used to invest in the clearing of her cacao fields.

loans.use: To pay workers to clear her cacao fields.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.es: Darwin, de 24 años, es un joven muy amable y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su querida hija Yuni de 2 años, quien es el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo al que Darwin se dedica, es el cultivo de café, palta y plátano, los cuales después de la cosecha lleva a vender a la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que la ruta es muy accidentada. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras, para incrementar la cantidad que produce normalmente. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, en sus primeros créditos fue muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que contagia su alegría al resto de socias. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para fertilizar mejor sus tierras.
texts.en:
Darwin is 24 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working young man who lives in his parents' home, together with his beloved daughter, 2 year-old Yuni, who is the main motivation behind all his efforts.

Darwin's business is growing coffee, avocado and bananas.  After he harvests his crops he takes them to the town of Pichanaki to sell as this is where he receives the best prices for them.

What Darwin most enjoys about his work is cultivating his land.  He has been in this business for 5 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his products since the route is very rugged.  Over time, he hopes to buy more land in order to increase the quantity of crops that he produces.

This is Darwin's fourth loan with MFP.  He was very punctual in paying back his previous loans and he hopes to continue being punctual.  Darwin is a very well-liked member of his community bank because his happiness is contagious.  He will use the 2,500 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy manure so that he can better fertilize his land.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Felizia
