texts.es: Feliza, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Noe de 40 años y sus 4 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Feliza es muy trabajadora, así que sus días lo dedica al cultivo, ella pone todo su esfuerzo para que sus cultivos tengan la mayor calidad posible, esta actitud ha hecho que sus cultivos de plátano, palta y café, sean muy solicitados en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es donde lleva a vender sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos ya que los sacos de cultivos son muy pesados. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Son cuatro ya los préstamos que Feliza tiene con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su banco comunal, en donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para fertilizar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Feliza is 38 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 40 year-old Noe, and her 4 young children who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.  Feliza is very hard working and spends her days farming her land.  She puts all her effort into ensuring that her crops are of the best quality they can be.  This attitude has led to Feliza's banana, avocado and coffee crops being very much in demand in the market in the town of Pichanaki which is where she take her products to sell.

What Feliza most enjoys about her work is sowing her land and she does this with a lot of care.  She has been in this business for 13 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products since the sacks of crops are very heavy.  In the future, she hopes to buy more farmland so that she can increase her production.

Feliza has had four loans from MFP.  She has been very punctual in making her repayments and has never had any problems with her community bank where she is in charge of injecting the happiness quota that keeps her fellow members very happy indeed.  Feliza will use the 2,500 Peruvian soles that she has requested to buy more manure so that she can fertilize her crops.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of manure

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es: Gerson, de 37 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Irene de 25 años y sus 2 hijas Lizeth de 5 y Jenifer de 3 años, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Todas las mañanas Gerson se esmera mucho en trabajar sus tierras y dejarlas muy fértiles, ya que sabe que de eso depende la calidad de su café y plátano, productos que posteriormente cosechará para llevarlos a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene mucha libertad para trabajar en sus tierras, ya que es su propio jefe, sin embargo el cuidar sus plantas de café de los insectos y el clima le resulta muy trabajoso. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Gerson is 37 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 25 year-old Irene, and his two daughters, 5 year-old Lizeth and 3 year-old Jenifer, who are the main motivation behind all his efforts.

Every morning, Gerson takes great care in working his land and making it fertile since he knows that the quality of his coffee and bananas depends on it.  After he has harvested his crops, he takes them to sell in the market in the town of Pichanaki.  What Gerson most enjoys about his work is the great freedom that he has to work on his land since he is his own boss. Nevertheless, he considers the most difficult part of his work to be weeding his coffee plantations.  Over time, Gerson would like to buy new land, in order to increase his production.

This is Gerson's second loan from MFP and he feels capable of making all his repayments.  He is one of the most active members of his community bank and, for this reason, he is very well liked and respected.  He will use the 600 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more manure to make his land more fertile.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of manure

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Álvaro Antonio se dedica brindar el servicio de carpintería. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, el realiza muy buenos trabajos como puertas, comedores, camas, sillas, escritorio, entre otros productos.  Trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada y hasta altas horas de la noche, para poder terminar sus encargos pues le realizan una gran variedad. Solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas, madera, clavos, maque, pega, tela entre otros. Es una persona trabajadora con ganas de superación, está agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Álvaro Antonio is a carpenter.  He has been in this business for more than 10 years.  He does very good work, making doors, dining room sets, beds, chairs, desks and other products.  He works every day, from very early in the morning until very late at night, so that he can finish the large number of different orders that customers place with him.  He is requesting this loan to buy tools, wood, nails, glue, fabric, etc.  He is a hard-working person with a desire to improve himself.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: to buy tools, wood, nails, glue, fabric and other products

loans.name: Guido

texts.es: Guido, de 41 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Virginia de 28 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad  de vida. Todas las mañanas Guido se esmera mucho en trabajar sus tierras y dejarlas muy fértiles, ya que sabe que de eso depende la calidad de sus cafetales y árbol de palta, en lo que posteriormente lo cosechará para venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene mucha libertad para trabajar en sus tierras, ya que puede disponer de su tiempo y capital, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es hacer la limpieza de sus plantaciones de café. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Es el primer crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Guido is 41 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 28 year-old Virginia, and his five beloved children who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Every morning, Guido takes a lot of care in working his land and making it fertile since he knows that the quality of his coffee plantations and avocado trees depends on it.  After harvesting his crops, Guido takes them to the market in the town of Pichanaki to sell.  What he most enjoys about his work is the fact that he has a lot of freedom to work on his land since he can make use of his own time and capital.  He has been in this business for 10 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be weeding his coffee plantations.

Over time, Guido would like to buy more land so that he can increase his production.  This is his first loan with MFP and he feels capable of making all his loan repayments.  Guido is one of the most active members of his community bank and, for this reason, he is very well liked and respected.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more manure to make his land more fertile.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es: Martha Azucena tiene 52 años, vive junto a su hijo que está a su cargo. Desde hace 20 años tiene instalado en el mercado su puesto de venta de frutas. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes una variedad de frutas frescas los cuales adquiere en el mercado mayorista en Managua. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda a la familia. El negocio de Martha siempre cuenta con clientes que prefieren su buen trato y amabilidad pero sobretodo la calidad de fruta que vende. El préstamo es para adquirir productos como plátanos, cebollas, tomates, sandias, papayas, maní entre otros. Martha es muy trabajadora y entregada a su familia, Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena is 52 years old and lives together with her son who is in her care.  For 20 years, Martha has run a fruit stall in the market.  Every day she offers her customers a variety of fresh fruit which she acquires in the wholesale market in Managua.  This business is a great help to her family.  

Martha's business always has customers who prefer to shop there because of the good customer service that she offers and her kindness but, above all, because of the quality of the fruit that she sells.  This loan will be used to acquire products such as bananas, onions, tomatoes, watermelons, papayas, peanuts, etc.  Martha is a very hard-working woman who is devoted to her family.  Her biggest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy bananas, onions, watermelons, papayas, peanuts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy modern accessories and spare parts for cell phones, in order to modernize her current stock

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana J. es una vendedora por excelencia, ella vende desde ropa hasta artículos para el hogar y bisutería.
Ella realiza su trabajo a domicilio, es decir  casa por casa va todos los días ofreciendo sus productos. Hoy ella quiere mejorar su pequeño negocio, y para eso necesita un préstamo de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones)   para la compra de mas productos que están siendo demandados en la comunidad, entre ellas ropa para mujer. Ella quiere crear un capital para poder construir su propia tienda y así mejorar sus ingresos
Viviana es  socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal La amistad, una de las 110 Empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Viviana J. is a saleswoman par excellence.  She sells everything from clothes to household goods and costume jewelry.  She sells her products door to door and goes out every day to do this.  Right now, she would like to improve her small business and, for this, she needs a loan for 500,000 colones so that she can buy more products which are in demand in her community, including women's clothes.

Viviana would like to build up capital so that she can build her own store and thereby improve her income.  She is a member of the La Amistad community credit company which is one of the 110 member companies of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes and accessories

loans.name: Fuerza Group

texts.en:
The 'Fuerza' (Strength) communal bank at FINCA Peru is starting its fourth loan cycle. Its 14 members have businesses selling groceries and preparing meats, among other things. 

Gloria is the president of the bank; she is 40 years old and has two children who are both studying. Gloria purchases cochineal (an insect used to make natural dye) and tara (a native plant used for tanning leather) at large local fairs, dries them at home, and then sells them in markets in Ayacucho and Huanta. 

She will be using her current loan of 700 Peruvian nuevos soles (PEN) to purchase cochineal. She has had her business for over 10 years and has been a member of FINCA Peru for just as long. Gloria would like to have her own house one day, and invest her savings in a knitting machine, so that she can make sweaters to sell.

loans.use: to buy cochineal (an insect used to make natural dye)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, rice, toilet paper, flour, coffee, evaporated milk, and pasta to develop her business

loans.name: Francisca Candelaria

texts.es: La Señora Francisca tiene 55 años, Vive en municipio de Nagarote, se dedica a la venta de comida, en su casa de habitación en donde la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a saborear los diferentes platillos que elabora.  Uno de sus mayores desafíos es el tiempo pues a pesar de que se levanta temprano tiene que realizar los quehaceres de su hogar, las compras, cocinar entre otras cosas. El destino del crédito es para aumentar los insumos de su negocio ya que necesita granos básicos, bolsas, platos, cubiertos, servilletas, refrescos, para la elaboración de sus platillos, es una persona muy trabajadora y su deseo es seguir trabajando mientras tenga salud.
texts.en: Francisca is 55 years old.  She lives in the town of Nagarote and her business is selling meals in her home where her customers come to savor the different dishes that she makes.  One of Francisca's main challenges is time since, in spite of the fact that she gets up early, she has to do her housework, do the shopping, cook and do other things besides.  She will use her loan to increase her supplies since she needs basic grains, bags, plates, cutlery, napkins and soft drinks for her business.  She is a very hard-working person and her wish is to continue working while she still enjoys good health.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bags, plates, cutlery, napkins and soft drinks

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián, de 30 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Mery de 29 años y sus 2 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. La siembra de papa, choclo y arveja es la actividad a la que se dedica Julián, todas las mañanas trabaja sus tierras para poderlas hacer más fértiles y productivas. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro, ya que saben que tiene que trabajar en todo lo que puedan, ya que la educación de sus hijos les demanda muchos gastos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es donde vende sus cultivos. Dentro de unos días, espera cosechar sus productos y venderlos a buen precio en el mercado y así poco a poco juntar dinero, para poner una tienda de abarrotes por su barrio. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si no desea causarle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual es un socio muy responsable y puntual. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas semillas de arveja y papa, también comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Julián is 30 years old.  He is a very simple and cheerful man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 29 year-old Mery, and his two beloved children.  What Julián wants more than anything is to excel in life.

Julián's business is growing potatoes, corn and peas.  Every morning he works his land in order to make it fertile and productive.  Together with his wife, he works very hard.  He knows that he has to work as much as he can since his children's education creates a lot of expenses.

What Julián most enjoys about his work is protecting his crops from the insect infestations that can destroy them.  He has been in this business for 16 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his products to the market in Tarma which is where he sells his crops.  In a few days, he expects to harvest his products and sell them for a good price in the market.  This will help him as he is gradually putting aside money so that he can set up a grocery store in his neighborhood.

This is Julián's sixth loan from MFP and he knows that he must make his repayments punctually if he doesn't want to cause trouble for his community bank where he is a very responsible and punctual member.  Julián will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy new pea and potato seeds.  He will also buy sacks of manure.

loans.use: to buy pea and potato seeds, and sacks of manure

loans.name: Elvia Carlota

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Juan  se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Elvia, ella tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y una chica de 16 años que  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es reciclador.

Doña Elvia se dedica a la compra y venta de material reciclable, compra cartón, hierro, aluminio, plásticos, entre  otros materiales que las empresas recicladoras compran. Ella recorre varios lugares en busca de productos que las personas desechan, compra esos productos para luego  venderlos al por mayor a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa y luego ellos venden a las fabricas que reutilizan estos materiales.

Este crédito es para comprar más material reciclable, cartón, bronce, hierro entre otros. Está en el Banco Comunal  hace dos ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan.
 
Sus sueños son tener salud y otro trabajo mejor.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the San Juan community bank meets in San Juan neighborhood, in the town of Manta.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year round by both domestic and foreign tourists.  Most of the locals fish and do other jobs related to the sea.

Here we meet Elvia.  She is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  Two of her children are grown up and her youngest daughter is 16 and still lives with her.  Her husband is in the recycling business.

Elvia's business is buying and selling recyclable material.  She buys cardboard, iron, aluminum, plastics and other materials that recycling companies buy.  She goes to different places in search of products that people throw out.  She buys these products and then sells them wholesale to salespeople who come to her home.  These people then sell the products to factories who reuse them.

Elvia will use this loan to buy more recyclable material, including cardboard, brass and iron.  She has been a member of her community bank for two loan cycles and she likes it because of the help she receives.  Her dreams are to continue in good health and to find a better job.

loans.use: to buy cardboard, brass, iron, plastic, paper, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Alejandra

texts.es: La Señorita Claudia es una joven emprendedora que a sus 20 años de edad ya tiene su propio taller el cual desea agrandarlo, por lo cual solicito un préstamo de nuestra institución para compra de una maquina de coser, ella se dedica a la confección de cortinas.  Ella aprendio el oficio de su papa quien por ser la hija mayor era su ayudanta, esta actividad la realiza para financiar su sueño el cual es salir profesional en enfermería, actualmente ella esta en cursos de enfermería básica. Aparte ayuda a sostener a su familia sobre todo a sus hermanos menores a quienes ayuda con los gastos de sus estudios es una joven muy responsable y trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Claudia is an enterprising young woman who, at the age of 20, already owns her own sewing workshop which she would like to expand.  She requested a loan from our institution in order to buy a sewing machine.

Claudia's business is making drapes.  She learned the trade from her dad because, as the eldest daughter, she was his assistant.  She carries out this business in order to finance her dream which is to become a nursing professional.  She is currently taking courses in basic nursing.  The business also helps to support her family, above all her younger siblings who she helps with their education expenses.  Claudia is a very responsible and hard-working young woman and she is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Las Escogidas 2, & 3 Group

texts.en:
Didina is a 27-year-old borrower from a small community outside San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is a member of her group, Las Escogidas 2, 3 & 4 ("The Chosen"), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group.

Didina lives with her only child in a batey (a rural community built by sugar companies for their workers). Didina and her daughter have a difficult life – little access to electricity, no running water or medical services, and insufficient roads. Bateys are filled with some of the poorest people, not just in the Dominican Republic, but in the entire Western Hemisphere.

Despite these difficulties, Gina runs a successful fantasia (a small store with miscellaneous sales). With her loan, Didina plans to buy clothes, cosmetics, shoes, accessories, etc.

Didina is very thankful for this loan, her fourth with Esperanza, and she hopes to continue her successful borrowing in the future. Thank you for lending to Didina and Las Escogidas Group!

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, shoes, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es: Lucinda, de 39 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Andrés de 41 años y sus 3 hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor educación. Trabajando arduamente, Lucinda ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora y media para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papa, arveja, habas y olluco, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Paralelamente a esta actividad, ella tiene un restaurante, negocio que le ayuda mucho en sus ingresos, puesto que su establecimientos es muy concurrido por sus vecinos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 31 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, las cual les pueda ayudar a mejorar su economía. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de poder acceder a este crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas semillas para sembrar, además comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Lucinda is 39 years old.  She is a very loving and hard-working mother who lives in her own home together with her husband, 41 year-old Andrés, and her three children who she would like to provide with a better education.

Through hard work, Lucinda has ensured that her farm provides her with the products she needs to support her family.  Before the first rays of sun are visible, she leaves her home and walks for nearly an hour and a half to reach her farmland where she grows potatoes, peas, beans and olluco (a native tuber), crops which she then takes to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma to sell.

In addition to this, Lucinda owns a restaurant.  This business helps her a lot in terms of income since her establishment is very popular with her neighbors.  What Lucinda most likes about her work is cultivating her land because she feels that she is putting it to good use.  She has been in this business for 31 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her produce to Tarma since the sacks she carries are very heavy and make her very tired.

Over time, Lucinda would like to set up a grocery store which will help her to improve her financial situation.  This is her tenth loan from MFP.  She is very happy to be able to access this loan and she would like to thank all those people who will make it possible for her to receive the money that she needs.  Lucinda is a very well-respected member of her community bank because of the order that she brings to the meetings.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy new seeds to sow.  She will also buy sacks of manure.

loans.use: to buy potato and pea seeds, and sacks of manure

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 58 años es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Félix de 58 años y esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. La tienda de Margarita es una de las más visitadas en Puerto Ipoki, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, lleva 4 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el primer crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Margarita, 58, is a pleasant and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Felix, 58, and works very hard in order to improve her quality of life.  Margarita's store is one of the most-visited in Puerto Ipoki.  She opens the store very early in the morning in anticipation of her neighbors coming to buy the things that they need.  She is a happy and attentive saleswoman, always receiving her customers with a smile and helping them with their purchases.  What she likes most about her job is talking with her neighbors.  She has been doing this work for 4 years.  The hardest part is spending the whole day in her store without being able to leave.

With time, she hopes to be able to grow her store and fill it with more merchandise, in order to offer her customers a greater variety of products.  This is the first loan with MFP and she intends to make all her payments on time, since she does not want to cause any problems for her communal bank where she is well-liked by the rest of the members.

With the one thousand nuevos soles she is seeking, she will buy more products to be able to improve her store.

loans.use: Buy more products to grow her store.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: La señora Maria Ester se dedica a la venta de artesanía hace más de 5 años, tiene 45 años tiene 1 hijo, menor a su cargo. Se dedica al comercio de artesanía, como jarrones, floreros, adornos entre otros. Su forma de venta es en un kiosco en donde transitan una gran variedad de clientes y también vende en su casa. Trabaja todos los días, sus productos los deja a crédito y de contado. Su mercadería la realiza diariamente y también la compra a ciertos artesanos del lugar. El financiamiento es para la compra de barro, pinturas y compra de más artículos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Ester has sold crafts for more than 5 years.  She is 45 years old and has one minor child in her care.  She sells various handicrafts, such as vases and decorations.  She sells them from a kiosk where a large variety of customers come through and also from her house.  She works every day, and sells her products by credit and cash.  She makes products herself every day and also buys it from some artisans from the area.

The loan is for the purchase of clay, paints, and to buy more products.

loans.use: Purchase of clay, paints, and more products.

loans.name: Las Escogidas 4 Group

texts.en: Angeli is the coordinator of her group, Las Escogidas 4, and her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in the rural area of San Pedro de Macorís, surrounded by sugar cane fields where there is no potable running water and electricity is unreliable. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. Angeli is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza, almost three years after she started doing business and taking out loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She sells miscellaneous products such as cosmetics, beauty items, shoes, clothing, etc. She will use her profits to start rebuilding her house as a safer structure. Her most difficult challenge is living in her community. She likes to work and her future plans include attending church. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Nueva Integracion Group

texts.es: La Sra. Miryam  es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar,  actualmente asume el cargo de presidente  en la alcancía comunal “Nueva Integración” grupo  conformado por 9  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Miryam  trabaja desde hace 3 años en la elaboración de vinos y venta, este negocio surge a raíz de su divorcio, ya que ella tenía que mantener a sus hijas y cuidarlas. Trabajó muy duro para darle una mejor calidad de vida  a sus hijas  y gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a  construido su casa, sus hijas tienen buena educación y a su vez mayores ingresos,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería y ampliar su negocio de vinos. Sabemos que Miryam  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en: Miryam  is a single mother with two school age children, and currently serves as president  of the community group “Nueva Integración” which has 9 members who are engaged in diverse retail businesses. Miryam  has worked selling wine for three years, out of necessity to provide for her children since she divorced. Through her hard work, she has provided a better quality of life for her family, and has built her own house and educated her children thanks to the income from her businesses.  In order to grow her business and increase sales of wine, she seeks this credit to buy product inventory for resale. Miryam is confident she will achieve her goals and the loan from Edaprospo will be of great benefit.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Marivel  Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Marivel es una persona bastante trabajadora tiene dos hijas que están estudiando en el colegio,  el esposo es pastelero en la zona sur su horario de trabajo es de 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde y después toda la familia ayuda a elaborar la masa a partir de las 5 de la tarde todos los días para despachar por la mañana a todas las tiendas  de  las zonas aledañas, ella realiza pasteles, panes, galletas. El crédito que solicito es para ampliar las instalaciones de su casa  comprara calaminas  estuco y material de construcción. Ellos viven la zona de villa salome  que es una zona que queda cerca de las oficinas es una persona muy responsable que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Marivel is a very hardworking person who has 2 daughters who are in school.  Her husband is a neighborhood baker; he works from 7am until 4pm, and after that the whole family helps to make the dough from 5 in the afternoon each day.  They deliver their products each morning to all of the stores in the surrounding area.  Marivel makes cakes, bread and cookies.  She requests a loan to expand the working area in her home; she will buy sheets of corrugated metal, stucco and other construction materials.  Marivel's family lives in the Villa Salome neighborhood, an area that is very close to the Emprender offices.  She is a very responsible person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal roofing and other construction materials

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, D. 42 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia casa junto a su esposo Silverio D. 49 años y sus 6 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. DesD. muy pequeña Marleni ha trabajado junto a sus padres en el cultivo D. L. tierra, con los años ha logrado comprarse sus propias chacras y ahora es una D. las principales productoras D. plátano, cacao, yuca, maíz y café D. L. provincia D. Chanchamayo, lugar hasta donD. llegan sus compradores para obtener sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que es muy difícil encontrar camiones que quieran llevar los pesados sacos D. cultivo. Con el paso del tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, está muy segura D. poder pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que siempre ha sido muy puntual. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar L. productividad D. sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marleni, age 42, is a very kind and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her 49 year old husband, Silverio, and their six dear children.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life.  Ever since she was very young Marleni has worked with her parents farming the land.  With the years she has managed to buy her own land.  Now she is one of the foremost banana, cacao, yucca, corn, and coffee producers in the Chanchamayo province. 

This is the place where her buyers come to get her crops.  What she likes best about her work is taking care of her crops, and she does it with much affection.  She has been doing this activity for ten years.  She considers transporting her products to the market to be the most difficult part of her work.  That is because it is very difficult to find trucks that want to take the heavy sacks of crops.

In time she wishes to buy new land where she would be able to increase her production.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is very sure that she is able to make her payments on time because she has always been very punctual.  She is a very happy and supportive member of her communal bank.  She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy natural and chemical fertilizers to improve productivity of her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Ana Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Juan  se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, ella tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos  mayores de edad, uno de ellos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo trabaja en su carro realizando fletes.

Ella trabaja en una fábrica y también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también les vende  a sus compañeras de trabajo. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en la fábrica y  en las noches  se dedica a vender su mercadería, además los sabados y domingos aprovecha para visitar a sus clientes. Su mercadería  la  comprar en  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, entre otras prendas. Está en el Banco Comunal  hace tres ciclos y le gusta la buena amistad que tiene con sus compañeras.

Su sueño es tener un negocio estable en un lindo local.
texts.en:
The communal bank ‘San Juan’ has a meeting every two weeks in the neighborhood in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches which have local and foreign tourists all year round. Most of its inhabitants are fishermen or work in the sea.  

There we met Mrs. Ana who is 45 years old. She is married and has two adult children, one of them lives with her. Her husband works making deliveries with his car. She works in a factory and also sells different type of clothing door to door and to her coworkers. She works from Monday to Friday in the factory, in the evenings sells the clothing and usually visits her customers on Saturdays and Sundays. She buys new items in Guayaquil every two weeks or as she needs to.

This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, blouses and children’s clothes. She is in her third loan cycle from the communal bank and enjoys the friendship she has with other members.

Her dream is to have a stable business in a pretty location.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children’s clothing, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Katy

texts.es:
Katy V.  M. es una mujer emprendedora,  y desea empezar su propio negocio.
Para eso, ella necesita un préstamo  de₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones)    para la compra de ropa, zapatos y perfumes, los cuales empezara a comercializar casa por casa. Katy sueña con tener su negocio propio y alguna día tener su propia de tienda.
Ella es socia de la empresa de Crédito Comunal  Guaitil en Guanacaste, una de las 110 Empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Katy V. M. is an enterprising woman who wishes to start her own business.  In order to do so she needs a loan for 500,000 colones to buy clothes, shoes, and perfumes.  She will start selling these items door to door.  Katy dreams of having her own business and of one day having her own store.

She is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Guaitil, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 26 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Wilder de 28 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Antony de 5 y Eduard 2 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Nancy trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, poniendo todo su esfuerzo siembra continuamente plátanos, cacao y café, productos que vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el mercado donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. En adelante, espera mejorar sus productos y así obtener mejores precios. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nancy, age 26, is a very kind and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her 28 year old husband, Wilder, and their two dear children.  Antony is five, and Eduard is two.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life.

By working arduously on her crops every day, Nancy tries to change the life she now has.  She continuously puts all of her effort into her banana, cacao, and coffee crops.  She sells these products at the market in the city of Pichanaki.  That is where she gets the best prices.

What she likes best about her work is taking care so that pests do not infest her crops.  She has been doing this activity for five years.  She considers the most difficult part to be taking her crops to the market where she sells them.  The sacks she takes them in are very heavy.  Later, she hopes to improve her products and get better prices.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She feels that this loan will be very beneficial to her growth as a farmer.  She is a supportive and very active member in her communal bank.  She will use the requested 600 soles to buy more fertilizer to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa has been working in restaurants and doing cleaning work for the past 15 years but this is the first time anyone has ever given her the opportunity and capital to start her own business.  Her friends and family tell her that she makes the best Ecuadorian food around.  This loan will give Rosa the opportunity to purchase cooking and cleaning equipment as well as decorations for her food cart.  It will help her to grow her food cart and attract new customers.  As her business expands, Rosa hopes to save enough money to one day open her own storefront restaurant.  Rosa has four children who she supports through her work; her husband drives a taxicab.

loans.use: To purchase cooking and cleaning products as well as decorations for her food cart

loans.name: Riqueza Group

texts.en:
The communal bank "Riqueza" is in its fifth loan cycle at FINCA Peru. Its 10 members have businesses selling clothes, electronics, textiles, and vegetables. The group is taking out a loan total of 7,350 PEN. 

Elisa is the president of the bank, and is 23 and single. She has a clothes-making business and will be using her loan of 1,050 PEN to purchase fabric in Lima to make clothes to sell in Ayacucho. She has had her business for two years and has been with FINCA Peru for the same amount of time. She would like to continue to grow her business and sell more clothing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make clothes to sell

loans.name: Katty Maricela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Juan  se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Katty, ella tiene  23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una niña de 6 años que estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja entregando materiales de construcción.

Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes en una empresa en la ciudad de Manta, pero también se dedica a la venta productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que además de trabajar en la fábrica de lunes a viernes también los sabados y domingos lo hace en las ventas de sus productos, deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada semana, nos cuenta que lleva seis meses que se dedica a este negocio, el cual empezó con un crédito del banquito y que le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The San Juan Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the San Juan neighborhood in the city of Manta.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited a lot by national and foreign tourists in all seasons of the year.  The majority of the residents here work in the fishing industry.

This is where we meet Katty.  She is 23 years old and married.  She has a six year old daughter, who goes to school.  Her husband works delivering construction materials.

She works from Monday to Friday for a business in the city of Manta.  But, she also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She works every day because besides working in the factory from Monday through Friday, she also sells her products on Saturday and Sunday.  She leaves the merchandise on credit, and she collects payment every week.

She has had this business for six months.  She started it with a loan in her communal bank, and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and underwear.  It is her second cycle in the communal bank, and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to have her own house because she lives in her parents-in-law’s house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and underwear

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
María, tiene  58 años edad, nacida en la Trinidad municipio de Estelí, se vino  a vivir al centro de esta ciudad cuando tenia 3 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa ,cosmético, zapatos y joyas de plata lleva 30 años en este oficio. Inicio comprando bolsas plásticas que se utilizaban para  vender hielo, helados antes de dedicarse a este negocio laboraba como  trabajadora social en el hospital de Estelí ahí duro 10 años donde. Luego decidió viajar a Guatemala a comprar mercadería tales como perfumes ,joyas de plata, para vender a sus compañeros de trabajo  estos viajes lo realizo durante 15 años así logro mantener a sus hijos ella sola. Hoy en día viaja a Panamá donde compra productos como cosmético, ropa , zapatos ,bolsos y joyas de plata que vende al por mayor y al detalle, tiene 8 vendedores y además recibe ayuda de un hijo que le manda remesas de Costa Rica.
Solicito el crédito para comprar mercadería nueva como celulares pues antes no vendía y ahora ve que es una herramienta necesaria y de uso cotidiano entre la población. Con este crédito espera poder aumentar su clientela, prosperar su negocio, mantenerlo surtido con productos nuevos ,generar empleo Tiene como planes futuros construir locales que pueda rentar y vivir de ello cuando envejezca. Su meta próxima es terminar de construir su casa para poner una tienda de ropa y zapatos dentro de la misma.
texts.en:
María, 58, is from La Trinidad in the Nicaraguan province of Esteli.  She moved to the town of Esteli when she was 3 years old.  She's a single mother with 4 children, all now grown.  Maria has been a merchant for 30 years.  At first, she sold ice, buying plastic bags that she packed with ice and sold on.  Now she sells clothing, cosmetics, shoes, silver jewelry, etc.  Before starting the business, she was a social worker at the hospital in Esteli for 10 years.  In those days, she used to go to Guatemala and bring back perfumes, silver jewelry, etc. that she then sold to her co-workers.  The money that she earned allowed her to better support her children.  Now she goes to Panama where she buys products such as cosmetics, clothing, shoes, purses and jewelry.  She sells on both the wholesale and retail markets.  She also gets t-shirts from a son in Costa Rica.
Maria is applying for a loan so that she can buy other products such as cell phones.  She's never sold cell phones before but she can see that they're an everday product now, something that everyone needs.  She hopes the loan will help her attract new customers and expand her business.  Keeping her business stocked with merchandise will help her create jobs for others, too.  In the future, she wants to build a shop that she can rent out and ultimately could provide her a place to live as she gets older.  Her next goal, though, is finish building an addition to her house for her clothing and shoes business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for retail business

loans.name: Nermi

texts.es: Nermi, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jorge de 48 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado cultivar Nermi, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas trabaja en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus plátanos, cítricos y café dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve crecer abundantemente, tiene 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es el lugar donde lo vende, ya que los sacos en donde lleva los productos son muy pesados. En adelante, espera mejorar sus productos, para así poder obtener mejores precios. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuota puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar la producción de sus plantaciones.
texts.en: Nermi, 38, is a friendly, hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband, Jorge, 48, and their 3 children, in a house that they own.  She and her husband work hard to provide a better quality of life for their children.   Nermi is a farmer and the money that she earns from her land greatly help the family.  She works the farm every morning, growing platanos, citrus fruits and coffee, and she knows the quality of the crop depends on the care she takes.  What she most likes about farming is taking care of her crop and watching it grow by the day.  She's been a farmer for 10 years and says that the most difficult thing about farming is getting her crop to market.  She has to cart the crop to the town of Pichanaki because that's where she sells it, but the sacks are very heavy and difficult to move.  For the future, she wants to improve her crop so that she can ensure the best price for it.  This is Nermi's fourth MFP loan.  She knows that she has to repay it on time and is committed to doing so.  The members of her community bank consider her to be a reliable and responsible partner.  She will use this loan, for two-thousand new soles, to buy supplies of manure for improving her crop yields.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure for farming business

loans.name: Ana Magdalena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Juan  se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, ella tiene 35 años de edad, está casada hace 11 años y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 11, 8 y 6 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es reciclador.

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de material reciclable, compran cartón, hierro, aluminio, plásticos, entre  otros materiales que las empresas recicladoras compran. Trabajan todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 19h00, ellos compra el producto a los recicladores que llegan hasta su casa, para luego venderlos al por mayor a comerciantes los cuales venden a las fabricas recicladoras en Manta.

Este crédito es para comprar más material reciclable como cartón, bronce, hierro entre otros. Está en el Banco Comunal  hace dos ciclos y le gusta todo del banco ya que no le importa a que se dediquen siempre que sea para producir y por el bienestar de los socios.

Su sueño es tener un carro para llevar los productos a Manta directamente.
texts.en:
The San Juan community bank meets every 15 days in the San Juan neighborhood of Manta.  The Ecuadorean city of Manta is known for its beautiful beaches and is much visited by both local and foreign tourists at all times of the year.  Most local people earn a living from fishing and other related occupations.  

Our member, Ana, is 35 years old.  She has been married for 11 years and has three children who are 11-, 8- and 6-years old, respectively.  All the children are in school.  

Ana and her husband makes a living from buying and selling recyclables.  They work together, buying recyclable materials--cardboard, scrap metal, aluminum, plastics, etc.--that are ultimately purchased by companies that buy recyclables.  Ana and her husband work every day from 9:00am to 7:00pm.  They buy recyclables locally and deliver what the collect, in bulk, to merchants who sell the materials on to the companies.  

Ana will use this loan to buy recyclable materials--cardboard, scrap metal, etc.--for her business.  She has been a member of the community bank for two funding rounds.  She likes her bank because they don't care how someone makes a living, just that they do something productive and to the credit of all the bank's members.  

Ana's dream is buy a car (or, possibly, cart) that she can use to deliver the materials she collects directly to the recycling companies.

loans.use: to buy paper, scrap metal, etc. for recycling business

loans.name: Nilson

texts.es: Nilson, de 35 años, es un hombre muya amble y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Rosita de 28 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los esfuerzos en cuidado y fertilización que Nilson realiza en sus cultivos, se ven reflejados en la calidad de sus productos, ya que sus productos de plátanos, palta, café y cacao que cultiva son muy cotizados en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanki, que es donde vende dichos frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha alegría, lleva 19 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el transporte es muy escaso por la zona donde tiene sus cultivos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción. Es el primer crédito con MFP y espera poder pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, es de los pocos varones de su banco comunal, por lo cual es muy querido por el resto de las socias. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en: Nilson, 35 years old, is a very friendly and hardworking man.  He lives in his own home with his wife Rosita, 28, and their 5 cherished children, whom they want to give a better quality of life.  The effort that Nilson puts into caring for and fertilizing his crops is reflected in the quality of his products, which are plantains, avocado, coffee and cacao.  These crops are in high demand in the market of the city of Pichanki, which his where he sells these fruits of his labor.  What he likes most about his work is harvesting his lands, which he does with a lot of joy.  He has been doing this for 19 years and thinks that the most difficult part is transporting his products, since transport is very scarce in the region where he has his crops.  With time, he hopes to buy more land and increase his production.  This is his first loan with MFP and he expects to make all of his payments on time.  He is one of the few men in his village bank, because of which he is held very dear by the rest of the members.  With the 800 nuevo soles that he requested, he will buy more manure for his crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Capoluca Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en casa de la señora Epifania T. un integrante del grupo "Capoluca", que esta ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz, en México. Epifania se dedica a la venta de antojitos, que inicio hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos e invertir en su negocio de tacos. Sus compañeras y clientes la conocen como una persona responsable y trabajadora. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente satisfecha ya que por medio de este préstamo podra incrementar sus ventas y atraer más clientes. Tiene 32 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, es casada y tiene 3 hijas. Con este crédito espera ser la mejor de la zona, asi como incrementar sus ventas y con ello ofrecer una mejor variedad de antojitos para deleitar el paladar de sus clientes, además de poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y seguir apoyando a sus hijas con sus estudios hasta donde le sea posible.
texts.en:
The photo was taken in the home of Epifania, a member of the “Capoluca” Group, located in the State of Veracruz.  Epifania sells snacks, a business she initiated some 2 years ago.

Epifania requested the loan to buy supplies and invest in her taco business.  Her companions and customers know her as a hard-working and responsible person.  At the time of soliciting this loan, she felt satisfied because with the loan, she will be able to increase her sales and attract more customers.

Epifania is 32 years old, studied up to secondary school, is married and has 3 daughters.  With the loan, she hopes to become the best in the zone, as well as to increase her sales and, with that, to offer the best variety of snacks to delight her customer's taste, plus to be able to provide her family a better quality of life, and to continue helping her daughters with their studies as far as possible.

loans.use: TO BUY MORE SUPPLIES FOR THEIR SALES OF SNACKS

loans.name: Westfall Humberto

texts.es:
Westfall, de 33 años de edad, nació en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, es casado, tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, estudio administración de empresa, pero dedica a las labores de siembra de hortalizas.
Inicio con esta actividad hace 7 años cuando tenia 25 años de edad comenzó sembrando una manzana de tomate lo hizo a medias financiado con fondos propios y un préstamo. Antes era profesor de ingles  y deportes para niños de primaria, pero después dedico de lleno a la siembra, también cultivo chiltoma. Hoy en día tiene 5 manzanas de tierra propias tiene 3 trabajadores que le ayudan. En este negocio cuenta con la ayuda de su papa y hermano. Además tiene una venta de insumos agrícolas pequeña no esta muy surtida pero le ayuda a mantenerse, distribuye sus productos en Sebaco y la ciudad de Estelí.
Solicito el crédito para la compra de abonos solubles que se utilizan en la siembra de tomates. Con esta inversión espera sacar 2,500 cajillas de tomates que le generaran buenas ganancias, satisfacer la demanda de sus compradores ya que el exporta su producto a Managua, Salvador, Honduras, mejorar el rendimiento de sus cultivos. 
Dentro de sus planes futuros esta poder comprar una camioneta de trabajo, darle mejor mantenimiento a su tractor y como meta comprar otra manzana de tierra para ampliar su cultivo, trabajando de manera tecnificada con un mejor sistema de riego.
texts.en:
Westfall is 33 years old, married, and has a 2 year-old son.  He was born in Pueblo Nuevo, in Estelí municipality.  Westfall studied business administration but he works growing vegetables.  He started his business 7 years ago when he was 25, at first growing tomatoes over one 'manzana' (just over 1.5 acres) of land.  Half of the money he used for this was his own and the rest was from a loan.  Westfall used to be an elementary school English and gym teacher but then he started growing crops full time.  He also grows sweet peppers.

These days, Westfall owns 5 'manzanas' (just over 8 acres) of land and has 3 workers who help him.  His dad and brother also help him in his business.  In addition, he has a small sales location where he sells agricultural supplies.  It isn't very well stocked but it helps him to support himself.  He distributes his products in Sebaco and the city of Estelí. 

Westfall requested this loan to buy soluble manure which he will use on his tomato crop.  With this investment, he hopes to harvest 2,500 small crates of tomatoes which will make him good profits and satisfy the demand of his buyers (he exports his produce to Managua, Salvador and Honduras).  He also hopes to improve his yield.

Some of Westfall's future plans are to buy a work truck, to do better maintenance work on his tractor and to buy another 'manzana' of land so that he can expand his crop.  He also plans to make use of technology and use a better irrigation system.

loans.use: to buy soluble manure for his tomato crop

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es: Ovidio, de 40 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Reyda de 35 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que Ovidio se dedica, es el cultivo de papas, choclos, olluco y arvejas, Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que mientras mejor calidad tengan sus productos, mejores precios obtendrá por sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 33 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre corre el peligro de que los químicos le causen alguna enfermedad. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras, para sembrar más. Este es el segunda crédito con MFP, manifiesta que el crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y respetuoso. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de papa y arveja, ya que en esta temporada son los productos que mejor se venderán.
texts.en:
Ovidio is 40 years old.  He is a very cheerful and hard-working father who lives in his own home together with his wife, 35 year-old Reyda, and his 5 beloved children who are the motivation behind all his efforts.  Ovidio's business is growing potatoes, corn, olluco (a native tuber) and peas.  Every day, very early in the morning, he works on his crops since he knows that the better the quality of his crops, the better the prices he will obtain for them in the wholesale market in Tarma.

What Ovidio most enjoys about his work is harvesting his land since that is when he feels that the months of work have borne fruit.  He has been in this business for 33 years and considers the most difficult part of his work to be spraying his land since he always runs the risk of the chemicals making him sick.  Over time, he would like to buy more land so that he can grow more crops.

This is Ovidio's second loan from MFP and he says that the loan will help him a lot in making progress in his work.  He is a very responsible and respectful member of his community bank.  He will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy potato and pea seeds since, during this season, they are the products that well best.

loans.use: to buy potato and pea seeds

loans.name: Ana Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Juan  se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, ella tiene 26 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen una hija de 8 meses de edad. Su esposo es obrero. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que trabaja como obrera en una fábrica en Manta y además de esto también se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque también aprovecha su lugar de trabajo para venderles a sus colegas de trabajo. Labora dos  días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los padres.
texts.en:
The San Juan Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of San Juan in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year by foreign and domestic tourists. Most of the residents engage in fishing or work at other jobs that are tied to the sea.

In this place one can find Sra. Ana. She is 26 years old, married, and has an eight month old daughter. Her husband is a laborer. She joined the Communal Bank at the very beginning and enjoys it because she has made many friends among her group.

Ana is a strong-willed woman who is employed as a factory worker in Manta. In addition, she engages in trade by selling Yanbal products (a line of beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She sells door-to-door and also takes advantage of her regular job by selling to her co-workers. Ana works at her business two days a week, offering her products on credit and collecting payments at the end of each week. She says the products that sell the most are perfumes because they are very good.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and undergarments. Her dream is to have a house of her own since she currently lives with her parents.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and undergarments.

loans.name: Solidaridad De Jicamarca Group

texts.es: Una alcancía con muchos deseos de superación y ganas por salir adelante, así se caracteriza la alcancía comunal Solidaridad De Jicamarca, el cual lleva ese nombre ya que, así se llama el lugar donde viven los integrantes del grupo. Esta alcancía está conformada por siete integrantes en su mayoría mujeres,  cada integrante  con una historia de vida y de superación personal a lo largo de sus vidas.  Una integrante en particular es la señora Eugenia Y. de 51 años de edad conviviente y madre de un hijo que ya es mayor de edad, ella se dedica hace más de tres años al negocio de su bodega que a su vez también vende útiles escolares en el mismo local. Y eventualmente realiza tejidos a pedido. Comienza en este negocio a raíz, que por donde vive no hay muchas bodegas en donde comprar. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo a podido construir el segundo piso de su casa y con el pasar del tiempo darse una mejor calidad de vida. El reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares para la venta y en el futuro le gustaría ampliar su bodega y así poder generar más ingresos económicos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Solidaridad De Jicamarca is a group whose members share a strong desire to improve themselves and to move forward in their lives; the bank takes its name from the place where the members live.

The group consists of eight individuals, mostly women, each of whom brings a personal history of effort and improvement in course of their lives. One of the members is Eugenia Y., age 51, who lives with her partner and has a son who is already grown. For more than three years, Eugenia has been running a small convenience store where she also sells school supplies; occasionally she also makes hand-woven items to order.

Eugenia started in this business because in her neighborhood there were not that many convenience stores. Thanks to the effort she has put into her work, she has been able to add a second floor to her house and with time achieved a better quality of life.  

Eugenia plans to invest this loan into the purchase of school supplies inventory for her business. In the future, she would like to expand the store and increase her earnings so that she could provide more economic resources for her family.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies

loans.name: Elodia

texts.es: La Sra. Elodia  es una persona muy trabajadora, honesta y sencilla, que se ha distinguido entre sus amistades, porque desde hace 15 años, ella se ha dedicado a la venta de ricos tamales  los  cuales los vende  en las diferentes maquiladoras y  ya  cuenta  con sus clientes que  le  realizan pedidos  por semana , ella al igual que su esposo con su esfuerzo y perseverancia  han  acondicionado su hogar además  de  sacar adelante  a sus hijos, en  esta  ocasión  requieren  el  crédito para  invertir  en su negocio y  de  esta manera  obtener   mayores  ingresos los cuales  les  permitirá continuar  con el acondicionamiento de  su  hogar  y  podrán  a  su vez  instalar  un portón en su  domicilio para  de  esta  manera  tener  mayor  seguridad y  privacidad  en su  domicilio.
texts.en:
Sra. Elodia is a simple, honest, and hardworking woman who has distinguished herself among her friends because she has been selling delicious tamales for fifteen years. Her tamales are sold at different factories where she has customers who place orders each week. Just like her husband, Elodia has worked hard and with perseverance to provide a suitable home to raise her children.

On this occasion, she needs a loan to invest in her business so that she can generate more income. This will allow her to continue remodeling her home as well as install a gate to provide greater security and privacy.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her tamale business.

loans.name: Virginia Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Juan  se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Virginia, ella tiene 21 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen un hijo de dos años de edad. Su esposo trabaja de reciclador. Este es su segundo ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven de mucha ayuda.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que además de esto también se dedica al comercio, vende joyas de fantasía. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos  días por las mañanas ya que como nos cuenta es más fresco para realizar su trabajo, ella  a veces tiene que llevarle a su pequeño hijo cuando sale a vender y otras veces lo deja con su mama pero eso no es todos los días, esto a veces le resulta muy duro pero ella sabe que lo hace por su bien de su familia. Sus productos los compra en una distribuidora en Manta.

Este crédito es para comprar joyas de fantasía como cadenas, pulseras, anillos, aretes, etc.

Su sueño es que a su familia no le falte nada en especial a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
The San Juan Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of San Juan in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year by foreign and domestic tourists. Most of the residents engage in fishing or work at other jobs that are tied to the sea.

In this place one can find Sra. Virginia. She is 21 years old, married, and has a two year old son. Her husband works as a recycler. This is her second loan with the Communal Bank and she enjoys the fact that the loans have been a great help.

Virginia is an excellent homemaker who also has a retail business selling costume jewelry. She sells door-to-door and works every day during the morning hours because the weather is cooler. Usually she takes her young son with her when she goes out to sell and on other occasions she will leave him with her mother. During those times it is difficult for her to be separated from her son, but she knows that she has to do it for the good of the family. Her products are acquired from a distributor in Manta.

This loan will be used to purchase costume jewelry pieces such as necklaces, bracelets, rings, earrings, and other items. Her dream is for her family to not lack anything, especially for her young son.

loans.use: To purchase necklaces, bracelets, rings, earrings, and other items.

loans.name: El Arbolito (The Little Tree) Group

texts.es:
La señora Carmen de 44 años es casada y tiene tres hijos, uno aún depende de ella pero dos ya son adultos e independientes. Ella es presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “El Arbolito”, nombre que le pusieron al grupo para representar el crecimiento paulatino que ellas sienten tener en la Alcancía; de cómo una pequeña semilla termina siendo un gran árbol.
Carmen se dedica hace 8 años a la compra y venta de artículos usados, comúnmente llamados “Chatarrería” o “Reciclaje”, negocio que le genera muy buena rentabilidad, tanto así que ha conseguido armar su casa y ampliarla adecuadamente para su familia. Antes, Carmen buscaba trabajos eventuales como servicio de limpieza o lavando ropa, pero su esposo le hizo ver que podían trabajar juntos y generar más ingresos. Así es como Carmen decide meterse de lleno a este negocio y a la vez reforzar los lazos de pareja con su esposo.
Dentro de sus metas más próximas, está el adquirir una “Mototaxi” (Motocicleta adaptada para brindar servicio de movilidad con pasajeros) para ponerlo a trabajar; también quiere ampliar su negocio a fin de tener un almacén donde guardar sus excedentes de mercadería.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 44, is married and has three children; one of them is still in her care, but the other two are already grown and independent. Carmen is the president of the communal bank "El Arbolito" (The Little Tree) -- a name that represents the gradual growth that the members feel they experience within their group, just like a tiny seed that eventually grows into a big tree. 

For over eight years, Carmen has been in the business of buying and selling second-hand items -- a venture that provides her with a good level of income and has allowed her to outfit her house and expand it to meet her family's needs. Prior to starting in this business, Carmen looked for odd jobs such as house-cleaning or doing laundry, but her husband helped her realize that they could earn more if they worked together. This is why Carmen decided to fully dedicate herself to this venture, which also allows her to strengthen her ties with her husband.

Among Carmen's near-term goals is the plan to purchase a Mototaxi (a motorcycle with a cabin for carrying passengers) to provide additional work for her husband; she would also like to expand her business and specifically to have a storage area where should could keep her excess inventory.

loans.use: to augment working capital

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora María D. es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, su belleza natural, su variedad en la gastronomía la que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños por su gente que es muy amable y cordial.

Doña María tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 24, 22, 21, 19, 14 y 12 años de edad, su primer hijo es discapacitado, su segunda hija trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su tercer y cuarto hijo estudian en el colegio y trabajan, su penúltima hija estudia en una academia de costura y su ultimo hijo se encuentra en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, tienen una casita propia que es de madera.

La Señora. María vende comida, esta actividad la realiza hace 20 años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, también se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cuyes.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para la construccion del techo de su nueva casa que esta construyendo.
 
Su meta es  comprarse un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Sra. María D. is a member of the Communal Bank “Feria Libre” (Open Fair). She lives in the sector of Miraflores in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for the richness of its historical center, its natural beauty, and the variety of cuisines that captivate the palates of locals and foreigners alike. The people are extremely friendly and cordial.

Doña María is 46 years old, married, and has six children (ages 24, 22, 21, 19, 14, and 12). Her oldest child, a son, is disabled. The second child, a daughter, works and helps with the household finances. Her third and fourth children, both sons, attend college and work. The next to last child, a daughter, attends a sewing academy. The youngest, a son, attends high school in the city. Her husband works as a security guard. They own a small home made of wood.

Sra. María has been selling food for twenty years. She works Sunday through Sunday from 6am to 6pm. María also raises chickens and guinea pigs. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for three years. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of materials to build the roof of her new house which is currently under construction. Her goal is to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build the roof of her house.

loans.name: Las Brillantes De La Q Group

texts.es:
La señora Natividad de 48 años tiene una Bodega donde vende abarrotes y útiles escolares, ella es presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “Las Brillantes de la Q” cuyo nombre refleja cómo se sienten en la sociedad: brillantes, que resaltan de lo común y hace mención a la zona donde viven, la Manzana “Q”.
Hace seis meses, Natividad decidió emprender en este negocio para poder estar cerca de su niña de 10 años quien aún sigue en el colegio. Antes de esto vendía jugo en un puesto del mercado que ahora está alquilando para asegurarse otra fuente de ingreso.
Natividad es divorciada, su esposo se fue de la casa cuando gestaba de su última bebe, aún así ella no se rindió y por amor a sus niños trabajó duro para asegurarles el sustento, comprarse artefactos y mejorar poco a poco su casa que carecía de puerta principal en el momento de la separación y que con mucho esfuerzo logró acondicionarlo.
Ahora comparte los gastos del hogar con uno de sus hijos mayores quien también apoya en el abastecimiento del negocio. El siguiente gran paso que desea hacer es agrandar la Bodega y convertirla en un Minimarket e instalarle rejas de fierro.
texts.en:
Sra. Natividad is 48 years old and has a store where she sells groceries and school supplies. She is president of the Communal Bank “Las Brillantes de La Q” (The Brilliant Ones of the Q), which reflects how they feel about themselves as a group – brilliant. Their name also reflects what they have in common which is the name of the area where they live, Section “Q”.

Six months ago, Natividad decided to start a business so that she could be near her ten year old daughter while she is in school. She previously sold juices from a stand at the market, but now she is renting it out while she secures another source of income.

Natividad is divorced. Her husband left home while she was pregnant with her last child. However, she did not give up and out of love for her children, she worked hard to support them, buy appliances, and make gradual improvements that her home was lacking at the time of her separation. With great effort, she was able to complete these upgrades.

Now she shares the household expenses with one of her grown children, who also helps with stocking her business. The next major step is to expand her grocery store, convert it into a mini-market, and install iron security bars.

loans.use: To install iron security bars at a storefront.

loans.name: Flor Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Flor Enríquez es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por la comunidad de Virgen del Cisne en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente es muy amable y cordial, laboran en el comercio, en la agricultura y cría de animales, muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes actividades.
