Doña Flor tiene 21 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 5 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres la misma que es propia y comparten los gastos del hogar.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de hortalizas y verduras, esta actividad  la desempeña hace 3 años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.
 
Se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su vecina, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más hortalizas y legumbres para así ampliar su negocio.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Flor Enríquez is a member of the Communal Bank “Feria Libre” (Open Fair). She lives in the community of Virgen del Cisne in the parish of Cumbe, an area that experiences cold weather. The people are very friendly and cordial and earn their livelihood by working in trade, agriculture, and livestock breeding. Most of them work in the city of Cuenca engaging in different business activities.

Doña Flor is 21 years old and a single mother of a five year old daughter. She lives with her parents who own their house and shares in the household expenses.

Flor sells vegetables and greens. She started this business three years ago and works Sunday through Sunday from 7am to 5pm. This is her first loan with the Communal Bank after being invited to join by her neighbor. The money will be invested in the purchase of more vegetables and legumes so that she can expand her business. Her goal is to own a home.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and legumes.

loans.name: Cookies Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "Cookies" esta ubicado en el estado de México, esta conformado por 9 integrantes entre ellas la señora Dulce Maria D. D. tiene dos negocios vende tacos los fines de semana y por las tardes vende papas fritas Tiene una hija de 3 años de edad y nos platica que desde muy pequeña tuvo muchos problemas de salud pues a su corta edad ya le realizaron dos operaciones en el corazon y una en los intestinos y eso fue lo que la impulso a iniciar su negocio ya que los ingresos de su esposo no alcanzaban para cubrir todos los gastos, ella anhela que su negocio prospere ya es un sustento para su familia. Con el prestamo que se le otorge va a comprar mercancia y asi poder hacer crecer su negocio y tener la seguradad para hacerle frente a cualquier problema.
texts.en:
This group is called "Cookies" and is located in the State of Mexico.  It has 9 members including Dulce Maria D. D. who has two businesses.  She sells tacos at weekends and, in the afternoons, she sells fries.

Dulce Maria has a 3 year-old daughter and she tells us that since she was very small she has had a lot of health problems.  At her young age she has already had two operations on her heart and one on her intestines.  This was what drove Dulce Maria to start her business since her husband's income didn't reach far enough to cover all the expenses.  One of her greatest wishes is for her business to prosper because it is a support to her family.  She will use the loan that she is granted to buy merchandise so that she can grow her business and know for certain that she will be able to face any problem.

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por el barrio San Martín en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, su belleza natural, su variedad en la gastronomía la que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños y por su gente que es muy amable y cordial.

Doña María tiene 69 años, está separada y tiene 11 hijos de los cuales  8 son casados e  independientes, sus 3 hijos solteros trabajan y ayudan  económicamente. Con su trabajo y sacrificio ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se dedica a la venta de papas con cuero (plato típico), vende este producto en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca y labora de lunes a sábados. Para la preparación de este plato se levanta a las 4 de la mañana y trabaja  hasta que termine de vender su producto.  En su casa cría cuyes y gallinas a los cuales los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. En el tiempo que pasa en casa también se dedica a la atención de una pequeña tienda, la misma que tiene hace un año y medio.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 12 años y los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en sus negocios, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un quintal de arroz, papas, cuero de chancho y más productos que necesita para la elaboración de sus platos.
 
Su sueño es hacer una casa pequeña en un terreno que tiene y allí poner su tienda y ampliarla.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Feria Libre” (Open Fair). She lives in the San Martín neighborhood in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for the richness of its historical center, its natural beauty, and the variety of cuisines that captivate the palates of locals and foreigners alike. The people are extremely friendly and cordial.

Doña Maria is 69 years old, separated from her spouse, and has eleven children. Eight of them are married and independent, while the other three are single, working, and helping her financially. Through work and sacrifice, Maria was able to build her own home.

Doña Maria sells a traditional dish called “papas con cuero” (potatoes with pork skins). She works Monday through Saturday selling her product in central Cuenca. In order to prepare this dish, she wakes up at 4am and continues to work until she finishes selling her product. At home, she raises guinea pigs and chickens to sell whenever there is a financial need. While she is at home, Maria also manages a small store that she opened a year and a half ago.

Maria has been with the Communal Bank for twelve years and the loans have been a great benefit to her businesses. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of a quintal of rice (1 quintal = 46kg), potatoes, pork skins, and other products that are needed to prepare her dishes.

Her dream is to have a small structure on her property where she can move her store and expand it.

loans.use: To purchase rice, potatoes, pork skins, and other supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: 3 Tien Phong - Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Hoa H. T. (10) is a 36-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Hoa is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.12.1.3 Nam Ngan (3 Tien Phong - Nam Ngan).

Hoa is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, she owns and operates a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community.  She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $96 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  

She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be her 2nd loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Thuyet (11) is a 39 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


2.  P. T. Vuong (12) is a 52 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


3.  N. T. Hien (14) is a 41 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoa H. T. (10) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.12.1.3 Nam Ngan (3 Tien Phong - Nam Ngan).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hải sản như cá và tôm trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.963.500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Thuyet (11) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  P. T. Vuong (12) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  N. T. Hien (14) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional seafood products to sell

loans.name: Sou's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sou, a 39 year old married woman, is a group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by its four members. The members of this group will use their money to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Sou's husband is a farmer who owns 3-hectare plot of land which he uses to grow rice for a living. This couple has five children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is employed in a shoe factory, and one is a laborer, while the others are attending in the local school.

Mrs. Sou is a pig breeder who is able to earn a small income to help support her family. Her family living doesn't have a well, so she would like to ask for a loan to add her saving to dig a well.

loans.use: To add her savings, to dig a functional well.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey works hard to support her family. Joey is married and has a ready to wear (clothing) business in the Philippines.

Joey requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products.

Joey has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from frozen goods vending.

In the future, Joey would like to expand her business, to send her kids to school, and to have savings for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing products to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth joined Grameen America with a dream of opening her own hair salon.  To date, she has received four loans totaling $12,800 to invest in her beautician work, where she rents a chair in a hair salon.  One year ago Elizabeth and her husband separated and she was left with four children to proviD. for.  As her daily expenses increased she maD. the difficult decision to send her four year old son to be cared for by his grandparents in the Dominican Republic while she worked long hours to get back on her feet.  Today Elizabeth is once again reunited with her son and is focusing on achieving her dream. Through Grameen America's savings program Elizabeth has already accrued over $3,500 in her savings account and continues to save until the day that she opens her salon.  This loan will help Elizabeth to purchase additional supplies and continue to grow her customer base.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang S., 38, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells groceries, earning an income of about $15 per day. Her husband is a soldier, earning an income of $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $35 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. Seang is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her 2nd loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen resides with her family in a four-room brick house in the area of Tahliwala, which is a residential area in Pakpattan. Pakpattan is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its agriculture industry. 

Her husband's name is M. M. and he operates a bicycle repair shop. He provides puncture repair services from there and also sells bicycle spare parts to his customers. He has been involved in this business for the past twenty years and is known as an expert in his field. 

Perveen supports her family financially by selling clothes. She takes orders from her community clients and fulfills them by purchasing clothes from the city of Lahore. She is a seamstress as well and sews clothes on order. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works while the others stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband, who will utilize the loan in buying some bicycle repair tools and spare parts for the improvement of his business. Perveen is hopeful that her husband will be able to do his work better and earn better profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy tools and spare parts for the bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh T., 26, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. T. is a farmer and raises pigs, earning an income of approximately $3 per day. His wife is employed at the factory, earning an income of $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $35 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

T. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem E., 42, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. E. sells handmade brooms, earning an income of about $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $45 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar lives in Pakpattan which is a small city of Punjab province in Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. For the past ten years, she and her family have resided there in a two-room brick house in the area of Tahliwala. 

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her business of selling clothes. She started this business after the death of her husband, C. M., some years ago. It was a time of great difficulty for her but she recovered her senses and started this business to bear the financial burden of her family. 

She is the mother of a son and a daughter. She worked very hard for the continuation of her children’s education. Her son has completed his Masters education and sells vegetables because he didn’t find a better job after his education. Her daughter is a teacher in a nearby school. 

Kosar is hopeful that through the loan investment, her business will improve and she will be able to fulfill the customers' needs and increase her profits. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proven herself to be a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Kosar.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Pom T., 54, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. T. is a worker at the railway station, earning an income of about $4 per day. His wife sells handmade brooms, earning an income of around $2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $35 on food and $40 on the other necessary expenses. T. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eighteen members. Mrs. Phan, a 33 year old married woman, is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. While each member of this village will use their portions of the loans to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Phan and her husband are pig breeders who are able to earn a small income to help support their family's costs of living. In order to support this business, Mrs. Phan would like to ask for a loan to buy pig food for pig breeding. Aside from being a pig breeder, her husband is earns his living by woodcutting. 

This couple has four children: two are attending in the local school and the others two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy pig food for pig breeding.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San K., 42, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. K. sells soft drinks, earning an income of about $7 per day. 

Her husband produces traditional musical instruments to sell, earning an income of about $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $35 on food and $74 on the other necessary expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more materials for her husband to make traditional musical instruments. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy materials for her husband to make musical instruments

loans.name: Ameena's Group

texts.en:
Ameena has a thread rolls selling business. She receives orders from different thread shops in the market and fulfills them on time to generate income for the family. She started this business to support her family financially.  She is the mother of two sons. Both are illiterate and couldn’t get an education due to financial reasons. Her elder son operates a stamp papers business (used for legal documentation), and the younger one is a driver by profession and provides transport services to his passengers. 

Ameena has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her younger son who wants to replace his old tires with new ones for his vehicle, which is an auto-rickshaw. This will help him provide better transportation services to the passengers and make more profit. 

She is hopeful that this investment will bring more profits to her son by improving the condition of his vehicle. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. She has maintained a good credit record in previous loan years. 

She belongs to Pakpattan, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its agriculture industry. For the past twenty years, she has been living there with her family in a two-room brick house in the area of Tahliwala.

loans.use: To replace the old tires of an auto-rickshaw with new tires

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma B. is from the town of Guinatan, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Thelma is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Thelma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Chhem K., 45, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. K. rents her house to workers, earning an income of $3 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $60 US on food and $74 US on other necessary expenses. Kimsan is requesting a loan of $1000 US to build more rooms to rent. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to build more rooms to rent.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a  married parent of six children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Helen is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase new tools and equipment for her tricycle transport business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business and to send her kids to school.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and equipment for her transport business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia sells clothes to share financial responsibilities for her family with her husband. She is also a very good housewife and does her household work very well. She is a very active and supportive lady who has been living in the city of Pakpattan for the past 20 years. Pakpattan is small city in the Punjab province, known for its agriculture industry. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house in the Tahliwala area. Razia is married to T., a fruit seller. At his shop in the market, he offers fresh seasonal fruits at inexpensive prices. 

Razia has three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son has a private job, the second sells wheat and her remaining children are enrolled in a local school. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business, who will use the loan to buy fresh seasonal fruits for resale. He has been operating this business for the past five years and Razia is confident that this investment will be productive for his business and will help him to increase his sales and income. She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. She has always paid her installments on time and attended every meeting.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits for resale.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 52 years old and married with four children.

Amelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Amelita has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from tricycle transport.

Amelita aspires to expand her business and plans to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Noem's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 19 members. Mr. NO. was born in 1953. He was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this village will use their money to support their different purposes.

Mr. NO. and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow rice. They also have 2 children who are also farmers. Besides farming, they also earn a living by selling Khmer natural medicine and as a fisherman. Even with these jobs, they still don't earn enough income to support the family. Thus, in order to improve the family's condition, Mr. NO. would like to ask for a loan to buy pig food and piglets for breeding.

loans.use: to buy pig food and piglets for breeding

loans.name: Bourng

texts.en: Bourng L., 38, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. L. is a housewife and her husband is an electrician, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 10 on other necessary expenses. L. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a tuk tuk for her husband to start a new business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk tuk for her husband to start a new business.

loans.name: Sataan's Group

texts.en:
Sataan live in Mian Channu, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a single room brick house with her family for the past eight years. A caring and supportive lady, Sattan prefers to stay at home and do her household responsibilities. She is a very good mother who is raising her children very well. She also operates a livestock business from home, raising and selling goats. She has five sons, two of whom are factory workers, one who works as a driver, one who studies and a five-year-old who stays at home. Her husband, M. B., works for the railway, earning a low income.

Sataan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah in order to improve her livestock business. With the loan, she will buy goats and sheep to sell for a profit. She hopes that with this loan investment her business will grow further and that she will be able to improve the financial condition of her family. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for a livestock business.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa C. is from the town of Guinatan, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 38 and single. Felisa own a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over three years, earning approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Felisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her food products. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Nasibahon

texts.ru: Нарзуллоева Насибахон проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 32 года. Замужем. имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для вспашки земли, то есть берет в аренду трактор и для закупа семян.
texts.en: Nasibahon N. lives in the Yavan district.  She is 32 years old, married and has 2 children.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years.  Nasibahon has a plot of land by her house, where she grows vegetables for sale.  She is requesting this loan for land plowing, i.e. renting a tractor, and for the purchase of seeds.

loans.use: to plow land and purchase seeds

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem lives in a two-room brick house with her family in Mian Channu, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family for the past eight years. Her husband, M. B., works in agriculture. He is very experienced in his business and grows different crops according to the seasons and has many business contacts.

Naseem is a housewife, staying at home to fulfill household responsibilities. She has a son who is illiterate because Naseem couldn’t provide him with an education due to financial constraints. He is involved in an animal-sales business and Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her son to buy some animals in order to expand this business. With this loan, he will buy goats and sheep to raise and sell for a profit. He has many years of experience in this business and Naseem is hopeful that he will be able to get better results from his business after the loan investment. She wants him to marry as he is now 23 years old and she is hopeful that she will be able to do this very soon with the increased profits from the loan.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for resale.

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.ru: Кучарова Зулхумор проживает в районе Яван. Ей 42 года. Она замужем, имеет 7 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Сама Зулхумор занимается растениеводством, она в основном выращивает овощи. В этой области уже 10 лет. Целью кредита является закуп семян и топлива для трактора. Она берет кредит для весеннего посева.
texts.en: Zulkhumor K. lives in the Yavan district.  She is 42 years old, married and has 7 children.  Her husband is working in Russia.  Zulkhumor is involved in agriculture.  She primarily grows vegetables.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  The goal of this loan is to purchase seeds and fuel for a tractor.  She is requesting the loan for the spring sowing.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fuel for a tractor

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a very supportive lady. Her husband, S. A., operates a grocery store in the market. At his store, he sells daily use items such as cooking oil, sugar and spices at reasonable rates. He is the only person earning income for the family. Sughran is a housewife, staying at home and doing household work. She is the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in a local school to get their education. She is a resident of Mian Channu, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband expand his grocery business. With this loan, he will buy groceries in bulk in order to earn better profits by selling larger quantities of groceries. He has been operating this business for the past six years and Sughran is confident that he will be able to improve his business with the help of a loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loans.use: to buy groceries for retail.

loans.name: Bubirayho

texts.ru: Нарзуллоева Бубирайхо жительница Яванского района. Ей 60 лет. Вдова, имеет 8 детей. У нее среднее образование. Она занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет большой участок земли, где выращивает овощи, для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 16 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Bubirayho N. lives in the Yavan district.  She is 60 years old, a widow and has 8 children.  She has a secondary education.  She is involved in agriculture.  Bubirayho has a large plot of land at her house, where she grows vegetables for sale.  She has been involved in this type of business for 16 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia, 23, is married to J. I., who operates a livestock business. He has two cows and some goats and sheep. He sells their milk and also sells them for profit to butchers and other buyers. 

Shazia lives in Mian Channu, a small city in Punjab Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family for the past 12 years. She is a housewife, staying at home to take care of household responsibilities. She takes these responsibilities very seriously and makes the utmost effort to give comfort to her family through her work. She is the mother of a six year old son, who is in school. Shazia is very fond of education but was unable to get one herself due to the poor circumstances of her parents. She wants to provide a quality education to her son so that he may become a successful person.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy cattle for resale. He has operated this business for the past six years and Shazia hopes that after the loan investment her husband’s business will be in a more profitable position and result in a better financial condition for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle for a livestock business.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is married to M. I., who has a business selling groceries. His shop is located in the market and he sells daily-use items such as salt, sugar, spices and cooking oil. He is a very good person and treat his clients respectfully.

Zarina is a housewife and stays at home to do household work. She is a very supportive lady and always ready to help her family in difficult times. She has three daughters and two sons, all of whom are studying at a local school, except for the youngest. She is a resident of Mian Channu, a small city in the Punjab province of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah in order to expand her husband’s grocery business. With the loan, he will stock more groceries to his shop in order to increase his sales and income. He has been operating this business for the past six years and Zarina is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one. She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. She has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting during previous loan years.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Maysara

texts.ru: Маханова Майсара проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 36 лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Образование-среднее. Уже 7 лет как она занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. Кредит берет для закупа семян. Она хочет посеять и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Maysara M. lives in the Yavan district.  She is 36 years old, married and has three children.  She has a secondary education.  She has been involved in agriculture for 7 years.  Maysara has a small plot of land by her house, where she grows vegetables and plants fruit trees.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds.  She wants to sow and pick a good harvest for sale.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina lives in Mian Channu, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a three-room brick house with her family in the Meharbad area for the past five years. She is a housewife, staying at home to do her household responsibilities. She is a very good mother who has raised her four children very well. Her eldest son sells wheat and rice and the second works in a factory. The remaining two children stay at home and are unemployed. Robina couldn’t provide them with an education due to poor financial conditions.

Her husband, Y. M., has a grocery store in the market. Robina helps her husband by visiting his grocery store once a day to deal with his customers. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband to stock more groceries in order to fulfill his customer demands. He has been running this business for the past five years and Robina hopes that with the loan investment her husband’s business will grow further and his monthly income will be increased.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Robina.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 41 years old and married with five children. Her oldest child is 21 years old. Her husband works as a farmer and driver. Elizabeth owns a sari-sari store which she's been running for 3 years. She sells items like soft drinks, noodles and canned goods. She usually earns about 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. Elizabeth also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as canned goods. She will also buy feed for the pigs. In the future, Elizabeth wants to see her children finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase feed, canned goods and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan lives with his wife, his disabled mother, and his sister, who is a student.  He is an engineer by trade, but the family's main source of income comes from his construction materials shop in the market.  Vardan would like to enlarge his business and increase sales, so he has applied for a loan to make this happen along with the purchase of new inventory for the shop. He hopes that these additions will bring more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase new construction materials to be sold in his shop

loans.name: Pigy Lestari Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang R., as head of this group, obtained a loan of 1,000,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) to buy two pigs to be used as sows. Ni Komal R. finds it helpful to supplement the family's income with this effort. She works daily as a farmer with one child who is an adult. She hope the future cooperation is still running smoothly.

Pigy Lestari Group has received a loan for the third time from MUK. But the presence of only eight people is realized, because two members were attending a religious ceremony.

loans.use: to buy two pigs.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is married to M. R. who sells cotton. He buys cotton from different farmers and supplies different shops in the market at profit. He is the only person earning income in the family. Kosar herself is a housewife; she prefers to stay at home and performs her household responsibilities. She has given birth to a son and a daughter. Both are illiterate for the reason that Kosar and her husband couldn’t afford their education. 

Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to help her husband, who wants to buy more cotton to supply more shops. This will help him fulfill larger orders on time and make more profit. He has more than nine years of experience in this field and Kosar is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to him and upgrade her family’s living style. 

Kosar lives in Mian Channu which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture.

loans.use: to buy cotton for selling.

loans.name: Ruqqiya Muhammad Sharif's Group

texts.en:
Ruqqiya M. S. lives in Mian Channu, a small city located in Pakistan’s Punjab province and known for its agriculture industry. She has given birth to three sons and four daughters. Only three of them are able to go to school because Ruqqiya cannot afford schooling for all of her children due to limited financial resources.

Ruqqiya has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business of selling crushed wood which is used to fill furniture. He started this business five years ago, and it is going well for him, but he needs to expand it further. With the loan he will purchase crushed wood in bulk to supply carpenters to increase his monthly profits.

Ruqqiya is very hopeful about the positive growth of her husband’s business and a better financial future for her family.

loans.use: To buy crushed wood to sell to furniture makers

loans.name: Torkun

texts.en:
Torkun N. is 46, married and has 6 children. She worked as a cashier for a long time and is characterized by her colleagues as a very hardworking and responsible person. After the breakdown of the Soviet Union, she started her business in breeding cattle and land cultivating. With an initial capital of 3,000 KGS, she managed to develop a farm with two milk cows, two horses and sixty sheep. Today she earns about 8,000 KGS per month from selling milk and meat products. Torkun also has a fruit garden with apples, pears, raspberries and currants, which provides additional earnings for her family.  

Now Torkun has applied for a loan of 130,000 KGS to purchase two mares, which will allow her to multiply her cattle and broaden her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her son. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma, a 41-year-old married woman with five children, works hard to support her family. Alma earns a living through food vending and the sale of her fisherman husband's catch in the local community. She also makes rice cakes and other delicacies that she sells around the neighborhood. Alma is asking for a loan to purchase a boat engine for her husband, which will help her business to continue.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Otgonjargal, 28, is married and lives with his wife and son in Arhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. They have an average standard of living. Otgonjargal began selling clothes in 2010. He started his business with 1,300,000 MNT of working capital. His wife helps him with the business. He sells goods by traveling from one place to another place, while his wife operates a stall at the market. Their monthly sales volume fluctuates between 750,000 and 1,200,000 MNT. Otgonjargal is planning to expand his business and start making woodcraft items at home. He is a hardworking person who says, "I pay attention to the quality of the service that I offer to others." He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase wood and necessary equipment for his new business.

loans.use: to purchase wood and equipment for woodcraft business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia has a business selling to the market assorted fresh fish caught by her fisherman husband. Working hard to improve their business, she is requesting a loan to purchase fishing hooks and nets which will help her husband catch more fish.

Amalia is 38 years old and has five children, the oldest 18 and the youngest only 2. Currently making improvements to their house, Amalia hopes to earn more and be able to complete the work soon.

loans.use: to purchase fishing hooks and nets

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
42-year-old Andresa runs a fishing business. She sells assorted fresh fish to the market. Her husband, who is a fisherman, goes to the sea to catch fish. Andresa has been engaged in fishing for 15 years.

Andresa is asking for a loan to purchase fishing hooks and nets. This will help her husband catch more fish.

Andresa has 5 children, the oldest of whom is 18 years old. Andresa works hard to sustain their education and to provide a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fishing hooks and nets.

loans.name: Bathuyag

texts.en:
Bathuyag, 38, is married and lives with his wife and four children in Arhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. They have a decent standard of living. His wife helps him with the business and his three of his children attend a local secondary school. 

Bathuyag began a clothes trading business in 2000. He sells clothes out of a rented stall at a local market. He started his business with a working capital of 300,000 MNT and now his working capital exceeds 3,420,000 MNT. He now operates two stalls at the market and makes sofas and beds in addition to his clothes-trading business. He is one of the reliable customers of XacBank, since 2004. Bathuyag is a hardworking and modest person. He is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase more consumer goods and materials for his furniture making business.

loans.use: To purchase more consumer goods and materials.

loans.name: Amarbayasgalan

texts.en:
Amarbayasgalan, 61, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in their own house on a small plot of land that they own. They have a decent standard of living. Her husband co-works with her and her two children attend a college. 

Amarbayasgalan began selling groceries and vegetables out of a stall in 1995. She started her retail trading business with a working capital of 50,000 MNT and her current working capital exceeds 410,000 MNT. She supplies vegetables, by custom orders, to cafes and restaurants. She became one of the reliable customers of our bank since 2000. She is a hardworking person who says, "I try to purchase and sell fresh and high quality vegetables." She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm materials

loans.name: Obida

texts.ru: Тошпулатова Обида проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 54 года. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Сыновья занимаются растениеводством. Сама Обида работает на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает фрукты. Этим видом деятельности занимается 3 года. Кредит берет для покупки апельсинов, бананов и киви.
texts.en: Obida T. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 54 years old. She is married and has three children. Her sons are doing agriculture. Obida works on the market where she rents out a vendor space where she sells fruits. She has been in this business for three years. She is taking out the loan to buy oranges, bananas and kiwi.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas and kiwi

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina, 55 years old, sells fresh fish and seaweed to earn a living. Her husband is a fisherman. Faustina sells his entire catch to the market. She also plants and harvests seaweeds to sell. Faustina is asking for a loan to purchase fish nets and other supplies that she needs for her business.

Faustina works hard to support her family. She has 5 children, the oldest of whom is 24 years old.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and other supplies.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph O. is 41 years old, married and the father of one child. He has been working as a mechanic in a garage where he repairs vehicles for his customers in Kangemi, Nairobi. He earns an income of 10,000 KES per month.

Joseph learned about KADET LTD through a friend. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to purchase spare parts. He intends to use the anticipated profit to save and plow back into the business.

In the future Joseph would like to grow his business and start selling spare parts from Dubai and Japan.

loans.use: To buy spare auto parts

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca sells RTW clothes and slippers to her community. She is also an Avon dealer. Francisca's husband is a fisherman. She helps him by selling his catch to the market. Francisca works hard to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

Francisca is 43 years old, married, and has 5 children. Her oldest child is 21 years old. Francisca wishes for her children to succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Хочаева Мохира проживает в районе Варзоб. Ей 28 лет. Она разведена. Живет вместе с родителями. Детей не имеет. У нее высшее образование, преподаватель. По профессии работает более 5 лет. Кроме того она в свободное от работы время занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Она в основном откармливает и продает крупнорогатый скот. В этой области уже 3 года. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы.
texts.en: Mohira K. lives in the Varzob region. She is 28 years old. She is divorced and lives with her parents. She does not have children. She has higher education and is a teacher by profession. Mohira has worked as a teacher for more than five years. Besides that in her free time from work she does animal husbandry. She breeds large horned cattle at home. She mainly feeds and sells large horned cattle and has been in this business for three years. She is taking out the loan to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Bebelita

texts.en:
Bebelita, a 37-year-old mother of four children, is married to a farmer. Their oldest child is 13 years old. Bebelita cooks viands, pancakes and other types of food that she sells to the community, a business she started a year ago. She usually earns about 2000 PHP per month and is now requesting a loan to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients that she needs for her enterprise.

Bebelita works hard to provide for her family and sustain her chidlren's education.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Kitembe Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Lawrence is a thirty-six-year old married man with three children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married to a teacher and they both contribute to the welfare of the family. He lives in his own house and, in total, there are thirteen family members.

For two years he has been trading in alcohol. He started by selling four jerrycans per week but he now sells fifteen despite the challenges of transport and competition from other alcohol brands. He is a member of Kitembe Tukwatanize group which literally means "we should cooperate". His desire is to set up a bar and also to supply the western region of the country.

Lawrence intends to use the loan to purchase alcohol for sale.

loans.use: to purchase alcohol to sell

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
57-year-old Cerelina sells RTW clothes to her community. She is also an Avon dealer. She has been in this business for 11 years and usually earns 2,000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan to purchase more clothes to resell. This will help to sustain Cerelina's business.

Cerelina is a married woman with 2 children aged 24 and 12. She wishes to have a stable business to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is currently in the business of selling bread. She is 28 years old, married to an engineer, and has 4 children who all go to school. Mary wants a loan to stock more bread to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred A. is 34 years old, married and the father of two children. For fourteen years he has been selling secondhand shoes in Gikomba’s open air market. He earns an income of 20,000 KES per month.

Alfred learned about KADET LTD through a friend. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to purchase more shoes to sell.

Alfred intends to use the anticipated profit to improve the living standards of his family. In the future he plans to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Gundsambuu

texts.en: Gundsambuu, 30, is married and lives with his wife and son in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard. He began operating a car repair service in 2007. He sells spare parts in his workshop and his working capital is 2,100,000 MNT. Now his business has become more stable and he has one employee. He offers  good quality service and has been able to attract many customers. He is a hardworking and modest person. He mainly focuses on the quality of his service. He wants to expand his business in the future. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts for his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a food vendor in Trinidad, Bohol. She makes different kinds of rice cakes and pansit (noodles). She started this business a year ago. Editha works hard to build up her business. She said she has to earn more because both of her kids now go to school.

Editha requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients. She says this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 61 years old and lives in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. She lives in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in her son's backyard. She used to live in the countryside and came to live in the province center in 2006.

She sells cooked meals in order to support herself. She has her regular customers, as she cooks delicious meal. She is a hardworking person and she says, "We cannot live without foodl. I like cooking delicious meals and I like people enjoying the meals cooked by me." She is requesting a loan of 250,000 MNT to purchase food ingredients.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Nyabukara Banywani Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a thirty-five-year-old married man with six children living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.The responsibility of taking care of the family rests solely on him, and his dream is to educate his children up to university. 

After failing to proceed with his own education due to financial constraints, Joseph decided to venture into motorcycle transport, and he has been in this business for thirteen years. He has a problem with his employees who fail to remit the actual amount due on time. Joseph's aspiration is to have at least six motorcycles. 

He intends to use the credit facility to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a resident and farmer in Litein Town in South Rift Kenya. He has been in farming for ten years doing mixed farming and producing milk and maize for the local market. He is married with four children, aged between and 1 and 6 years.

Josphat has requested for this loan amounting to 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the acquisition of a dairy cow will mean additional milk production for the family's consumption as well as income that will see the children through further education.

Josphat laments the market prices and poor road systems, which makes delivery to the market expensive, hence cutting in on the farmers' income.

loans.use: Purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel, 41, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the Arhangai province of Mongolia.  They live in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. 

She began selling meat and meat products at a local food market in 2002. She started her business with a working capital of 50,000 MNT and her current working capital exceeds 250,000 MNT. She breeds pigs which she uses for meat. Her business has become more stable and now she has her own regular customers. She is a hardworking person who says, "I am trying to save money for my children and help them to get a good education." 

She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy a car so that her husband will be able to help her with the business by transporting the meat from one place to another.

loans.use: to buy a car for transporting meat

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena makes different kinds of rice cakes that she sells in her community. She also makes banana cue. She has been in this business for three years and usually earns about $75 per month. Magdalena has requested a loan to purchase ingredients such as flour and sugar. She hopes that this loan will help improve her business.

Magdalena is 56 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have an 18-year-old child.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour and sugar

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is a widow and has three children, all of whom are in school. Regina has a business of selling fruits. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works five days out of every week. She also rents out homes as an additional source of income. 

Regina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to purchase more melons, passion fruit, and pineapple. The main business challenge for Regina is seasonality. Her goal is to build more houses. 

Regina lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of passion fruit, watermelon and pineapple

loans.name: Gulnaz's Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz A., the 33-year-old leader of this group, resides in Balykchi, a small town of 41,500 people by Lake Issyk Kul. It is the place where Gulnaz and her husband grew up, married and established a family of three children. In 11 years of marriage, the family has made several attempts at starting a business, all in vain until eight years ago when they found the means to open a salon to provide computer services.

In a small town many residents don’t have access to either the Internet or a personal computer. The salon has become a very reliable means of communication with the outside world, and Gulnaz’s customers include youth who come to enjoy computer games or social networks and adults who use e-mail and office supplies.

The business was started with capital of 60,000 soms to purchase six computers. Gulnaz has since improved arrangements in the salon and expanded the business, resulting in a monthly income of 30,000 soms which has allowed her to purchase a long-waited apartment. Gulnaz’s portion of this loan will be used to buy necessary parts for the computers and a central processing unit.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren, 61, is married and lives with his wife and daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. 

He began operating a bakery and woodcraft trading business in 2000. Then he started to sell clothes in 2006. His daughters help him to purchase goods from China and he takes care of the sales. He rents a stall at a local market. He started his retail trading business with a working capital of 200,000 MNT and his current working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT. He has been one of the reliable customers of our bank since 2000. 

Byambasuren is a hardworking and honest person who says, " I want to expand my business and help my children start their own life". He is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase clothes for his business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. She is 20 years old, married to a businessman, and has 5 children; only 2 of them go to school. Charity took a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Batrentsen

texts.en:
Batrentsen, 34, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. They have a decent standard of living. His wife is self-employed and his older daughter attends a local primary school. 

Batrentsen began selling consumer goods in 2006. He purchases clothing from China and sells from a rented stall at the market. He began his business with working capital of 1,000,000 MNT and his current working capital exceeds 3,700,000 MNT. Now he operates two stalls. He has been one of our reliable customers since 2007. Batrentsen is a hardworking and honest person. He is requesting a loan of 3,600,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for his business .

loans.use: to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a seller of RTW (ready-to-wear) clothes in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells shirts, jeans and also slippers. She has been in this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more clothes to resell.

Martina is married to a driver. They have 2 kids aged 6 and 12. Martina says that she and her husband work hard to provide for their family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. Margret has a restaurant. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days a week. She also has a transportation business (motorcycle for hire) as an additional source of income. Margret has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, beef, rice, Irish potatoes and chicken.

The main business challenge for Margret is seasonality. She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expense is rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, beef, rice, Irish potatoes and chicken

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate the rental houses and to buy packing tins for yoghurt.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, aged 41, is a farmer in Kitale Town, Western Kenya. He has been in mixed farming for ten years, producing and selling milk, tomatoes and vegetables to the local market. He also operates a motorcycle transport business to subsidize the farming income.

He has requested for a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to set up a poultry unit and to purchase poultry birds. He says the loan will allow him to venture into the poultry business and help him diversify his businesses. He also plans to own four quality dairy cows to improve his milk production capacity to over 30 litres per day.

Richard points out that a poor roads network is a great challenge and frequently results in delay of produce to the market.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and to set up a poultry unit.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda, a 40-year-old farmer who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol, has been growing rice for five years. Her husband is also a farmer, and they help each other keep the farm productive. Criselda also sells their harvest to the market. She is now requesting a loan to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies in the hope of increasing the harvest.

Criselda has seven children, her oldest 20 and her youngest only a year old.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also cares for her father. Farida lives in a home that she rents; she does not have access to electricity or to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

Farida sells sugar cane. She has been in business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. The main business challenge for Farida is the seasonal aspect of sugar cane.

Farida has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to purchase more bundles of sugar cane to sell. Her goal is to boost her business and make more in profits.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of sugar cane

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma M. is a married woman who has three children, the oldest of whom is ten years old. She lives in the municipality of Trinidad in the province of Bohol on the Central Visayas islands.

Gemma owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like milk, noodles and canned goods.

Gemma has requested a loan to purchase noodles, canned goods and other items to sell. She hopes to have a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: To purchase noodles, canned goods and other items to sell

loans.name: Mawimbi Group

texts.en:
Pandu H., who is in his early sixties, is married with four children and twelve grandchildren (in the picture, Pandu is the only man and is in front). He sells coffee and water outside his house. He has been in business for 25 years. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Pandu's fourth “motisha” loan fron Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania which allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. He has paid back his previous loans successfully. He hopes to obtain a loan to finish building his house in Zanzibar, an island off Tanzania.

Pandu will share this loan with his loan group, Mawimbi, which has a total of fourteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To continue building his house

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Aneth T., who is in her early forties, is married with three children.  She has been running a general store for two years.  She works from 6.00am to 9.00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Aneth's sixth loan from Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the shop inventory and to pay school fees. She has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to again increase the shop inventory.  Her dream is to one day own a grocery and sell just soft drinks.

Aneth will share this loan with her loan group "Unity", which has a total of fifteen members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Aneth is first on the right with a dark blouse.

loans.use: to increase her shop inventory.

loans.name: Royal Group

texts.en:
Mariam O., who is in her late thirties, is married with one child.  She has been running a grocery business where she sells beer, soda and water.  She starts working at 4.00pm until around midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy empty crates and beer and has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more beer.  It seems she has more customers who buy beer than sodas and water. Her dream is to one day start a chicken business.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "Royal" which has a total of 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Mariam is behind a man with a red t-shirt.

loans.use: To buy more beers

loans.name: Kizota Group

texts.en:
Tatu S., who is in her late thirties, is married with two children.  She has been running a business of selling ladies clothes and handbags for three years.  She sells her products from door to door.  She works from 9.00am to 4.00pm (7 hours only) and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Tatu's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy bedsheets, hand bags, face creams and food at a local place.  She has paid back all her loans sucessfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more bags and she will start selling charcoal.

Tatu will share this loan with her loan group "Kizota", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Tatu is second from the right, in the first row.

loans.use: to start selling charcoal and also buy more bags

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is currently in a business of selling sugar. She is 22 years old and married to a businessman. Her two children do not go to school yet. Mary took out a loan to stock more sugar to sell.  She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more sugar to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Ma. Corazon is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Corazon is 41 years old and one of her children is in school.

Ma. Corazon has a ready to wear (RTW) clothing business in the Philippines. Ma. Corazon requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products.

Ma. Corazon has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Ma. Corazon would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 54 years old and widowed with six children. One of the children is in school. Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock for her sari-sari store.

Mercedita has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, shampoo, toothpaste, soap, bread, sugar, juice, candies, etc. Mercedita also earns income from a ready to wear business.

In the future, Mercedita would like to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lourdes is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lourdes is 51 years old and has one child who is in school.

Lourdes has a furniture shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase lumber materials for her furniture making business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 18 years.  In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of lumber and other materials forher furniture making business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children, three of whom are in school. Rose has a business of selling vegetables. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works six days out of every week. Rose has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to purchase more bunches of sweet and yellow bananas and avocados to sell. 

The main business challenge for Rose is seasonality. Her goal is to boost her business and earn more profits. Rose lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas and avocados to sell

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 47 years old and married with five children.

Consolacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock.

Consolacion has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from gasoline retailing.

Consolacion aspires to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en: Miraflor, a 19-year-old young woman living in Trinidad, Bohol with her family, manages their sari-sari store which sells items such as soft drinks and canned goods. She has been running the store for a year now and usually earns about 3000 PHP per month. Miraflor has requested a loan of PHP 6000 to purchase additional merchandise to sell and hopes for her store to grow.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Actable The Best Group

texts.en:
Asha Hamisi, who is in her late thirties, is married with 5 children.  She has been running a salon since 2000. She works from 8.30am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Asha's second loan from Tanzania Limited. She used the previous loan to start selling fabric and sarongs in her saloon. She also bought salon equipment. She has paid back her loan successfully. She now hopes for a loan to buy salon equipment. Her dream is to, one day, open a food shop and sell at wholesale prices.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group, "Actable the Best", which has a total of 15 members. The group members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

In the picture, Asha is 1st on the left in the second row.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Safina has a tailoring business. She has been in this business for ten years and she works seven days a week. Safina has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to purchase more materials for her sewing business.The main business challenge for Safina is transportation. Her goal is to expand her business and to earn more profit. 

Safina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more material for tailoring

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa works hard to support her family. Jesusa is married and has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines.

Jesusa requested a PHP 16,500 loan through NWTF to purchase a bike and a sidecar.

Jesusa has been in this business for six years now and also earns additional income from a ready to wear (RTW) business.

In the future, Jesusa would like to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase a bike and sidecar

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Charily

texts.en:
Charily is 44 years old and married with 10 children, three of them in school. Charily works very hard to provide for them.

Charily runs a business buying & selling rice grains in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more rice grains.

Charily has been in this business for six years and has sustained her business with the help of her loans from NWTF. 

In the future, Charily would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of rice grains

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dogdurkan's Group

texts.en:
Dogdurkan J., 57, is the leader of this group. She is a widow and doesn’t have any financial dependants. She is a resident of a small village, Bokonbaevo, in the Issyk Kul province of Kyrgyzstan. Until 2007 Dogdurkan worked in Telecom: the main communication center of the country. Having retired with honors she now receives a pension of 2,000 soms.

Four years ago, Dogdurkan invested her savings in purchasing goods for her new business of reselling gasoline. She purchases it from suppliers at a good price, gets a license and resells it to local consumers. Dogdurkan is proud of herself.
